description:
Really tasty bagel egg Sando!
Great chai lattes and iced coffees!
Great breakfast/lunch spot in the heart of San Fran
author: SkyeBlu W.

description:
We came here on a Saturday afternoon. The cafe was not very crowded, but the flat White I ordered was probably the worst I have had in a while. The coffee was sour, in spite of the milk. 

Would not recommend coming here.
author: Vidya S.

description:
So now I am really confused.  I was back in town for an annual conference and staying a block away.  I don't mind the hike up the hill.  I made a mistake though.  From Yelp, it appeared the place didn't open until 8 but I think it really opened at 7 so I wish I had come earlier than I did.  Second mistake, I think this business- well it has definitely expanded taking over a second shopfront when it used to be just half the size but I think perhaps the success of the business either led to it being sold or under different management.  I did not see the Asian husband/wife team from before and instead of owners, it seemed to be employed staff.  Nothing wrong with that, just a majorly different and unexpected vibe.

So the reason I came back was that although I am a huge fan of the breakfast sando, I really wanted to try the toast cup which I never had before.  I didn't even look for it on the menu or do a quick visual scan so it was quite a surprise when I returned to my room, and spilled my cappucino to find that it was tiny.  The toast part of it was different as well.  In past visits, I remember seeing them roll out a slice of actual sandwich bread for the toast and I'm not sure but thought it was two eggs with the bacon.  This toast was still good but not the sandwich bread and it was only one egg.  I finished it in two bites and was left wanting more.  

This whole visit was a bit of a bust.  If you've never been before, I would still strongly recommend it to try but if you've been before, you too may be in for a surprise.
author: Maria K.

description:
Eating better and traveling feels like an oxymoron. Especially when you're staying in a touristy party of town and looking for breakfast.

Just the walk to Beanstalk made me feel like I was being healthy; walking up the hill got me a little sweaty. It's a small, but cute place. Tables during the morning rush are designated eating only, so if you're looking for a place to work at peak time, this isn't it.

I went with the veggie sandwich minus the mushrooms and mayo, which was really good. Plenty of veggies to make me feel like I was making good choices and plenty of flavor to enjoy doing it.

If you're in the Union Square area and are looking for some real food options in a casual or carryout setting, this is a great choice.
author: Mary T.

description: I was so excited to try the cragel since croissant everything is the new craze (thank you Dominque Amsel w the cronut). But I had the bacon egg cragel and it was so gross and dry. Also $8 for a breakfast sandwich? Don't waste your money or calories here!
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Cute spot a few mins away from the intercontinental and Fairmont! 
Owner is very attentive and was really kind about helping me find a spot outside for my pup. 
They serve a variety of tea, coffee and food. Looks like a great place to study or hang out for a while, watching cars go by in Nob Hill.
author: Pavknee M.

description:
The Beanstalk was near our hotel and I popped down the hill to grab some breakfast to take back to the hotel. The pre-baked egg cups (pictured) looked great on Yelp but it took waay to long for them to reheat and by the time I walked 3 blocks they were not warm anymore. Plus the egg was solid and the bread was like a crouton... Not what I was expecting.

The next day we gave them a second try and it was equally underwhelming. The service was epically slow and they left the bacon off of my Cragel. I asked for it on the side but finished my Cragel before they even gave me an update, so we left.
author: Adrienne S.

description:
I came here with a friend on Saturday morning for our weekend caffeine fix. It's a cozy little coffee shop with a handful of small tables. 

The menu has your typical drip and pour over coffees, espressos, lattes and tea. I got the pour over Colombia coffee which was pretty decent but nothing special.

The real reason to come here are the cragel sandos. Cragels may just be another way of throwing a croissant at another breakfast item (remember the cronut?), but it's actually pretty good. The best way to describe it is a flakey, buttery bagel. If croissants are just too decadent for you, the cragel is for you! I got the bacon cragel sando, which took some time to make. The prices are a little high for what is basically a bagel sandwich but we're not at avocado toast territory just yet!

Overall, this is a cozy and hip little coffee shop that is worth trying for their food. Will definitely be back for some of their sandwiches.
author: Damon L.

description:
Updated review after the sexist and victim shaming comments from the company, welcome to 45's new America.

In short: $15 for a latte and sandwich--never again. 

The latte was wrong and the cashier insisted I ordered a regular latte? I ordered a regular vanilla latte. I gave up, took it, tasted how bitter it was and drank water after requesting a water cup to the 3rd time. 
Oh and I asked for a water cup while waiting for my sandwich, they kept motioning and insisting it was there on an empty tray. I asked if I should cup my hands?
The sandwich, literally as pictured: bread, cheese, lettuce, egg and bacon. No flavor whatsoever. I'm really disappointed that I walked a 1/4 of a mile out of the way for this place.
WHAT A LET DOWN!
author: Jon O.

description:
The coffee was alright. My biggest issue was that they wanted to charge me .50 for almond milk as a creamer in my pour over. I have never had any other cafe charge for almond milk as a substitute for cream. Not even Starbucks does this! If I was offering an almond milk latte I would understand...

However, when I ordered my drink and asked for almond milk it never was written down. When my drink came out I asked where my almond milk was and the lady told me there was none. Then she told me I had to pay .50 for it. I was confused and told her I asked for almond milk and was not charged. She proceeded to give my my almond milk but in a very strange way. 

My cousin had ordered almond milk too with her americano. The milk came out in a mini milk pitcher- normal. But the barista pointed at my cousin's pitcher on the table and motioned for her to give it back. To clarify what she wanted, I asked her if she wanted my cousin's used pitcher to put my milk in. She nodded yes and kept motioning with her fingers to give it to her. 

Um. Okay? If that was not my cousin- ewwwwww! At that point I just wanted to leave so I gave her the used, still partially full mini pitcher which she poured some more almond milk into. 

At least they gave me the almond milk free of charge, but talk about a bizarre experience all around.
author: Madison B.

description:
Super cute and super small cafe located within walking distance (*up a huge hill*) from Union Square.

I got the Matcha Latte & an everything bagel w/cream cheese. The latte was delicious and decorated with cute latte art of... a Christmas tree? Still cute though!

I wanted to try the cragel, but they had a sign up that said "out of cragels" ... the sign was taken down as soon as I got my bagel :(

My sister and I were able to snag a seat, but it's really small, so I wouldn't recommend coming with a large group.

The employees here were really nice :)

I'll be back!
author: Tia O.

description:
My boyfriend found this place on Yelp and we decided to try it out. I'm so glad we did! Very cute atmosphere in a quaint neighborhood. Hipster and cozy vibe at the same time, with amazing food. 

My boyfriend ordered a cragel sandwich (a croissant shaped like a bagel w a similar texture to a bagel and croissant outside). It was a cute idea and Beanstalk executed the cragel perfectly. Wouldn't be surprised if cragels are the latest and greatest thing in the food world! However, my boyfriend asked for no eggs and sausage and instead got eggs and bacon. But, the eggs were nice and fluffy on the breakfast sandwich, so we were surprised by that and i'm sure they would've fixed it had we asked. Service was a little slow for bagel sandwiches, but it was worth the wait. Coffee was good too and my boyfriend enjoyed his Mint Mojito Coffee. 

Atmosphere is very cute and I would recommend this coffee shop to anyone in the area!
author: Katie R.

description:
So, today was the first time I've tried the cragel (combination of a croissant and a bagel). My friend and I decided to each get a cragel Sandro. She got one with bacon, egg, and cheese. I ordered the sausage, egg, and cheese. And we each traded half. It was yummy and their coffee is delish too. 

My only issue is space. It's very difficult to eat in there. Some ppl just sit and do work... during busy hours, I would love to see (in a place like this) that they turn their internet off so that ppl can enjoy their food in the establishment and turning the internet off helps during busy times.
author: Danielle S.

description: Great coffee and I love their Pastrami sandwiches BUT my recent visit was rather disappointing. The "new" cashier girl (I assume she's new as I've never seen her before) was very unwelcoming and didn't even say hello or thank you when I placed my order. She looked at me like "ugh well here you are another stupid customer". Didn't give a single smile either. I didn't add tips to my transaction. I think you tip only when you're happy with the service and I wasn't. Not for $16 coffee and sandwich combo. People at McDonalds smile and welcome you even though you leave there like what $5 for breakfast? At prices like this, mind your customer service
author: Elaine C.

description:
This morning - 24 dollars for 3 bagels and 2 coffee

And the bagels were clearly at least a day old!! So hard 

And they wouldn't allow a splash of soy milk for coffee - stating they had to charge for this. 

Nickel and dimed. And old food? Won't return.
author: Gernaut A.

description:
I don't know why I haven't tried this place before but we were looking for a place to eat before we went to the color factory and this popped up on the app.

Walked into a small cafe with just a few tables that were all occupied. 

Tried both:
Bulgogi sandwich
Egg breakfast sandwich ?

Both were packed ...packed sandwiches ( hard to hold together) which doesn't necessarily mean a good sandwich but these were very delicious. The bulgogi had an unexpected "kick" to it as well. 

Service was friendly as well.
author: Rod M.

description:
The toast cup is cute but not easy to eat and the cragel sandwiches are pretty good but not worth the long wait... it's good to try.
Value 3/5
Atmosphere 3/5
Service 3/5
Quality 3/5
12/20
author: Nina S.

description: I ordered tuna salad on a plain bagel. Not usually my style- I usually go for sausage egg and cheese, but this was the perfect late brunch sandwich. Left me without feeling greasy or too full, but satisfied enough where I didn't need to snack until my next meal.
author: Riiz K.

description:
Cute little place for good coffee and small bites. 

We tried the Cragel (bagel/croissant) sandwich for the first time.  Very delicious. It has the chewiness of a bagel and the buttery flakiness of a croissant. This particular sandwich came with egg, bacon and cheese. The bacon was cooked to a perfect crisp and the eggs were freshly cooked and folded nicely into the sandwich. 

The Grilled Pesto Cheese sandwich was also a unique and delicious eats. 

The sandwiches are made fresh to order so it may take a bit longer but definitely worth the wait. 


Happy Eating!!
author: Toan D.

description:
We had eggs sandwiches and picked up a roast beef sandwich for our plane ride home.   Not inexpensive, but worth the price of admission.   Their bread is delicious and their sandwiches are a bit different.   Only gripe is coffee was bland and they did not do refills which for their prices would be a nice gesture.....

Not a lot of seats so, if u must eat in and there is a wait, you do have to make a decision....
author: Joel S.

description: Casual and bright little cafe! The food was okay but the coffee was great and overall a solid choice to hang out, grab a bite, chit chat or read a book.
author: Victoria C.

description: The bacon egg and cheese cragel was delicious. Very friendly staff. Bulgogi sandwich is also a must try item
author: Brock M.

description: One word: CRAGEL! Being from Miami, we had never even heard of a cragel - but this is for sure the thing to order. The sausage, egg and cheddar cheese is the way to go! Also, be sure to order the chai tea latte - you will not be disappointed!
author: Elyse G.

description:
Cragel is a must-try, but I would get it straight up as a carb instead of a sandwich next time. Bacon was very fatty and the cragel seemingly fell apart after being cut. Being from the NY area, I have a high standard for bagels, and this flaky crunchy croissant combo was awesome. Great mocha, too. 

Note: if you're getting takeout for a few people, BYO bag. I was not given one for my two sandwiches and coffee and made for a funny walk home.
author: Justine C.

description:
I wish I had tried some of the more unique items on the menu, but I went for the standard sausage, egg, and cheese on a plain bagel, as well as the daily brewed coffee.

The sandwich was fine. Pretty par for the course in terms of what you would expect from a coffee shop. The bagel was dry / hard, but the sausage was tasty, and the egg was nice (and a generously thick portion of egg). Oddly, everything bagels are 75 cents more...

The coffee was burned - both the beans the temperature. It was so hot and filled to the brim, it spilled on my hand, and now I have two small burn blisters...hence the three stars. 30 minutes later, it has cooled down enough to drink, and it tastes just okay. 

I kind of think I could have had the same level of taste (drink and food) at a chain cafe.
author: Katherine N.

description: I'll start by saying that my bacon, egg, and cheese bagel sandwich and iced americano were a great way to start the morning. But, the bacon, egg, and cheese cragel and mojito iced coffee I wanted would have been the perfect way to start the morning. Unfortunately, they were out of cragels AND out of mint -- very disappointing! Cute little spot with yummy food, but be warned they may not have all ingredients -- even at 9 in the morning.
author: Morgan H.

description: Cragel breakfast sando is a must... plus they have good coffee with pour over options and full service barista.  Limited seating, so not a spot to post up, u less you plan to eat (tables reserved for food orders only between 9AM - 12AM.
author: Skyler S.

description: An amazing hidden gem in the heart of San Francisco, the atmosphere is welcoming and serene. Walk in order a latte and sit down,  enjoy the sounds of house music playing in the background and the sent of fresh yellow roses on the counter tops. Along with friendly made house coffee and espresso shots. My matcha latte was the perfect start to my morning and my cragel sealed the deal . The barista is beyond friendly along with the cashiers . I can't say it again Sit down and relax enjoy this beauty . Before or after after a busy morning . Enjoy  lunch before walking the town. Thank you for making this So Cal Girl feel welcomed .
author: Ashley J.

description:
FINAL UPDATE: Since the business owner insists on slandering me, I want to show proof that I was actually going from place to place to work AND making purchases. Attached you can find 4 photos of the places I went along with the drinks I ordered. To the business order, sometimes things appear one way when they're actually the other. Stop making assumptions, especially when they might be influenced by your own biases. I was not trying to leech, I was literally just full from the two bobas I'd had before and the burrito I had at Tacorea. Sigh. 

UPDATED REVIEW: after the business owner replied, I'm updating this. Even if it was 45 minutes, this response is actually disgusting. Adding the screenshots in case they try to change them since they're clearly so messed up with this unprofessional response. Want to also note I was in town for an interview with a large tech company that's paying for all my expenses. Money was not exactly sparse in this instance? And in New York, the city that's supposedly ruder, it's fairly common practice to sit for a while and order when you want/need. Guess the same courtesy doesn't apply here? 

OLD REVIEW: 

The staff was SO rude. I was in town for a day and stopped by while I was traveling around SF. I was hopping from one coffee/boba shop to another and was pretty full so I was waiting a bit until I ordered and sat down. (You can even see that I had checked in at several places beforehand on yelp) 

One of the staff who was also sitting (not even behind the counter) went to me and asked if I was using the WiFi, which I wasn't - I was using my personal hotspot because I knew better than to ask if I could have the password if I hadn't ordered yet? She said i shouldn't be using the WiFi, which again, I was NOT. So she starts to grill me about ordering something in a super rude tone. I tried to explain that what was going on, but of course she wasn't having it so I told her I'd leave.  

I pulled out yelp both because I was looking for another place to go and also because she kept hassling me so I was going to comment on how rude she was. This is when she actually started to lose her shit. She started yelling at me about going on yelp. Literally yelling at me, so I got up immediately and called a lyft to leave. As I'm leaving, she's still yelling at me.

I'm waiting outside and she comes outside with HER PHONE to take pictures of me. Unbelievable! Which is why I took a picture back - how on earth did this woman think this was okay?? 

She starts yelling at me more as I'm taking pictures back of course, and then of course it turns into a yelling match between the two of us. Unbelievable! I've never had a staff or even worse, a business owner, be this blatantly rude to me. 

Honestly would not be surprised if she saw an Afro-Latina woman and got suspicious because I really don't understand how my presence was so upsetting? The place was mostly empty.
author: Lesley C.

description:
On the search for an Americano after arriving in SF I found that this establishment was just two blocks down Nobb Hill from my hotel. Upon arriving I was greeted by a pleasant employee and my coffee was dispatched within minutes.  It was just right and hit the spot. 

The location appeared to be a locals hangout with many people being acknowledged by first name. People working while enjoying coffee seemed to be the norm. 

On a side note they also offer many Korean dishes and the employees were also Korean so this may be  a hiding jewel to get my Korean fix at very soon. 

Enjoy!
author: Lora G.

description:
Great cafe to grab some coffee and some food. It's also ideal for working and using your laptop. They also have free wifi.
The staff is very friendly. 
It's also well located in a nice area of SF
author: Dima R.

description:
Cruffin cragel what? Those croissants really be getting around the block... we tried the cragel (croissant bagel) hybrid here. Yes, you get the flakiness and buttery flavor from the croissant, and the denseness and shape from the bagel chromosome.  It's $3.95 with cream cheese, but we got it just plain. 

I liked the flavor of the iced coffee here (roasted and not too bitter), but husband's Americano was just so so. A small is just 8oz. 

Small cafe. It's rather warm in the side area next to the bathroom. Also, they open relatively late for a coffee shop, 8am.
author: Tricia D.

description: Nice present place very good coffee and perfect banana cake, the best tuna sandwich I eat, nice and clean. We visit 2 times we love it :)
author: Hagar O.

description: Great coffee and lovely breakfast sandwich! It was my first time having a cragel (croissant and bagel in one) and I'll say it lends itself to a sandwich better than either a bagel or a croissant! Very fresh, great service, and can tell everything was made with love!
author: Irina G.

description: Fantastic little cafe, good breakfast sandwich and the mocha was perfect! Will be back for sure. Service was nice and plenty of seating for a Wednesday morning pit stop
author: David G.

description: Made it to the top of the beanstalk for a milk tea and cragel. Milk tea of chai and almond milk was light and comforting on a cold day.  Wish my cragel was less burnt, but it was tasty like a jacked up Egg McMuffin.  The bulgogi sandwich was reportedly tasty as well.
author: Peg S.

description:
Ate here because it's across the street from my hotel. I'm glad I tried it. I got the cragel with bacon two mornings in a row. It takes about 10-15 minutes to wait for the food. So if the line is long, you'd have to wait longer. It's a little pricey for me, but it's really good. 

I have a small stomach so I get full from just eating half! I saved the other half to eat as a snack on my trip to Alcatraz. And the next day, I saved the other half to eat on my bike trip to the Golden Gate Bridge.
author: Sameyah M.

description:
I loved the tofu sandwich. Just the perfect amount of spice, nice crunch from the bread and lettuce. That deserved 5 stars.

The espresso was not good that day. Very very bitter. When I asked for a splash of almond or soy milk to cut it, the said I would need to pay. Yet they have dairy milk out on the counter for free. I don't understand. I handed my espresso back to the barista and left because I just couldn't drink it, it was that bad. I should have asked for my money back for that. That is the one star part of my experience.
author: Brooke W.

description:
This is just down the block from Marriott on Sutter St at Union Square.   You have to walk up a steep hill for it, but I say it's worth it and it will help you get your morning grind on.

Cute little store that  matches the cute owner of the store too! 
Ordered the Cragel Sando w/sausage and the egg is so creamy and fluffy and Matcha latte.   

Latte's there comes unsweetened so you'll have to add your own sugar packets, which was a little annoying, but I guess it's for the better of everyone I guess (save their time & we can adjust our sweetness level ourselves.. I put 6 packets of  sugar in that uh... LOL)

I  would def make this my staple and come back again :).  Keep in mind though it's because I really loved the ambiance of this restaurant really homey and hippy.
author: Joyce L.

description:
Where is Jack? Shouldn't Jack be hanging out at Beanstalk Cafe?
Haha, just kidding.  
Beanstalk Cafe is small and cute, slightly hipster-ish. I came here for coffee, it was my first time having Contractband coffee, and wow, it blew my mind. It was out of this world!
They also have fancy contraption to make cold brew coffee, you can literally see the coffee being brewed, drip by drip. 
Next time I come back, I'll be sure to try some food!
Seating inside is very limited, so I would suggest doing take out.
author: Stephanie Q.

description: Stopped here while vacationing in SF and ohh my this place is fire. Delicious food and awesome latte I had. Super friendly staff will return in future to try more delicious sandwiches.
author: Tejinder G.

description:
I've been staying nearby in a hotel and, fortunately, wandered into this cafe while looking for a quick bite to eat. Since doing so, I've stopped by here nearly every morning to pick up a sandwich. The bulgogi sandwich is absolutely delicious. It's served on a hot and wonderfully crusty loaf of ciabatta and is piled full of bulgogi, cucumber, thin slices of tomato, other yummy greens, and topped with a shmear of korean style hot pepper spread. Absolutely amazing. As a self declared foodie, I can be pretty picky with how I like my food to look and taste. All around, I was extremely satisfied. 
The owner and patrons were also very kind and understanding, especially when I brought in my small, hypoallergenic service dog. If you're staying in or are from the San Fran area, I highly recommend dropping by to grab a bite. 
Will not be disappointed 5/5
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Fun little cafe!!
Had an amazing veggie sandwich and a dirty chai latte.. I stumbled upon this place after walking around and needed my fix on a chai latte!! Thank you!!
author: Caramie C.

description:
****READ**** A woman sits down right next to me at a table that is half a foot away from mine WITH A DOG in her arms. I ask her to move because I am allergic to dogs and I am trying to enjoy my meal. She says rudely, "I don't have to move." I ask the employee to tell her to move to another table (all of the tables are empty!), and he would not do it. I AM OUTRAGED that he would not reseat her!!!!! It ruined my meal and I left; I didn't want to chance having a full allergic reaction to the dog.
Do not go here, they don't care at all about the customers!!!!!!!
author: Lon G.

description:
This rating is specifically for the cragle ( croissant + bagel) that I came here for.

Result: try to steer away from the sausage cheese and egg cragel . Sausages are sliced into strips not a sausage pattie and is quite salty yet you don't taste the flavor of the sausage itself.  

The bread itself is good hence they get the 3 stars but everything else in it including the way how they make the egg, cheese and meet are very mediocre.

Portion is big, the cragle is a size of a bagel puffed up, so one is enough to be shared for two.

Latte is ok. Probably gets a 4 stars.
author: Baobei P.

description:
I walked way up hill on mason with my baby and stroller to this place. I was excited to have finally found it! But only to find out that they don't have a high chair. So unfortunately, I had to take my food to go since there was no where for my 8 month old to sit. 

Anyway, now onto the food. I ordered a cragel with egg and cheese. The cragel was a little burnt at the top but it still tasted good. They didn't go cheap on the eggs I had quite a bit on my sandwich and just enough cheese as well. The price was pretty high for a small sandwich, though. I suppose the prices in dt sf are pretty high everywhere. 

I would recommend this place if you don't have a little one with you. Can't comment on the coffee as I did not try it. They have few chairs to sit outside as well
author: Rubab M.

description:
Aside from staff that couldn't fully understand english and a condescending af dude and coffee that sucks (or maybe it was just their ability) the frankenstein sandwich was good! Sad it was not on the bread I asked for. 

I truly wish I had taken other negative reviews to heart before spending/wasting money here.
author: Hailey T.

description: Latte was well made and their Cragel (Croissant Bagel) was surprisingly delicious. The line was out the door when we arrived but moved fairly quickly. The space is a bit tight with only a few tables so not the greatest spot for large groups.
author: Cindy P.

description: That was delicious! Got a cragel with egg, Swiss cheese, and tomato! Drip coffee too. Fast service and super cool vibe!
author: A H.

description:
Came in for a quick bite to eat after the excellent reviews. My love for bagels and croissants have been fulfilled and realized into the cragel. 

We both had a veggie cragel, although I realized after I ordered that it didn't come with cream cheese and was more of a lunch item. Oh well! 

The sandwich was delicious! Lots of veggies, a tiny bit of chilly sauce and even some apple to add a twist of sweetness. I loved how thinly sliced each veggie was! 

The cragel is the perfect blend of both a bagel and a croissant. I would love to try it open faced with some cream cheese and avocado/tomato/onion. 

The restaurant is small but we beat the morning rush and people do leave relatively quickly after their meals. I highly recommend this if you're vegetarian and looking for a yummy quick bite.
author: Mansi S.

description:
I am super bummed out... I was hyped to try this place out. I even tipped about 5 dollars and waited 20 minutes to get the wrong order :(

I ordered 2 breakfast sandwiches and took my order To go cause I was on my way to work an event and when arrived I unwrapped and got the wrong order. I don't eat sausage in breakfast items and there wasn't bacon to just take out. Ended up throwing it away. 

Make sure to check bags before leaving. 
Coffee was good.
author: Stormy B.

description: Woww!! So blown away by Beanstalk Cafe. It's well worth the steep climb up here. We got here at 1:30 pm on a Saturday afternoon while shopping in Union Square. The place is well-lit and has a wide variety of Korean-fusion style sandwiches (many vegetarian options) and coffee. We got the Bulgolgi Beef sandwich and Spicy Pork sandwich. The Spicy pork was better but both were super good. The beef is paired with a provolone (i think) cheese and Spicy Pork was with cheddar - good combos. The bread was perfect and there was fresh veggies like arugula. It seems like a decent place to study as they have free wifi and food and coffee to keep you fueled. The price is not cheap, however, at $10.25 for our sandwiches. The vegetarian options are just as expensive as the meat ones which is surprising. $22 for two sandwiches was kind of a lot but hey it's in the touristy part of the city.
author: Shannon W.

description:
"All sandwiches served hot" It says that on top of the chalkboard menu, but I guess it didn't sink into my feeble brain. Now that made sense for the $4.25 Grilled Cheese and the $9.75 Bul-go-gi Beef Sandwich, but for some reason, I was in the mood for egg salad. You ever have one of those moods...the egg salad mood? Maybe it's a second childhood thing or a subconscious memory of a kind chicken...or maybe you just need a mayo fix. Anyhow I ordered it thinking it would be like the one's I used to get at Lee's Deli where it was overstuffed between two slices of yeasty white bread.

As laptoppers took over most of the tables next to the window, I sat at my lonely table next to the restroom for about ten minutes waiting for a sandwich I thought would take about thirty seconds to make. They don't have Diet Coke...yes, it's one of THOSE kind of places, so I picked up a can of San Pellegrino Limonata, the kind that has the little useless wrapper on top, and of course I had to get chips. Not Lay's mind you but a bag of Deep River Aged Cheddar Horseradish Flavored Kettle Cooked Potato Chips (photo: http://bit.ly/2lH5nEG). That was a mouthful...the name, not the chips so much.

My $9.75 Egg Salad Sandwich finally arrived looking nothing like the lunchroom staple from days of yore. Hard-boiled egg mixed with mayo, yes, but also arugula, lettuce tomato, onion, and cheese. It was all encased in a crusty organic wheat roll, and yes, you guessed it...it was hot. Hot egg salad (photo: http://bit.ly/2llkhzB). All the ingredients seemed right, but hot egg salad seemed so wrong like repealing transgender rights or enforcing Muslim travel bans. Yes, that kind of wrong. But I finished it without complaint at least until now. "All sandwiches served hot". They mean it. No exceptions. Is Lee's Deli still open?

FOOD - 2.5 stars...nice ingredients but hot egg salad isn't right
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...compact, light cafe appears to attract the young and fat-fingered
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...OK, not that friendly
TOTAL - 3 stars...I'm guessing the "real" hot sandwiches are more satisfying, right?
author: Ed U.

description:
Amazing food - everything is made to order with great quality ingredients! 
Great customer service as well. I've asked for a customized sandwich and they were more than happy to make it for me. I've got egg, cheese and mushroom on a cragel and it was sooo good! The mushrooms were perfectly seasoned, and their cragel bread was just "wow" - nicely toasted, flaky and yummy! 
Overall, I think it's the best breakfast sandwich I've had in a long time. I could easily eat it for breakfast, lunch and dinner.
author: Inna B.

description: This place is simply adorable. One woman served us and I imagine she's the owner. She makes fresh sandwiches, espresso and coffee, breakfast and more. She's constantly moving between stations and still manages to serve everyone quickly. Everything was beyond fresh, including freshly cut vegetables and bread for sandwiches. The spot is right near The Dragon Gate entrance to Chinatown and, from the pictures inside, you can see the history of how this small business grew. I love small shops like this that deliver on the perceived promise of intimate encounters and fresh-prepared food. If you are looking for a healthy stop for breakfast or lunch, this place deserves a visit!
author: Chris C.

description: I love  this cafe!! I'm from NYC and it's my second visit to this beautiful cafe today! I really recommend for the tourists and all the neighbors
author: Jaehoon L.

description:
Found this gem using the Yelp app as we were staying in Union Square and wanted a super quick yummy hot sandwich.  Ended up ordering a bacon, egg, and cheese cragel (croissant meets bagel).  It was delish!  

They also serve toast cups before 9:30am that looked really yummy and picture perfect.  

Service was friendly!
author: Nadia K.

description:
Bulgogi Beef sandwich. That's all you need to have.
The best sandwich that we enjoyed 3 out of 4 mornings here. Well marinated tender slices of beef pressed in warm crusty bread from a local baked. There is a spicy red spread (Kimchi?) and topped with fresh crispy, thin sliced cucumbers, arugula and other veges.
My daughter and I dream of this sandwich.

Didn't care for the cold drip brew or "contraband" coffee as everyone calls it.  It was sour and all the cream in the world didn't help it.

My wife enjoyed her cappuccino 2/3 times. It really depends on who makes it and whether the lovely owner is there that day.

The place itself like all SF eateries is small with limited seating. They recently expanded this cozy venue and added a second location. Expect the annoying hipster camping out at tables with their laptops on one cup of coffee while other paying & eating patrons try to scope out a spot to enjoy our breakfast. There really should be a 20 minute minimum.

This is one of our favorite SF spots to hit and you might be lucky enough to grab a Cragel before they run out.
author: Linda S.

description:
Truly a gem! The place was so cute in the sense of a great atmosphere, great workers, great decor. I have been to the honey cafe down the street and this was definitely better. Although they don't have as many options as Honey Cafe this place is more intimate and cheaper! 

I wanted to try the cragel or the toast with the egg but I lucked out on timing. Not to worry though because I will definitely come back again. 

This time around I split an Asiago bagel with bacon, egg, and cheese coupled with a mint mojito. The bagel came out hot and both items did not take a long time to come out. There is the cashier, the barista, and the chef. Great team. 

As for seating there was more than expected! There are people who come and go on their computers, and others who just stop by for breakfast. A few chairs outside, and one large table that can fit 8 on the inside. I came with one other person so the seating was easier. 

Overall great place by Union Square to grab a light breakfast.
author: Kathleen N.

description: Great Customer Service and attentive staff. It is a genuine coffee shop with great environment and such good vibes.
author: Julio S.

description: I have been here a couple of times for coffee.  The price is right, only $2.50 a cup to go.....Cheaper than starbucks, and I am supporting a local business, which I think is great.  The staff is not that warm, but hey, it is only coffee.  This place only a few tables, and the staff thought I was there to use the restroom, which I was denied, and what was funny, is that I never asked to use the facilities.  So, this is why only 3 stars.... Employees, a bit judgmental.
author: Paul G.

description: Great coffee. I got a mocha latte. They use delicious Ghirardelli chocolate. They play great tunes in the background. Service was fast and courteous.
author: Melissa J.

description:
Love, love, LOVE this place! The customer service is above and beyond... mainly because you're usually greeted by the owners, which is great business! They've got tasty Korean fusion sandwiches made with Acme bread, which a big plus. My favorite, though, is their Turkey sandwich. I add extra protein by requesting egg... so freakin' good! For coffee offerings, my choice is their ice'd mocha made with Ghirardelli chocolate... hits the spot after lunch. 

Oh, and thanks for adding another location in the Inner Richmond... you're now close to work AND home! :D
author: D L.

description: What a great little sandwich place! We wanted something portable and smallish no fuss sort of quick breakfast. I had the cragel breakfast sandwich with scrambled egg and bacon. The croissant/bagel is flaky and chewy at the same time! Super yummy if you like croissants and bagels. Never had anything like it before but will be back! The coffee is also very good.
author: Shirley C.

description:
Great spot for a breakfast Sammie. Quick service and super tasty. We split a spicy chicken sandwich which is plenty for two marginally hungry people. It was Korean influenced and tasted kinda like a Vietnamese  Bahn Mi but better. Coffee and Matcha were both very well done too. 

Simple, no frills and  clean establishment.
author: Andy C.

description:
Found this place through yelp and decided to give it a try. First off, parking wasn't too difficult to find, especially for being in such a busy city. We walked in and were greeted by very friendly staff. We ordered our food and sat outside; luckily it was a very nice day! Our food arrived and it not only looked delicious, but tasted even better!! I definitely will be returning and will be adding Beanstalk Cafe to my list of 'favorite food places'. 

PS- I highly recommend the Cragel Sando (both bacon and sausage were delicious). Their iced vanilla almond milk latte is also VERY good. Try it!
author: Nicole S.

description: Yummy coffee and delicious lemon cake. Place is very small and inviting. The lady at the counter was super sweet to my daughter and I. A convenient location when staying at the Westin St. Francis.
author: Michelle I.

description: Cragels are a very cool concept! I don't think I've ever had it before. The mojito cold brew was awesome too! Wasn't super packed in the morning! Very good/nice staff... really enjoyed it overall.
author: Sam P.

description: Spent two work afternoons at Beanstalk.  Twice had minnies veggie, first on a cragel then on a whole wheat bagel with an added egg. Both were very satisfying.  Also had the morning glory loaf.  Yummy too.  Overall, a good experience.  The service was a little awkward because they couldn't get my order right the first time. I believe the owner was there the second time - she's very kind.   But I'll be back when back in San Francisco.  Highly recommended.
author: Rey C.

description:
Nice quaint sandwich shop close to union square. 

We were in the neighborhood and were looking for a quick bite while we wait for a few friends to catch up with us. Found this small sandwich place/coffee house on Yelp and I am glad I did. 

We had the Grilled Pesto Cheese sandwich with Avocado and Egg. It was wonderful and the flavor of the egg and pesto went very well together. It was so yummy that you did not need any condiments with it. The sandwich was tasty and complete in itself. 

We also got the Gluten Free Butter Mochi. It was very tasty and had just the right amount of sweetness and butter flavors together. I really liked the balance in this one. 

I would order both of the things that I had here again. Having said that, I do need to go back to this place to have the toast cup that everyone keeps raving about. But I have to show up before 9:30am for that. All the best to me for that !!.. :)
author: Nipun S.

description:
Come early or be disappointed. Despite several morning visits, I have yet to try the toast cups because they sell out so fast. Even at 10AM, I only barely managed to snag the last cregel! Visiting in the afternoon, this place is a totally different place... and totally deserted. I realize their kitchen is small, but I wish they'd find a way to increase their stock.

The cregel is worth a try- light, flaky croissant dough in the shape of a bagel, with increased density to match. The sandwich holds up well, but you can also get it with plain cheese. Bagels are limited in flavor (and Asiago has a surcharge, and also runs out early in the AM) but fresh and chewy. Coffee and tea drinks here are average, so come in the morning for their standout breakfast items and grab to go.
author: Stefany V.

description: Came for the breakfast cragel sandwich but won't return because of service. Who charges for a splash of soy milk?? This place is on my way to work so I pass by it every day. They missed out on gaining a regular customer but I don't think they are worried. They always seem to be busy with tourists when I walk by. Oh well!
author: Anastasia E.

description: Been coming here every morning from my hotel. The cragel is a must have item. Cold brew is strong and smooth. All of the coffee items delicious. Much better atmosphere and friendlier staff than nearby cafes I have tried. Y'all have a customer until I leave!
author: Randy F.

description:
This place is so cute!! Takes to go orders which is the route we took but I'd definitely come back to sit down and enjoy the atmosphere. 

The Mojito cold brew is delicious and packs a punch!  It had me awake in less than 20 minutes later.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Perfect cuppa chai. Not too sweet just perfect .  I had mine with almond milk .  Fabulous music.  Comfortable seating and the place just has character.  Close to fairmont hotel relatively
author: Amaia S.

description: I love love love this spot. I used to live one block away and would be here almost daily for coffee and food, back when this was a cozy one room space. Amazing sandwiches - turkey cranberry and spicy chicken are my favs. Owners are incredibly friendly - always feel super welcomed. Was able to stop by again recently and check out the renovations - plenty of room to sit down, WiFi and also has a bathroom! Highly recommend if you're in the area and want a legit San Francisco coffee shop experience that isn't a big chain.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Don't go here. They don't care about their customers at all.

I live on the same block as this cafe so I was pretty excited when they moved in. The first few times I went there I experienced some minor issues, like cashier not being friendly and them getting my order wrong. I wanted so badly to like the place that I kept coming back, but today was the last straw.

I ordered a small coffee with room, paid, and then asked where the milk was. The cashier reached below the counter for milk as I said, "I'm lactose intolerant, what are your non-dairy options?" 
He responded that non-dairy is 25 cents extra. I didn't have any cash, they couldn't charge me for such a small amount (1$ minimum on charges) and refused to give me a splash of something non-dairy for free.

I can forgive a lot of things but this kind of bs, especially since I go there quite often and tip every time, is just ridiculous. You guys have lost a  customer and I'm sure I'm not the first or last.
author: Michelle W.

description: Not bad, but not as good as I was expecting. What I was impressed with was the hot almond milk tea. Never have I had hot milk tea before so that was authentic, and really good actually. I ordered the bacon, egg and cheese in an Asiago bagel and I wasn't impressed because I've had better before. It lacked flavor. I loved the aura and there was plenty of seating space when I went.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Came here right before heading to the color factory and both my friend and I were really happy we stopped by here for a quick breakfast! 

First off, the place is pretty small but there was actually a lot of seats. We came around 10AM on a Friday so it was kind of busy and all the seats were taken, but there was two seats on the big table near the window, and the owner (at least we thought she was the owner) politely asked this man to scoot over so that we would be able to sit down and enjoy our breakfast. Legit, so sweet of her! The other employees were also very sweet and joyful to all the customers so that's a plus! 

My friend and I were so excited to try the toast cups but missed it by 30 min, so we settled for a bagel sandwich with egg, bacon, and cheese and we split a mint mojito just because we were in a rush. Both the sandwich and drink came out fast and were good! The bagel was warm and toasted but not too toasted that it hardened really fast. Also the eggs were super fluffy. Such a good sandwich. The mint mojito was pretty good after I added a little more milk into it. It wasn't a Philz coffee mint mojito but it was good! 

Would definitely come back to this place and hopefully come early enough for the toast cup!
author: Erin G.

description:
Solid place for a light breakfast: friendly and efficient service, a very clean environment, and some excellent tunes emanating from the speakers. As for the chow, I had a plain bagel. Next time I'll ask for cream cheese on the side, as they smear it on immediately out of the toaster, and that alters the consistency of the cheese. Wife had a cragel breakfast sammie which was okay, but it was heavy on the cheddar and the bacon was a bit undercooked . . . 

Cheers!
RS
author: Rich S.

description:
A gem in San Francisco. 
- Drinks and food are great and simple
- Everything is fairly priced
- Interior feels homey and comfortable
- Small place about 20 seating capacity
- Big windows for great natural lights
- Clean bathroom
- Friendly staff
- Plays old jazz/swing music loud enough for you to enjoy. Not too loud if you need to focus on whatever you're doing
author: Vu D.

description:
Bagel mates with a croissant and made a cregel :) 
Enjoy immediately while warm with an americano!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Yes yes yes! I absolutely loved this little cafe! My boyfriend and I were staying right down the street at the Executive Vintage Hotel and decided to hit this place up before heading out for some site seeing. 

We decided to share the cragel with cream cheese. I love bagels and I love croissants so naturally this was a match made in heaven. The portion size was huge so perfect for us to share and it was toasted just right. For a drink I went with a caramel latte. It was a little bit sweeter then I'm used to but overall very tasty. 

I highly recommend passing up Starbucks and giving this place a shot. Now if only I could get a location closer to me.
author: Erika N.

description:
Had a bagel sandi with avocado extra and an americano. This is the best breakfast.
I love beanstalk and I am so happy about their expansion! Last time we sat outside and it was worth the coffee - so good.
author: Rebecca R.

description: So understated that we couldn't find the store sign. ... Siri said we passed it and we backtracked.  2 young guys ran the place pretty efficiently.  Veggie bagel sandwich for $7 .. cragel which is a croissant / bagel merger that works well for the sandwiches.   The ingredients are all fresh and simply put together and taste good.  But the best thing were the drinks...  iced mocha was brilliant.  Made perfectly.
author: Gina G.

description:
Such a cute place!!

I came here Thanksgiving morning for a latte and a small nosh as I was visiting from out of town. The latte was killer and the breakfast sandwich was great! Great place to sit and watch people too! Wish they were in my home town!
author: Carly S.

description: Cragel breakfast sandwich is very good. Perfectly different. Friendly staff and street seating. Highly recommend.
author: Sean P.

description:
I had high expectations for the cragel. The pictures looked mouthwatering, and croissants and bagels are some of my favorite foods, but I am also incredibly picky about both of them. I received my cragel with cream cheese and it was pretty dry and the bottom was burnt in the toaster. That's normally not a problem, but the bread just didn't taste very fresh. Perhaps I got a bad batch, but I came around 8am and thought they would be fresh if I got there so early. I couldn't taste the buttery flakiness of a croissant or the chewiness of a bagel. It was just kind of stale, and the cream cheese tasted like the cheap kind you pick up from a grocery store. 

All that being said, the cafe's atmosphere was lovely and I would have loved to spend the morning there if I had more time. Plenty of light and tables, and plenty of other food options to choose from next time. I would still give this place another shot, but am just really sad that the cragel didn't live up to expectations!
author: Nancy W.

description:
Great coffee. 

Only ever tried their Egg Salad Sandwich, and should've ordered it with extra cucumbers and NO extra mayo. Was a bit too goopy, but would definitely get it again. Got the cravingggg.
author: Tiba G.

description:
[Out-of-Towner Review]

When you need something to bright you up after a lackluster meal!

We had originally planned to stop here, but realized it was super small and didn't have a huge breakfast menu. Stupidly, we went with Roxanne's Cafe down the street, but made our way back here after anyways. 

That being said, I am not seeing I missed out on trying a Cragel! I'm intrigued...

The just okay coffee we had a breakfast left me wanting a treat. Coffee in SF is usually generally a good idea, so we walked the block to Beanstalk so I could get myself my usual weekend caffeinated treat - a soy mocha!

BC was lightly crowded. Each chair inside was full and there was a very short line, which we obliged by waiting in. Their offerings looked (and smelled) delicious. I still went with my tried and true and ordered a soy mocha and Lil followed suit.

I love my drink! It wasn't too sweet (like Sbux tends to be), it was just the right amount of mocha to soy ratio. It was cool to see the Barista pour the steamed milk into the cups as the finishing touch, sadly no cool design ;) I kid, I don't care if they do mocha art on my drink, for goodness sakes its for drinking! If you're like Lil and like the sweeter stuff, this might not be the drink for you or ask for more syrup in your drink.

I loved the quaint atmosphere and appreciated that they sold quality beverages. If we're ever in this area again, we will stop by. There was nothing spectacular about the staff, but they seemed cordial and made a good drink -- nothing to fault there!

Mocha for dessert, by chance!
author: Steph G.

description:
Area / Atmosphere:  This place was very simple and clean. I believe the owner had some remodeling done, he had pictures of his place before and after the construction which was a nice touch. Everyone here was so nice and friendly. They had jazz music when we went. It wasn't too loud either, YAY! Although it was a small spot that could probably sit only 18-22 people it was lovely. Very chic/vintage decor.

Food / Drink: We had the toast cup. Which I thought was very simple but yummy in my tummy (as seen on pic). Egg, bacon, and a crunchy pastry wrapped around it to keep everything together. We had the black tea I believe. I do recommend for you to get there early if you want to try the toast cup. We got there around 10:30AM and got the last two.

Recommend it? / Price: I would recommend it! Everywhere i looked I saw delicious food. Cant wait to visit SF again to try other food from this spot. This place was a bit pricey. Only because the little toast cups were about 5$ each.
author: Cindy R.

description: Nate wanted breakfast and Chad was yit d and I was like ya ok so we came here I got express coffeee and a sandwich great food some tables had signs on them about rush out between 9 and 13 why does the city wake up so late this is weird most people  wake up and had coffee by 9 why is rush our at 9?
author: Heywood J.

description:
Very good breve flat white.
Not bitter nor tarry.
Crema not quite as good as the best.
author: Jason C.

description: The cragel  (a mix of croissant and bagel) is very flavorful! I ordered one with sausage, egg and cheese and I would eat it again. Maybe because it was Sunday, the service was slow, but overall I enjoyed the place.
author: Cristina M.

description: Are you kidding me with this place?  First off, franchise one of these to Cincinnati ASAP!  The food was absolutely outstanding from beginning, my Cafe Au lait was prepared to perfection.  We sat to wait in this crazy busy space but had fresh salsa waiting for us which was a HUGE surprise just because it was breakfast but even more so because it was GREAT!  We moved on to a simply egg dish, fresh bacon, and potatoes.  My bride got some of the best French Toast we've had in a long time!  The food was all delicious!  Like I said...Bring one to the Nati!!!
author: Timothy D.

description:
addicted

pls send a cragel to ohio 

/hint: get there early or musicians early (after 11) like me ... they may sell out of things if you aren't the early bird tho ‍
author: Brit F.

description:
This place is a small but cute gem. I like the aesthetics of the coffee shop, and there are several places to sit and work. Many people come in and out because it is near Union Square, but it isn't too disturbing. The coffee is delicious - I usually go for just an americano or espresso, no milk necessary for their beans! 

The one downside is that their music is really obnoxious, constant top 40 of the worst pop songs around, and some of the songs were repeated over and over. Literally I had ear plugs in because the music was so horrible. 

Music aside, it's always a decent experience when it comes to their food/drinks. I'd recommend, especially if you are looking for something on the go.
author: Michelle N.

description:
An amazing coffee shop and cafe.  We came here each day of our trip!  The drip coffee is delicious, and so is the macha green tea latte.  However, the real stars of the show are the sandwiches.  We had the turkey and cranberry sandwich and the breakfast sandwich on the cragel.  It's hard to say which one was the best.  They both had such quality ingredients.  The prices were also very fair.  

Would be a regular customer if I lived nearby.  It's definitely worth a try.
author: Noah A.

description:
Breakfast toast cups here are top notch! Some items on the menu are a little pricey, but you can expect to get something good! 

Mocha was pretty good too. I've also heard good things about the iced coffee--particularly the mint mojito--so I'll have to try that next time.
author: Vasiliy M.

description: I'm so happy with this place. The cragle breakfast sandwiches are fantastic. They say a 10 min for a sandwich and it's worth it. Get a coffee and enjoy the atmosphere while you wait. I did the daily drip coffee which was nice and strong. This is going to be our morning routine while in SF.
author: Ben C.

description: Good, but not spectacular. I went twice during my last SF visit due to yelp reviews. No Cragel available either day (and I went at 7:00 a.m. the next day when their doors opened -and it was listed as a special). The toast cup was okay - too crisp and egg too raw. I had read it was small - it's small. The next day I got the bagel sandwich (as there was no cragel, although they let me order it). It was good. Coffee is good.
author: Lisa B.

description:
I came here after work on a Tuesday afternoon. I was scared that since it wasn't morning, they wouldn't be serving cragels anymore. To my surprise, they were still serving cragels! I ordered the Cragel with cream cheese and it was really filling!! The only thing was that it was a little tough but it was definitely super unique. 

It was worth the walk up the steep hill! The cafe is really small with only 1 small table and a couple bar stools, so I don't think coming here with groups of people would be very effective. This place is definitely a grab and go cafe.
author: Catherine S.

description: Bomb.com such good coffee& breakfast sandwich was big enough to share! Def will be back!!
author: K K.

description: I had the Bush Street morning sandwich.  Texture in the bread, freshness in the veggies and taste in the eggs and bacon. Wonderful.  Their Chai latte had the right amount of kick in it, perfect temperature and they offer it with almond milk which is awesome.  Their pesto is made there.  It has a fully developed buttery flavor which goes hand in hand with the crisp of their vegetables.
author: Felipe M.

description:
A cute coffee shop in Tender-Nob. I had their cappuccino. It was ok. The milk was a bit too hot so it ended up on the wet side unintentional.

There were only a few seats but most people seem to get their coffees to go. There is also a bench in front. On a good day you can sit there to enjoy the precious sunshine in between downtown high rises.
author: Joseph L.

description: It's really good. I had an egg sausage cragel which is really delicious and fresh. Staff is friendly. I went there during off peak time but still it is very busy. Place is nice, clean and comfortable.
author: Karen C.

description:
Love this place! It has the cutest blue/glass exterior that's hard to miss. The inside has high ceilings, comfortable seating, and (I think) 6 tables. 

Food takes ~10 minutes to come out, but when it does - it's hot and melty and goooooey goodness. I got the bacon cragel sando which was a delicious melty mess of cheese, bacon, fluffy eggs, and flaky croissant. 

Such an adorable, quaint spot that I know I'll come back to
author: Shelley K.

description: I tried the bacon, egg and cheese cragel sandwich and I've been thinking about it for 24 hours.  It was awesome!
author: Leigh H.

description:
17.07.12.    1st dropin

Place ........ 5 Stars
Food ..........4 Stars
Seevice ..... 4.25

Nice new place for coffee.
Used to be Village Cafe.

New short opening hours for now.
Closes early for now.
The people working could give me a 
   Definite store name ...
   Beanstalk Cafe or
   Beanstalk Inner Richmond

They do carry breakfast in a bread cup ...
   like their 1st first shop ... Beanstalk Cafe
   on Bush St.
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Food - 2
Service - 3 
Interior layout - 2

Average sandwich. It hurts my heart to see them label 2 tbsp of flavorless chicken on bread as a Korean Spicy Chicken sandwich. Cheddar drowns out any hint of gochujang flavor. 

Cashier suggested we order something other than the Bulgogi beef sandwich because it was cooking and would take 15-20 min to be ready, then said our non-Bulgogi order would take 10-15 min (why suggest something else then??) 

No blinds on high windows means that sun shines blindingly onto all tables with nothing to shield your eyes.
author: Connie K.

description:
I stopped by on a Sunday afternoon for a light brunch and thought it was a cute place. There was a short line, and I ordered an egg & sausage cragel sandwich and a cappuccino when I got to the front. I was told that there would be a 10-15 minute wait for my food, which was fine.

Note: The cragel is just a croissant shaped like a bagel. Essentially you're just getting a warm croissant sandwich, but the shape actually holds the sandwich together a lot better.

I got my cappuccino about 5-10 minutes after ordering. It was bitter, and overall just meh. I would get my coffee somewhere else next time. The big down side is that they only had one person making the sandwiches, despite it being pretty busy, and it wasn't until around 25 minutes later that we got our food. Much later than I was originally told. It seems like they could use some improvement in their setup to be more efficient in making the food.

The cragel itself was crispy on the outside and worth trying. The filling ratio was mostly egg, so I couldn't really taste the cheese or the sausage as much. A little more cheese or sausage would've been nice, though I love eggs, so I didn't mind too much. Overall, the sandwich was tasty, but nothing amazing.

Expected a little more from such a high overall rating, but not bad.
author: Sara L.

description: This cafe was a super cute stop in our day. The line, unfortunately, was quite long, and we had come here to avoid a different line. It wasn't a big issue, and the line quickly moved. It seemed like there was some sort of problem with the cafe yesterday (when I went), though, as the employees seemed dazed and confused, and the poor (what seemed to be) owner at the cashier was trying to tell them all what to do and how to do it after an order messup that spiraled into a snowball effect for other orders. I felt truly bad for the manager, as she had to direct all of her employees and looked tired. Because of this it was a bit of a longer wait. When she asked us for our order, though, she was very sweet and made sure everything was in order. We sat down and waited for our order. The employees were again a bit confused when looking for us to give us our order, but the manager did make sure that we got our food. We ordered three cragels (croissant + bagel) with cream cheese, two coffees, and a hot chocolate. The cragels were absolutely delicious and were the perfect blend of the two different breads. The hot chocolate was equally great, and the coffee, I was told, was good as well. Overall, it's a great cafe if you have some time to stop by, but not if you want the quickest service or have somewhere to be and need a quick bite.
author: Nicole C.

description: Staying at the hotel around the corner and walked to this place in the am even though it was out of the way from my work cause I had to try this breakfast cup!! So glad I did because I'll be going back every morning now that I'm here for a week and the food/prices were so good!!! Got an almond milk latte, and their large was pretty small but I didn't need a lot so I was totally okay with that! Breakfast cup with bacon and two eggs was amazing quick light breakfast. Wish they had a veggie option tho since I don't really eat meat I picked around the bacon. Crispy pastry shell was amazing!!! Great staff. Cute decor. Indoor seating. It's got it all. Want to try the breakfast sandwich next when I'm in the mood for a bit more food!
author: Allison B.

description:
Sold. 

And I didn't even have their signature egg cup. 

I'm not a big breakfast person. Period. A good cup of coffee and a small bit of something will generally have me good until the afternoon. 

The man and I were weary from the evening prior where we partied on $15 cocktails and $80 bowls from Rickhouse. 

Translation: we were dead broke. Yet still hungry. 

Our adorable little Inn served "breakfast" but it pretty much consisted of stale bagels and OJ. For the starving and desperate, it would do. But for the Yelper in me, I needed to explore... but on a budget. 

Our destination was Union Square. We just had to check out the Christmas tree, ice skating, and other Holiday decor. I found Beanstalk Cafe was just a quick block and away - perfect!

Beanstalk Cafe is everything you want in a neighborhood coffee shop. Bright, cheery, and friendly - with delicious coffee and treats. 

It was too late in the day for their egg cup (sad day!) but their breakfast sandwiches were still an option. These suckers were worth the 9.25 price tag. Large, freshly made, and bread that was seriously swoon-worthy; it was filling for pretty much the entire day. Add in a two latte's, and our breakfast was under $30. Not necessarily cheap, but for SF standards it's a steal. 

I wouldn't hesitate to return, if not for that elusive egg cup creation!
author: McKenzie S.

description:
Cute little cafe on Bush Street. 

They are creative with their menu - toasted cups and cragels for example. Food prep time is especially fast. 

I wouldn't go so far as a must visit due to its busy nature and overall taste of food. I spent last evening craving these toasted cups that people have been going on about so I finally decided to drop by. The toasted cup did not disappoint on presentation and creativity. The cup itself tasted only so - so though. I believe the staff warmed it up a bit but they don't seem particularly fresh (they seem to be just sitting on the counter and warmed up). The skin was tough and the fillings were just room temp. 

I Would return and try something else or just enjoy their coffee. 

Speed and service - 5
Drink quality - 5
Food quality - 3.5 
Food and drink creativity - 5
Price - economical
author: Sammy H.

description:
The cragel isn't necessarily a revolutionary breakfast food, but Beanstalk does it particularly well. This small cafe is situated on the border of San Francisco's Nob Hill section, close to Union Square. It's usually very busy, and consequently, difficult to secure a table, so it's better to arrive earlier on the weekends if you plan to stay and eat. If I had to guess, I'd say that the entire establishment could only accommodate between fifteen and twenty customers at a single time.

Most people seem to substitute cragels for bagels (which they also offer) to form breakfast sandwiches, but the cragels are great on their own as well. Buttery and flaky, their texture on the outside emulates that of croissants. The inside, slightly denser, matches the consistency of bagels, and is even a bit chewy.

As for the coffee, it's sourced from Contraband, a well-known neighborhood spot located just a short distance away. Because of their arrangement, this cafe is a rare gem, offering both a good cup of coffee and a solid sandwich or pastry. Unfortunately, this also means that they run out of certain items fairly quickly. There's a reason Beanstalk Cafe is so popular, so make sure you check it out if you're in the area!
author: Daniela L.

description: We loved having a quick breakfast bite here upon arriving to San Francisco. We jumped off the cable car on Bush and easily found it. Place is casual, but cute. Drip coffee was strong & bagels were good :)
author: Melissa J.

description:
Admittedly I ordered the wrong sandwich in retrospect. Not too fond of the spicy chicken sandwich just because i was expecting a lot spicier; that said, with some of the sriracha by the counter, it was a pleasant experience. Definitely high quality bread and chicken. If you are just wanting something lightly spicy, you will likely enjoy it.

But the coffee, oh the coffee. This place knows how to balance acidity. Get the mojito. As someone who usually drinks cold brew without anything in it, this place might have converted me to the (slightly) sweeter side of things. Thanks, Beanstalk!
author: Elizabeth F.

description: Just wanted to give a quick update that Beanstalk has become my go to coffee shop! I have become a huge fan of their cappuccinos and it's nice to see the same people working there everyday. One of the workers always does a new design in my cappuccino each time and it makes me happy. That's all.
author: Estelle C.

description: On vacation in SF. Was looking for a highly rated breakfast joint that was close to the hotel. Literally across the street. Had the sausage bagel sando and hubby had the breakfast cragle sando. Yum! The mocha I had was delicious - not too sweet or too hot (I hate when it's so hot I can't drink it or it burns my tongue)
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Fantastic stop! I had a latte, my husband had a flat white, and we shared a piece of apple cider cake.
The espresso was perfect and the cake was incredibly moist and flavorful. Definitely stop by!
author: Charlotte R.

description: Good food, good drinks. I'd only suggest that they carry cup holders for larger orders carried out by one person.
author: Oscar G.

description: I ordered a breakfast sandwich and it was super hot when I got it! The sandwich was very basic but it was a good size and I liked the mix of the croissant and bagel! Drip coffee was decent, a little too acidic for me but I know some like that! The line took forever, like 40 minutes, and I was only outside the door.
author: Amber L.

description:
Overall an excellent place, and super busy. Coffee is excellent however there is only one size (12 oz). I had the toast cup which was great however as others have stated is a bit small. 

Service was very mixed, forgetful and not very friendly but all together it is worth going to and I would come back for their coffee for sure.
author: Jeff D.

description:
If you're looking for a quick bite with a short line, this place is for you! The menu offers sandwiches, breakfast items, pastries, and coffee/tea. Some of the more unique items are the cragle (croissant + bagel) and the toast cup! (Quick tip: go early if you're craving the cragle. I went on a Saturday around 1 pm and it was sold out.) 

I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich with an iced mocha. It took about 10 minutes from order to table (which is so quick!) It was AMAZING!! The bread was soft and the chicken was moist and flavorful. It was totally satisfying and definitely hit the spot! The iced mocha was good. As I like to put it, iced mochas are like adult versions of chocolate milk. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.
author: Elaine N.

description:
TOAST CUP. CRAGEL SANDO. These two items are not only original, but also one of the best breakfast items I have ever eaten. 

Please do visit when hungry and in search for a light (to go) fare. You will NOT be wrong with either option. 

The hot chocolate and latte were perfection. On a cold day, each helps you get all warm and fuzzy inside. 

Beanstalk: thanks a lot for the amazing breakfast. 5 stars for originality and exquisite taste!
author: Arturo B.

description:
The coffee is really good - they serve Contraband and have a wide array of hot and cold drinks (I had the flat white and it was...delicious).  

The interior is large and bright with a few tables and sofas to chillax on.
 
I didn't try any of the food but they have a nice menu of sandwiches for breakfast and lunch - will definitely be coming back to try some of those.

The owner, Mina, was delightful and the service was quick and friendly. Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Ariel C.

description: Glad I came across this place when I was in SF. The sandwiches were delish and reasonably priced! I tried the spicy chicken and bulgogi sandwiches, both were to die for. I've had plenty of spicy chicken and bulgogi from eating kbbq and other Korean spots, and the meat served here were arguably tasty as some of those places. If you eat less like me, you can save half of the sandwich for later, which is great! Service was solid, cute/hipster interior, and a place I hope others will stumble across.
author: Lisa T.

description: Fantastic and super cute cafe. I had the croissant with egg bacon and cheese with the milk tea. It was delicious. I would definitely recommend coming here.
author: Kim N.

description: The flat white from this adorable eclectic cafe was delicious! I definitely preferred it over the iced mint mojito lattes. My boyfriend and I came here around brunch time and it was pretty busy but we were still able to find seating (perhaps by luck) but we got the roast beef sandwich which was perfection. The sliced tomatoes and cucumber made this sandwich so fulfilling and satisfying. As for the cragel with bacon and egg, I didn't know a bagel could taste even more delicious but this place found a way.
author: Samantha E.

description:
My go to coffee shop - for a few reasons... First, it's on my way to work and I enjoy so very much stopping here, having an espresso and then continuing on my way. Secondly, I really like the staff and the coffee. This place makes you feel like at home. 

They just recently finished their renovations and it's spacious, and bright (with the large windows)! They have lots of food options, great for breakfast and lunch... Or just great coffee options ! Their prices are more reasonable than most boutique high end coffee shops so I feel there is great value here. 

Great service, great food and coffee and a great vibe... This is quite the gem of a spot. Check it out!
author: Jenna M.

description:
Title:  just 2 blocks from Union Square, and worth the walk 

Since we were being tourists in San Francisco, I decided to step away from the chain establishments, so we found this gem, 2 block north from Union Square... it is small, quaint and Awesome.  

We really were looking for lunch...and we were not disappointed.  
We had Egg Salad, Roast Beef and their Polgulgi (korean bbq) sandwich... 
all of them were a hit.  Especially the Korean BBQ sandwich... 

There was so little room to eat (only 7 or seats), but we managed.  Got to talk with one of the owners of the place, and they are going to expand to include ice cream and move their coffee next door...  with this great food and coffee,  I know they will be a success.... 

Next time I am in SF, and near Union Square / Chinatown, I will bee line it to Beanstalk...
author: Balinor I.

description: First visit. Ate here because of the seemingly positive reviews. We waited 30 minutes for 3 breakfast sandwiches. I had the spicy chicken. There was probably an ounce of meat on the sandwich. Really pathetic. My wife had sausage on hers which she spit out saying it tasted spoiled. The most shocking thing I witnessed was a worker there. A short Hispanic looking man was behind the counter making sandwiches. He had NO GLOVES on his hands. He was touching everything. Utensils, bottles, counters, etc. I watched him running sandwiches out to customers outside. While out there, a man who he recognized was walking down the sidewalk. They high five and then the man came back inside and continued making sandwiches! He never washed his hands. It was disgusting. I bet he took the trash out too. I won't be back.
author: Jeff B.

description: My mojito coffee drink (coffee, vanilla, half & half, mint leaves on ice) and cragle w/cream cheese were both very underwhelming!
author: Miss Y.

description: Nice little cafe, the sausage, egg & cheese cragel and bulgogi sandwiches are pretty good. It was a nice morning and we got an outside seating. A great way to kickstart our day.
author: Maryann H.

description: A cute cozy little brunch find in SF Union Square area.  My girlfriend and I stumbled on this place.  been here twice for brunch. i personally enjoyed the mojito iced brewed coffee, cragel with sausage and the beef bulgoogi.  i will come here again if i am back in SF.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Super friendly service (was greeted with a genuine smile upon arrival and before I left) and good food. I tried the toast cup ($3.75) and grabbed two vanilla lattes to go. There was a little wait because of how reputable this cafe is, but it didn't bother me too much. 

Overall, the cafe is small, with a counter to sit by and a little corner table. I wouldn't rely on having a space available to sit when coming here. The toast cup was different, but tasty, and the lattes were made well.  I would definitely come back and try some of the sandwiches because they look delicious!
author: Corinna T.

description:
Adorable little coffee shop with the CUTEST salt and pepper shakers but I'm so sad that my cappuccino milk was burnt and the foam had a lot of air bubbles. The burnt cappuccino milk made the coffee bitter so I had to add sugar. Meh.

However, the mint mojito iced coffee looks good. I will give that a try next time.
author: Leilani Y.

description:
Coffee was fine but poor customer service is my pet peev. Stood at the counter ready to order for Prob 3-4 mins without anyone even saying hi... and there were 2 employees about 4 feet from us putting stuff away. No eye contact. No "be right with you." No "just one moment." No "hi". WTF? It's so EASY to just be polite!
3-4 star coffee
1 star service
author: Denise S.

description:
OMG! I absolutely love this joint. Stopped here before a fashion show in union square and got a coffee and a bagel with egg, avo and cheese. So good! The coffee mojito thing was literally the best iced coffee I've ever had. And the bagel was perfectly crisp and delectable, plus everything was ratioed well, which is always difficult for some reason. Price was average for a hipster coffee joint in SF (about $11 total).

Ambiance is awesome, super quaint (small open kitchen and very small dining area). Cute little knick knacks and chachkis littered around, as well as greenery to make the place feel more open and fresh. Staff was super friendly, the girl behind the counter helped me out in choosing which drink to get (I always like to ask the staff what their reccomendations are). Overall, really liked this little place, was nice to take a breather after my heinous plight of finding parking in the city. RIP sanity.
author: Kyle D.

description: Great place. The only downside is that they close way too early! 5PM or 6PM depending on the day. That is really unfortunate. Downtown is really short on food cafes that are both 1.) good for studying and 2.) stay open at night.
author: Art W.

description: I think this place is totally over rated. Besides the cragel (bagel croissant), there was nothing special about the breakfast sandwiches we got. It was really no better than getting something from Starbucks. I prefer fresh made eggs - these ones tasted microwaved. I don't know if they actually were or not. There was a line but it went quickly. I'm sure there are better take out places but not to say this was inedible. Just definitely not worthy of the 4.5 stars rating.
author: Jules M.

description: This is a cute little coffee place just off all the hustling from union square. You'll find a lot of locals here just enjoying a cup of good coffee. They are also good for a light and quick breakfast or brunch. I love their interior - super high ceilings, a lot of light and very modern and cool. It has a good amount of hipster vibe to it and they certainly take it serious preparing your espresso or sandwich. You'll always get a smile from the barista. They also serve slow drip coffee which tastes excellent. Seating is limited but usually you can always grab a table.
author: Jonas G.

description: Nicely designed small cafe, relaxing and inviting atmosphere, good coffee, nice bagels :)
author: Max M.

description: This place has a great atmosphere and staffs are really friendly and helpful. I love their cragel bacon egg and cheese. Daily coffee is the best to try. I would come back here again.
author: Mary D.

description: Love the minimalistic decor and focused menu selection which is totally right up my alley. A pity we came a little too late for the toast cups but their specialty cragels certainly didn't disappoint. I had their cragel with cream cheese - it has the crispiness of a croissant on the outside yet softness of a bagel inside, and pairs so well with the cream cheese which was not too overwhelming. They make a mean cup of mocha too! Would definitely be back again for more
author: Clement W.
