description: We came to try the Cragel breakfast sandwich, and it did not disappoint. It's a small restaurant, so it can be tricky getting a seat, but very yummy food.
author: Kristin P.

description:
They don't check their online orders. They ask you to repeat your order to them, and then they make it wrong. Whole milk instead of almond milk and syrup. Then they ask for payment even if you've already paid online. Avoid this mess of a place.

Edit: Updated from 1 to 2 stars for nice owner comment. Will stop by again and update review.
author: Shu J.

description: A great place to relax and get some coffee before driving to Reno. I ordered the matcha latte with a bulgogi sandwich. The latte was good but could've been a little sweeter. The sandwich was very filling and delicious. I will make sure to stop by here again the next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Kevin H.

description: We ate breakfast on Sunday early morning. There were few people. Coffee and toastcup were served quickly compared with everything bagel. We got a light meal here. It's okay quality nothing surprising.
author: Crystal Y.

description:
Coming from out of town, I wanted to try something that I couldn't get back home and I found the cragel sandwich through Yelp. I came on a Sunday morning around 10:00am and the cafe was pretty busy but I didn't have to wait a long time to order. 

AMBIANCE: 
- The interior is just like any cute cafe, bright and airy. 
- There are not many tables only about 6 or so you really have to be on the lookout to see if any diners are leaving their table so you can claim their seat. 

FOOD: 
- Cragel sandwich with sausage: This was sooo delicious! The combination of croissant and bagel was even better than I was expecting. The top is croissant-like with it's flaky and buttery taste but the sandwich is also more hearty like a bagel than a croissant. The sandwich is filled with fluffy scrambled eggs, chunks of sausage, and melted cheese. Paired with some hot sauce (which they'll give you upon your request), you have the perfect hot breakfast sandwich! 
- Drip coffee: I just got a normal black drip coffee to go with my sandwich and it was just your normal cup of black coffee, nothing too special. 

SERVICE: 
- The staff is really friendly! 

I'm really pleased with my experience here and I would definitely come by for another cragel if I'm ever in town again! :)
author: Tiffany L.

description: Sunday, October 1st, 4:42pm. I asked for a roast beef sandwich and the guy at the counter loudly exclaimed "fuc*" as my order was 20 minutes before close of business. He even made an exclamation with his head and arms. Of course I said "it's ok" and walked away without any food. He didn't even apologize or give me any reason for the refusal. I've been a regular customer even before the renovation last year. However, the rudeness of the response left me speechless. I will never come back.
author: Leandro D.

description: Mediocre place with a killer location. Serves thoroughly unremarkable food to indiscriminating crowd on the run. Bonus points for weak coffee. Perfect example how it's all about Location, Location, Location.  Honestly the stuff they prepare in their open mini kitchen is the kind of stuff you can make at home running out the door. I totally do not get all the 4-5 star reviews... You people should get out more and raise your standards a little!
author: Degustator J.

description:
Cregel Sando -- not as good as a croissant sandwich, but slightly better than a bagel sandwich. Cregel, indeed. 

$7.50 is way overpriced - I don't know why I got two. It's okay to try once, but I would half it and explore what other options you have in the city.

Now, the coffee cola on the other hand? Delicious!
author: Jane L.

description: Good spot to catch a coffee and snack or quick breakfast.  The sandwiches looked amazing.  My order was matcha green tea latte and bacon/egg/chz bagel.   Neither disappointed and were reasonably priced ($12 for the pair)
author: John H.

description: Food was amazing and my mocha latte was decent. Only giving this place 4 stars because the young lady taking my order was completely rude. Came with my significant other and tried to place my order after his and she asked if we were together; completely ignored me and took his payment without putting my order in. She didn't even confirm our order before taking payment.
author: Leah M.

description:
Came here after a horrible inbound flight for a bite during the afternoon lull (most places were closed or closing).

Owner was friendly and fastidious, overseeing the staff and making sure things were cracking depsite relatively slow service. It's a small place, so allow some time.

Didn't try the coffee but I did feast on the Korean Spicy Chicken Sandwich (Sweet vinegar cucumbers, lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, mayo, and mildly spicy Korean sauce), which I got to go. A bit pricey at $11+, but it's SF.
author: Yan T.

description:
Legit cafe serving breakfast food you want as well as pastries. The business seems to be aiming to support local as much as possible, boasting Ghirardelli and House of Bagels products. The eggs in my bagel seemed real whisked eggs, and noticed that they use cage free. Heck the honey was organic, too. 

Great business model.
author: S D.

description: I love this place! Small and quaint with great food! After reading fellow yelpers' reviews, I HAD to try their toast cup. It did not disappoint! Super crispy toast parts (almost like a thick pita chip), savory bacon, and perfectly cooked egg went well together.  Wanted to try the drip coffee, but opted for the Americano instead. It was perfect with the toast cup!  My friend tried their cragel (croissant and bagel), and it tasted exactly like you would think a croissant-bagel would!  I loved the unusual texture-kinda chewy like a bagel, but lighter and fluffy like a croissant.  Prices were very reasonable! I would definitely return to Beanstalk Cafe if I'm ever in the neighborhood again!
author: Steph I.

description: Came here for the mint mojito iced coffee and it was okay. I personally liked Philz better but that's just me. Also got the tofu sand which and was good but I think to expensive however this is down town and $15 is about what you pay for a coffee and sand which so I'm not too surprised. My friend got the grilled cheese and that was pretty good. I loved the Cafe itself and how aesthetic it is! Very cute and the service was also nice. Side note - Their water also tasted very good lol
author: Cynthia R.

description:
San Francisco is full of surprises... Here is the deal this SF cafe is a hole in wall easy to miss... Literally it is a hole in the wall without a proper sign to identify it;however, once you find it you find yourself in a welcoming environment. While you find yourself in home, this rush hour type of home. Make the order, pay, get your food and keep on moving (it is not the place to sit down and take forever to eat your breakfast). Hence the reason the only have two small tables.

Nevertheless, the food is quite delicious and fast. The line keeps on moving and people keep leaving w a smile in their face.

-Price

It is affordable and good (not common in SF) 

-Service

Friendly and fast

- would I recommend it to a friend?

Absolutely 

- why 4 stars?

I wish it had more room and perhaps a sign outside so I don't get lost  trying to find it.

I'll be back soon enough
author: Carlos R.

description: When the new owners took over, they immediately took away a bench on the side of the building to get rid of a 70 year old homeless woman that stayed there each night; even though they didn't open their doors for another 6 months. She wasn't hurting their closed business! Super overpriced for food and coffee that is nothing special. The Richfield down the street is cheaper and much higher quality!
author: Joshua L.

description:
Toastcup is what brought me here! There's a sign that says "served before 9:30am" and they sold their last one at 9:25. The toastcup was decent but my yolk was pale yellow/dry -1* for sad yolk :(. I would have preferred it with a medium yolk.

The coffee quality here is good. Got a capp which was yummy, the milk was perfect. My friend got the drip coffee of the day "Black Market" and it was fantastic. I'd definitely go with the black market next time.
author: Jessica L.

description: Amazing! Friendly staff, even though I was indecisive. I ordered the bulgogi sandwich and it was great. I'm not sure any sandwich after this one will be as good.
author: Amanda D.

description: This was a really cute café in a nice location where I tried the cragel sando with sausage.  It was a filling breakfast that was freshly made and easy to pick up on a busy morning.  I liked the bagel/croissant combination and hope I have a chance to stay a little longer and try something from their drink menu next time!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Review is based on Caviar delivery... I'd definitely recommend using Caviar if you're too busy (or too lazy) to get food, or if there's a cafe or restaurant that you've been dying to go to but it's not convenient for you to visit. Some of the prices may be a little higher than in the actual restaurant and delivery fees may be a little steep depending on how far it is, but it's super convenient and the food is fresh. 

I decided to try out Caviar for the first time with Beanstalk Cafe and ordered the bulgogi sandwich, warm, with no cheese, no mayo and the spicy Korean side on the side (yes, I complicate orders). Came out to be about $15 including taxes, tip and delivery. Delivery was quick and the sandwich arrived exactly as requested :)

-BULGOGI SANDWICH ($10.50) - 4/5 
[sweet vinegar cucumbers, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, onions, mayo, spicy Korean sauce; served on acme roll]
Mmmm warm, crunchy, toasted bread filled with a solid portion of bulgogi. The sweet/spicy sauce gives it lots of flavor and a good kick, though I would've liked it a touch spicier. No mayo needed in my opinion, but I'm generally not a fan of the creaminess mayo adds to sandwiches. As much as I love the proportion of protein though, I wish the sandwich had more veggies as well. There was only a thin layer of lettuce/arugula, incredibly thin slices of tomato, minimal onions and cucumbers, and no pickles.
author: Jessie L.

description: I got the bulgogi sandwich on roll. Amazing. Lovely crunch and toastiness. Slightly spicy but not over the top. Why hasn't anyone else thought of this?!? Pesto turkey sandwich was another winning order that someone in my group got.
author: Kiran C.

description: Beanstalk Cafe is a great place for a sandwich and a cup of coffee.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The sandwiches are freshly prepared using high quality ingredients.  In particular, their rolls are delicious--just the right amount of crust and chew.  I liked having vegetables on my breakfast sandwich.  Beanstalk Cafe also offers a well curated selection of coffees.
author: Armand A.

description:
Very very disappointed. I ordered a toast cup around 2 pm. The toast cup turned out to be very dry and basically not eatable at all.  Inside the cup filling - running egg yolk and bacon. The cup was made with a thin layer of toast bread.  I'm sure it would be a good breakfast if it were freshly mad. However, it was not the case. The egg was hard and basically, it looked like a plastic egg yolk. The toast cup ( bread) was burned and hard. 
The cashier said they made it in the morning. I got it at 2PM, they should not sell me the toast cup because it's old and dry. 

Overall, it was bad and I had to return it. Good thing they refund me the money.  The shop should not sell it to the customers after 2-3 hours of shelve life.Because that toast cup is probably only good right after coming out from the oven.  

Tips: don't ever get the toast cup after 11AM!!!  You don't want to eat a plastic egg and burned toast bread.
author: Helen C.

description: A little low on atmosphere and not the best for food, except for catching a quick bite, but they really know how to make coffee. I had the cortado three mornings in a row, and it they've dialed it in perfectly. The coffees I delivered to the Mrs. each morning were spot on - both the drip and the pour-over. They work fast and efficiently too. I'd go every morning if I lived here.
author: Steve C.

description: Came here for breakfast and loved the cragel sandwich. I love that they add a lot of moisture to the egg, so it stays warm for a while. The place is a bit small.
author: Beth M.

description:
I had to check this place out when I heard about the croissant bagel hybrid. The cafe is very small and cute. There was a bit of a line so I tried to order quickly. I opted for the cragel breakfast sandwich. The sandwich was a bit dry, but overall it was good. I don't think I'd go out of my way for another cragel. The best way to describe it is as a flaky bagel. 

I think this place is probably a solid 3.5 stars, but I had the opportunity to closely examine the menu as I waited for my food and noticed some funny business with the pricing. If you order a plain bagel with cream cheese it's $3. If you order a plain cragel with cream cheese it's $3.75. However, subbing the cragel on the breakfast sandwich instead of a the bagel up charges $1.50 instead of $.75.
author: Kristen B.

description: Nice, quiet, unassuming coffee shop a couple blocks from Union Square.  I had a couple of good cappuccinos and an egg salad bagel.  I really like the ambiance.  Lots of light.  A great little neighborhood coffee shop.
author: Chris R.

description:
up up down down left
right left right b a Contra
Coffee with my brunch

the famous Toast Cups:
"much ado about nothing"
kidding. room temp though
author: Dan B.

description: Great coffee and sandwiches. The bread is fantastically fresh, this is a hidden gem away from the bustling union square. It's a great place to watch the world go by whilst enjoying some good eats.
author: Steve B.

description: Called in for 2 takeout sandwiches and 2 lattes. Was really nice! Came to $31. Would recommend! Staff were efficient and food was fresh and didn't take too long!
author: Ryan L.

description:
OMG this cragel was so good - basically a perfectly dense croissant. Cannot rave enough about it.

Amazing combo? Turkey sandwich on a cragel.. seriously you need to try this.

Service was super friendly, fast, and there were a few seats outside in the sun too :) perfect!
author: Kristie C.

description:
Wonderful veggie sandwich. It tasted great and was so beautiful! I ate it on the go and 2 people on the street asked me where I got it from (and I, of course, pointed them towards beanstalk). 
Location is simple and cute. 

I ran into this place sort of by accident and will definitely come back.
author: Kiley S.

description: Came into the city for the Hot Chocolate Race tomorrow.  Came here with the recommendation of our hotel.  Happy to say we were very pleased with the spot.  I got the Homemade Pesto Turkey sandwich and my husband had the Bul Go Gi sandwich.  We shared half of each and they were both very tasty.  I would definitely come back here again.
author: Grace F.

description: So good!! I went for breakfast and ordered the egg, cheese, and bacon cragel and an iced thai latte - such a delicious breakfast. Highly recommended!
author: Andrea C.

description:
Okay eating experience. The shop is very small but clean and cozy. They take long to prepare the sandwiches and the average time is 5-10 mins. The place gets really busy at brunch times and the shop got packed with people waiting to get their food.

We ordered the toast cup, the morning breakfast sandwich, the pesto cheese sandwich and the drop of the day coffee. The food was okay, everything  tasted plain. The toast cup was disappointing, I do give them the credit of being creative but the flavor and the taste were not there. The coffee of the day was plain as well. 

The food may need spices/ peppers or salt.
author: Yangyang J.

description:
The coffee was good and I would go back for bread, because it was fresh however the sandwich vegetables were not so fresh tasting. I didn't finish the sandwich because it had that "FRIDGE TASTE" 
I walked around a bit and wanted to try this place but disappointed...the dessert looks good so maybe just a coffee and cake spot in the future :(
author: Punita K.

description:
Best place to come for a quick, but high quality caffeine fix! I love their cappuccinos - they use double shots by default, so they really wake you up, and taste amazing.

Super small space, so expect to take out. Seating is cramped, so you wouldn't want to come for a laptop session or a long conversation.

They also have great food! Highly recommend anything with the cragel!
author: Jeffrey Z.

description:
Small café with lot of nice things to try!
The Sandwiches are made with fresh ingredients and coffees are good quality and they have original coffee drinks!
The service was friendly and fast!

Recommend to try the Bul gogi sandwich and Mojito Iced brew!
author: Aurelien C.

description: Tried to find a breakfast place near our hotel, which was hard in financial district; we had to walk here as a last resort; and it wasn't bad, I loved the croissant/bagel sandwich with sausage; it's a busy place with dumb corporate laptops morons but I liked it; it was a great start to my morning
author: MK M.

description: Good strong coffee. Friendly people. No crowd. Clean. This is my "go to spot" for coffee. At other coffee shops *cough(Starbucks) I have to ask for an extra shot in my mocha. At this place it's already strong and delicious. Black coffee is good too.
author: Romeo A.

description:
Long wait for mediocre sandwich. Egg cups aren't available after 9:30. Four and a half stars is pretty high and I was expecting a lot better than I could get at Safeway.

Edit: removed one star due to Owner's response

Edit: reported owner to Yelp due to threat of physical violence, the "consequences" of giving negative reviews
author: Markus S.

description: Coffee is tasty and snacks are yummy. One of my favorite breakfast places in the area.
author: Abie W.

description:
I needed a quick breakfast with some protein and a good, strong cup of coffee - Beanstalk Cafe did not disappoint!

Their specialty are the little 'toast cups' with a thin bread baked around an egg and a strip of bacon. They were pretty good, and a good idea. I think it might be a big better if the egg was just slightly runny so you could dip the toast into it, instead of firm.

The coffee was good and the crew spent time on doing the pour over to make sure it was done well and not rushed. It's a tight little spot in there but I was able to snag a chair, have a quick conversation and be on my way. 

Definitely worth checking out - I could also eat a couple of those toast cups!
author: Adam S.

description: Damn Damn Damn, this is the spot for a quick bite. Get in there and see for yourself. Not much seating but well worth it. Coffee and sandwiches were great. These are the spots that make SF a great city!
author: Michael D.

description: Walked 7 blocks out of the way to try this place. At first I was pleasantly reassured it must be good when I saw a line out the door. I ordered a simple hot espresso macchiato and it was un-drinkable. The coffee was over-extracted and too bitter enjoy.
author: Briana S.

description:
Met Joe for lunch near Union Square, and with him being vegetarian, he found the Beanstalk Cafe. The place is tiny, with just two tables inside and two outside. But with the sun streaming through the big bay window, our cozy table experience felt like a tiny Paris cafe. 

This place literally had the very very best veggie sandwich I have ever had. Not even sure what's in it, but it was out of this world. I can't stop thinking about it even two weeks later. 

Highly highly recommended!
author: Charlie L.

description: Coffee is great! The place is inviting and comfortable now that they renovated it. The only downside, service is quite slow.
author: Khristine A.

description:
The service is slow, I ordered a pastrami sandwich and it took 10mins (2pm so it was after lunch rush).
The bread was extremely hard and it actually cut the inside of my mouth.  The pastrami is too salt, but I like the arugula and mustard sauce favor.
Overall I would give it another try, maybe order something else that doesn't involve injury.
author: HL W.

description: Amazeballs bulgogi sandwich & egg/cheese cragel. Cute place excellent.  My husband and i shared bulgogi meat was excellent!
author: Michelle K.

description:
This is my current go-to neighborhood spot for getting my daily caffeine fix. It's a very cute cafe with seating for about eight inside plus a couple of benches outside. It can get a little crowded on weekend mornings, but otherwise it's usually easy to find a seat. If you're pressed for time, you can pre-order online or by phone. Note that the online ordering doesn't offer all the items on their menu, so you may want to opt for the phone option if you can't find what you want there.

I am a huge fan of their mochas: very tasty. They also offer a large selection of sandwiches and bagels. I usually go for their breakfast sandwich.

The staff is extremely nice. One of the owners, Mina, is usually there to give a warm welcome to customers. There used to be a stamp card reward system, although they did away with it a few months ago. Nevertheless, Mina will still give me a free mocha or snack every now and then to honor repeat service.
author: Rodney G.

description: We had a great bagel breakfast here. Service was so-so, but bagels were delicious. Clean, cozy and super convenient from Nob Hill.
author: Lily M.

description: Nice little café! I can see myself coming back soon to study. It is a bit noisy, but I prefer to have some noise sometimes for studying or working. I had a mocha coffee and a pesto grilled cheese,  both delicious and very filling. My meal was around $7, which is a cheap price for breakfast that good in SF. Will try to come back earlier to try the cragel, which seems very popular, as they ran out of it.
author: Lorely G.

description: Cute little place, staff was great. Only one size cup offered for black coffee, and it was mediocre. There are also better places to find a bagel sandwich not far from here. I might be drawn back to try their lunch sandwiches but I think I'll go elsewhere for a quick breakfast.
author: Christina L.

description:
Used to get this delivered often! Loved this place until there was a mans arm hair in my sandwich ... almost threw up. Sad because the sandwiches taste great, but unfortunately this ruined it for me. Won't be back.


I don't find the situation that funny honestly. And yes, a males body hair looks MUCH different that a woman's. Not sure how a delivery person could get a hair in the lettuce of my sandwich. I would be happy to email you the receipt for a refund! Some of us lead very busy lives so calling to complain doesn't do much. That is where Yelp comes in handy. And yes, I am a real customer, with a real review. Thanks for your concern!
author: Ashley F.

description:
Right by the hotel we were staying in on a recent trip to San Francisco. Read the reviews and decided to give it a go. Ordered both the bulgogi beef sandwich and a bagel sando and both were amazing. Bulgogi beef sandwich was filled to the brim with tasty tender beef and a tangy yet spicy sauce with cabbage and some rocket. I only wish they had put more spicy sauce and that they'd pickled the cabbage and carrots to give it a nice lift. 

The bagel sando looked like a regular and tasted like an unremarkable egg and bacon sandwich in a bagel. Tasty but nothing to write home about. Seating is sparse but accommodates about 5 or 6 and if you're so lucky to grab a seat outside when the weather is sunny, enjoying a good sandwich in the sun is a luxury.
author: Tim L.

description:
Hole in the wall cafe spot and not too fast of a turn time for scrumptious bakery goods to come out of their oven.  I wanted to try their toasted cups, but they said they ran out.  I ordered their mint mojito coffee and they ran out of mint.  Limited supply for a small cafe storage I suppose, to function.

Few seatings and not the ideal bring-your-stuff to do work here for awhile cafe.  I prefer that cafe vibe. 

The norm on coffee and sandwich menu. 

I left unimpressed.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
This place has great energy and service. The people working there were warm and inviting. 

We  ended up getting the toast cups (they sold out of the cragel), an iced  mojito coffee,  and a chewy chocolate pretzel/pastry looking thingy in a cake holder at the counter.  I forgot what it was called but I remember that the pastry was gluten free and he said he was going to name it after his daughter. 

Everything was good and I would recommend anyone who is in the area to drop by. Too bad we're from La. I feel like my husband and I would be regulars here if we were from the bay area.
author: Christine P.

description: Came here since we were staying close by. The breakfasts was very very good. Also bagels were amazing!!
author: Suley Z.

description: Cute and quaint. Service was nice and quick. Wasn't sure what to expect when searching for brunch spots on here but it was decent for a quick stop. Okay food (we got a sausage egg and cheese croissant to split, I think it's just heated upon ordering like most coffee stops) and decent coffee!
author: Kaylynn K.

description: Nothing better than their cracked smothered in fresh cream cheese. Great price! Great location! Very cool little cafe in Nob Hill. I will definitely be here every chance that I can.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Beanstalk cafe has a certain morning menu and baked goods served between 730am-930am.

All other menu items are delicious and include items from turkey sandwiches to breakfast sandwiches and more.

Great, quick pick up spot for a breakfast or lunch on the go. 

Very reasonably priced
author: V O.

description: Decision to the get the Cronut was spot on. It was flaky and warm, perfect for a small brunch before leaving the airport. It's always busy so finding a seat is tough, but the food is easy to grab and go.
author: Meghan B.

description:
3.5 stars.

Enjoyed the toast cups. I wasn't expecting that, since they seem kind of simple, but they were pretty delicious. The crust is really good (like Pillsbury crescent rolls, which I love), and it's just so darn cute and easy to eat on-the-go. This is kind of a once-in-a-while treat though, since it's pricey for how much food you get.

I also tried the Korean bulgogi sandwich, which wasn't bad, but just very non-Korean. The beef didn't really remind me of bulgogi and it wasn't spicy at all, but the sandwich itself held up really well with the crispier bun.

Friendly family-run place. There are some tables, but it's pretty small, so probably not a great working spot.
author: Alice T.

description: It turns out you can get nice coffee in the US!!  Great spot for a quick lunch. Had a tasty roast beef sandwich with boiled egg and greens. And an awesome coffee. Will definitely be back.
author: Gearóid H.

description:
Bread to meat to veggie ratio was optimal. Spicy chicken sandwich is actually spicy and they don't over do it with the onions. They also toast the subs which is nice. Good pickles too! 

The Toast Cups were sold out (it was 2pm-ish) so that was a bummer. 

A few drawbacks: the guys making the subs used their bare hands and my sub was $12 which is very pricey for what it was.
author: Vanessa L.

description: I visited for breakfast, ordered a cragle with sausage, banana bread and a vanilla cappuccino.  Total was $15.  Seemed a little over priced for the quantity / quality of food.  The cragle was average - sausage is diced into cubes vs. a patty.  Cappuccino was the same - nothing worth returning for.  Rated 3 stars because it was average but certainly not memorable or worth returning for.......the banana bread was great!
author: Stephanie I.

description: Cute place with decent sandwiches and coffee. But beware, if you are going there to work, this is NOT the place. They don't have a single outlet for you to plug into. Clearly this was designed on purpose to prevent people from working there. Really bummed.
author: Butters Mamma T.

description: Mojo to coffee is delicious.  Mint flavored cold brew.  Yum!  Even had almond/soy milk options.
author: Nureyev M.

description:
One of the better food options if you're in or around Union Square, and like warm, fresh sandwiches. They have mostly sandwiches on the menu, so if you're in the mood for salad or something else, you may want to go elsewhere. This is more of a grab-and-go place - they have a few seats along the wall and window, and 2-4 seats outside.

Sandwiches will run you about $9-10, and they have a wide selection of breakfast sandwiches, Korean-inspired sandwiches; you'll have a selection of about 10-15 things to choose from. They also have a croissant/bagel egg sandwich that looked delicious, but since we had just come from working out, we opted for a slightly healthier option.

I got the Korean Bulgogi Sandwch which comes with cucumbers, bulgogi beef, spicy Korean Sauce on a crusty French baguette that was airy, but not too airy, crunchy on the outside, and was just fresh and delicious. The proportion of filling to bread was good, and it was spicy but not overly spicy. I'd definitely get this again, and seems like one of the few fusion-flavored sandwiches you can get in the city, and certainly very unique.

My boyfriend got the Breakfast Sandwich which had bacon, eggs, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, arugula, on the same bread as mentioned above. It was delicious, and seems healthier than a cheese & egg sandwich on a bagel, since the bread is slightly less dense and it includes some vegetable and arugula. I only intended on taking one bite of my boyfriend's sandwich to try, but ended up swapping half of my sandwich for half of his, because it was so good. You can't go wrong with bacon, egg, and cheese.

All in all, a great sandwich spot, especially if you want something to just grab & go or want to order via Caviar or GrubHub, although I feel like these sandwiches are probably best when they are fresh and hot, just out of the toaster oven. I'd definitely come back here again to try some of their other sandwiches or to grab a coffee.
author: Christina L.

description:
Delicious sandwiches! Came here based on Yelp. Incredibly small sitting area so not good for large groups - inside is a table for 2 and a sitting area for 3

Bulgogi sandwich 5/5 - tasty marinated thin slices of beef with arugula on perfectly toasted bun
Spicy chicken sandwich 5/5 - sliced chicken with gochujang sauce
author: Joyce C.

description: We absolutely loved this place every morning for 5 days in San Fran. The Asagio bagel breakfast sandwich with bacon was amazing. Pair it with the awesome coffee. It's a great way to start your day.
author: Lydia S.

description: Large coffees were size of s normal small. $1.50 for refill. Bagels pretty mediocre. Service pretty mediocre. Would be happier if they had given me a decent sized coffee or at least a free refill.
author: John M.

description: Walked by the Cafe and stopped in for breakfast. Not much of a line, loved the Cragel option but opted for the Egg & Bacon on Everything Bagel with a hot Milk Tea. Great quality and relatively quick.
author: Arwin G.

description:
I wanted to grab a quite bite to eat and a cup of coffee for brunch and found this place on Yelp. It was right across the street from the hotel that I was staying at.

There's a couple chairs out front and about 1-2 small tables inside. They had some pastries and a small menu posted.

After reading some Yelp reviews, I decided to try their Bulgogi sandwich and a cup of coffee. Sadly, they ran out of the toast cups.

The bulgogi sandwich was really good. The meat was flavored well and they gave generous portions. The bread was a baguette and it was nicely toasted. It had a nice crunch every time I bit into it.

However, the coffee was just ok. I'm not sure what brand they use but I didn't enjoy it as much as I had hoped.

Overall, it's a cute cafe. I think it's a good place to come and get a cup of coffee and/or a sandwich/pastry to-go.
author: Lily Y.

description:
A small and intimate hole in the place where service is warm and food is delicious. 

We got the Bulgogi and breakfast sandwich on our first visit. Bulgogi had to my favorite. Can't speak for the coffee as only my GF got it but she wasn't that impressed.

 The sandwiches  I guarantee will cut the hell out your mouth but you won't mind when you realize how good there are. It's been two days since I scarred the roof of my mouth and its still sore. When asking for my left overs  to go they were nice enough to re wrap my sandwich for me.

Seating is limited so you might want to avoid the rush if you plan on eating there. I believe it had a 4 seat counter, one table for two inside and outside, and a small bench.
author: Larry T.

description:
Beanstalk cafe is def worth a visit if you're in SF.  It is a very cute coffee shop that is like a hole in the wall spot with only one table that seats 3-4 people and 3 stools on the side.  What's cute and special about this place from my experience are the cragels (croissant bagel) and the toast cups (thin hard toast that wraps an egg and bacon). The cragel is pretty delicious but the toast cup could use a lil more flavor/seasoning.

My bf had the coffee which was pretty good and I drank a green tea.  The tea wasn't bad but not that good either (it was similar to the Bigelow brand teas from Costco that have a cardboardy after taste).  I hope the owners get some better tea here.
author: Lizzy P.

description: This place is fabulous. People are great, food even better. I get the turkey with cranberry sandwich. The bread is the best I've ever had. How they get it so crunchy and crispy on the outside and yet so soft inside has me bewildered. With the fresh arugula and small hint of Korean influenced flavors, this place has my heart. Very clean small neighborhood cafe. Great job!
author: Mae C.

description: Not sure what's up with this place. I've had two experiences where my simple order has been epically messed up. This last time it seems like they just forgot about me so I left without getting my drink, as a quick stop to get coffee turned into a 20 minute wait. Also, the lack of ventilation really kills the vibe as you walk in and the smell of everyone's food wallops you in the face.
author: Dennis G.

description:
Hate to be a hater, but this was a not a 4.5 star coffee shop as per Yelp in June 2014. It was all right, but not great.

The mint mojito iced coffee was more like iced coffee with a few squirts of chocolate mint syrup. Not even comparable to Philz, so I'm not quite sure why the cost was similar at $4.50. I think they could've set expectations better by not calling this mint mojito in the first place. Minus a star. 

FYI, they do serve Contraband coffee, so for a local coffee fix, this is your spot. 

The toast cup was good, but pretty small and baked inconsistently. While pre-cooked, they still tasted nice and fresh after being warmed up. I bought two, and the egg yolk in one of them was slightly runny and orange, while the other one was well done and a pale yellow color. I like to take my eggs pretty seriously, and that feeling when one doesn't get that slightly runny egg while someone else does, is quite a let down. Minus a star for that. It was also pretty pricey -- mostly for the novelty or if you're on the run. 

The price of the bulgolgi sandwich also seemed a bit high, considering I've gotten a high quality banh mi for less than $8. I may still try it to quench the foodie curiosity in me though. The prices could be a function of the location, which is close to union square. 

It's a small shop with about four chairs and three bar stools. Good for a stopover if you're in the area and need a quick bite or a rest, but not something to really go out of your way for.
author: Audrey L.

description: Good find! Needed a quick lunch and was really impressed with the quality of the warm homemade turkey pesto sandwich. Friendly service, fresh ingredients. The sandwich was big enough that I almost saved half for the next day, but it was so good that I couldn't help myself and ate the whole thing. Oops.
author: Sarah W.

description: We happened across this charming cafe one morning in search of breakfast. As a vegetarian I would have to say their options are slim and very dairy laden. Their drop coffee was quite nice but I don't think this place was memorable.
author: Jennifer M.

description: his place is adorable and has the most amazing bagel sandwiches. Great ambience to chill out and enjoy your cup of coffee.
author: Harry K.

description: It's ok. Reminds me of Noah's bagels.  Don't come if you don't want bread.  Not even an omelette or salad even though looks like they've got all the ingredients. Tiny place, disorganized. Great if you want to hang out and work on a laptop all day with theirs free wifi.  Kinda silly that individuals take up whole tables all day working so that big families can't fit.   At least Starbucks has a bunch of benches to fit everyone.  Overpriced and disappointing.
author: Susannah K.

description:
I've yet to set foot into Beanstalk Cafe, yet I am already a fan of them! How can that be? Well, we've been ordering our team lunches from here for the past few weeks using the Eat24 App and now we're stuck with them: I can't get enough of their Bulgogi sandwiches and my colleague is addicted to their spicy chicken sandwich. 

I really ought to pay them a visit one of these days, especially since this place is in my old hood...maybe I'll hop on a cable car and swing by tomorrow. It's only been a day, but I am already missing their marinated cucumbers!
author: Uli B.

description:
Dainty cafe with a cute name. This is a good place to get a sandwich to-go since it's so cramped and has limited seating. I came here because I heard so much about the Toast Cups, which are composed of sliced toast, bacon, and egg. Each one is $3.95 which I thought was overpriced. As for the cups themselves, they were rather disappointing, but I think that's because I got the last two of the day around noon. They probably tasted better when they were first made. The toast tasted stale and the bacon was overcooked. 

I also got the Morning Breakfast Sandwich ($9.25) which made my trip to Beanstalk Cafe totally worth it. The sandwich is stuffed with bacon, eggs, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, and arugula. YUM! Very filling. Would definitely recommend this. It was nice to find a place that had more of a brunchy sandwich rather than your typical ham, egg, and cheese croissant.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I'm visiting from Hawaii, and staying at the Orchard. It's about a minute away from my hotel. Saw the positive Yelp reviews and figured I had no excuse not to try.

All in all a pleasant experience. Definitely one of the best lattes I've had in SF with one of those little toast egg cups. It was quick, friendly and cute. A little cozy on the inside, definitely the type of place that gets busy on the weekends. Wish I had time to stay longer, but it will be my go to coffee place when I'm staying in Union square.
author: Sam W.

description: Disappointing, eggcups were pre- made cold and stale. Coffee was great as was the morning bread but everything should b as fresh. Want egg cup w/o meat too.
author: K T.

description:
The cregal is a thing of beauty. The perfect marriage of a bagel and a croissant. Must try. I had mine with cream cheese. After ordering the cregal is perfectly toasted and generously lathered with cream cheese. 

Also ordered my usual triple shot 12oz vanilla latte. 

Very good. Not the best ever but still in a prestigious tier that will more that satisfy the casual coffee drinker.
author: Everett B.

description: I have been to this Cafe on numerous times and the service is somewhat tolerable. Sometimes the orders get mixed up and you're left waiting for your meal for a long period of time. We have had this happen to us on one or two occasions but it has become a sort of habit at this place. The service could definitely be better and their food has also deteriorated over the time I have been there. The best example is the Chicken Sandwich, it used to be one of my favorite items here but the last 2 times I could barely finish it. Numerous times I have gotten meals that felt somewhat cold to the touch. I do not think I will be returning to this place anytime soon. It was good while it lasted.
author: Pedro S.

description: I had a cragel with turkey sausage, egg and cheese. It was just alright, I have had better. It was missing a flavor. The lady at the front was not very personable.
author: Hailey R.

description:
Went here in the mid morning when I was visiting SF. Had read all the reviews here on Yelp and thought I would give it a try. 

When I walked up to the cafe as expected it was a really small hole-in-the-wall with a couple chairs inside and a small bench outside. Not much seating but its SF so that is a given. There were only a few other customers in the cafe when I went it. 

The lady at the counter greeted us (My GF and I) immediately which was nice and asked us what we would like to order. Upon asking for their toast cup she politely said they had sold out. So we decided to order bagels. When I asked for two raisin bagels she went to the back then came back out and said they were sold out. We then just asked what bagels they do have and she replied all they had were onion bagels left. We decided to order those and two cappuccinos as well.

The drinks were really good, creamy and smooth.. The bagels, are bagels - Standard.
Overall it looks like they would have had great tasting toast cups and specialty sandwiches if they had the ingredients in stock.  

Three stars just because we did not get to experience the great tasting sig. breakfast they offer
author: Taylor F.

description: The cragel sando was good. I think I just liked the cragel and would recommend skipping the sando. Coffee was good. My bf got an everything bagel sando and the everything bagel wasn't the best.
author: Carly B.

description: Love this place! Stopped by for a quick lunch and enjoyed every bite! It's so central and close to our hotel!!
author: Bianca R.

description:
Great friendly little cafe in nob hill area!  Coffees, sandwiches, etc., all served up with love and attention!

Eat in or on the sidewalk if you're lucky to grab a table.  

Loved the veggie tofu sandwich on fresh wheat baguette.

They "get" vegan, too!

Enjoy!
author: Gary A.

description: Inexpensive small place, better to take it to go. Sandwiches good coffee drinks. Definitely a good inexpensive place to go near union square.
author: David M.

description: I found this place on yelp and stopped here for breakfast with my husband while we were vacationing in San Francisco. We both enjoyed a cragel and coffee. I enjoyed it so much, that a month later I was back in San Francisco for work and took a co-worker here for breakfast! It has an intimate atmosphere, great food, and right off the cable car line!
author: Rachel M.

description: They have these amazing breakfast entrees called toast cups? Anyway they are essentially toast and bacon and eggs shaped like a cup.
author: Justin S.

description: We were unimpressed with our experience at Beanstalk. We ordered a bagel, a cragel sando with no meat and two black coffees. The bagel was sickly looking and small, the sandwich had a slice of bacon in it even though the guy taking the order and the woman bringing out the order echoed back to us that it was a no-bacon sandwich, and we had to follow up about getting the coffees. After we had been there for a while and hadn't heard the coffees called, we asked about them and the guy was very odd and a bit rude in checking that he charged us for them and then finally giving them to us.
author: Emily M.

description: In town for the week and checked this place out since it was only two blocks (steep San Francisco blocks, mind you ) from my hotel. I'll be going by here for my morning Americano the rest of the week now. Never seen crema so rich in the eapresso. The cragel is an interesting combo, not as greasy as a croissant, but lighter than a bagel.
author: Joel Q.

description:
Very cool tiny spot on Bush street. Good espresso with a nice brightness and citrus note. Small so don't expect a seat unless you snag one of the eight. This is a grab and go. Yummy sandwiches, bagel creations and some pastries. Enjoy.
Good solid cup of coffee.
author: Randy M.

description:
Cozy cafe to grab some coffee and breakfast. I ordered coffee, a bagel, and a toast cup. The toast cups are their specialty, and I thought it was delicious. 

There isn't a lot of seating, but it seems like a lot of customers take their orders to go. I wouldn't bring a big group here, but it's just right for one or two. The employees were pleasant and the atmosphere is tranquil. I may stop in again before I leave SF.
author: Ashton N.

description:
This cafe is super cute!

I was strolling around SF and felt like a cool beverage and a sunny spot to read my book - my trusty Yelp app directed me towards Beanstalk, and I'm glad it did! The place is small and a little well-loved around the edges, but it's clean, the staff are friendly, and they have a great selection of food and drinks.

I asked the lovely staff member what they had in the way of some kind of unsweetened ice tea type thing (SO specific, right?!) and he immediately told me they have a delicious pomegranate iced tea with my name on it. YES. DONE. Put it in a cup and sling it my way. Hell, I don't even need the cup!

I grabbed a seat by the window in a sunbeam - there are very few chairs so watch out during peak hours - and soon my amazing tea appeared. Rich purple in colour and garnished with a slice of lemon and a sprig of fresh mint, this was some fancy tea! I gave the mint and the lemon a squeeze and mixed them into the tea, and enjoyed some time reading my book. The tea was extremely flavourful, and I really enjoyed it! 

This is a lovely spot, and I highly recommend trekking up the hill (or down, depending on where you're coming from) to stop by.
author: Ayla C.

description:
Hey thanks for ruining my morning, I started on a good note. I have had Beanstalk Cafe bookmarked for over a month, I was rather excited to be here the shop looks cute on the outside like really cute. It is very small so you may have to wait for a seat but that is fine. What is not fine is being one of the first people to order and have people who came much later get their order first. I am talking about 10 bagels clearing up before i got mine. The coffee was so bad it couldn't make up for the wait. 

I got egg salad on a wrong bagel (raisins instead of plain- I hate raisins so much) it isn't so easy to eat (see pic) so that was half of my food and my coffee in the rubbish boom I'm feeling so miserable right now looking at it. I feel more miserable having to write such a review.

Owners are friendly obviously quite strained at times. I heared her say she is one person short maybe that is why!
author: Nora B.

description:
Ordered the bulgogi sandwich with my boyfriend; very tasty! This cafe was surprisingly small, but lovely. Definitely a place to go for a light meal. 

Not boyfriend. Friend. Best friend. Brest frwend. Chris. See this Kevin
??? so sorry LOL luv you
author: Davina B.

description:
Real yelpers don't lie and disappoint, glad the reviews are great and the rating is A plus. 

I walked over from the Triton to try the breakfast cups and get a cup of delicious coffee. 

Was greeted by friendly staff, and love the friendly customer service. 

I ordered the breakfast cup, wish the egg yolk was runny though, but for food & health rules they can't make it runny? Other that it was nice quick breakfast munch, for people on the go

I also ordered the Korean burl kogi sandwich, which I thought i would need a Togo box after seeing the size, but damn shit was so good I ate the whole thing. Crisp, soft bread, and fresh ingredients. 

Not sure what coffee to get so I just randomly picked the New GuineaKimel Estate, taste good on its own without sugar and just pour in the cream, which they warmed up for me. 

Great place must go!!! :) Julie body karate approved. Haha...
author: Julie S.

description:
Such a cute little cafe located very close to Union Square. Their bulgogi sandwich seems to be the specialty here, and I enjoyed every bite. 

The bread was so easy to bite into, the meat was seasoned perfectly, and I felt like ordering another one by the end of it. 

I also ordered their milk tea, which was nice and refreshing. Definitely check it out!
author: Tika B.

description: This is only a review for the mint mojito coffee.  It was meh. If you are looking for comparable to Philz's, this is not your place.
author: Linh L.

description: Nice brunch place although limited menu. The pesto grilled cheese sandwich was out of the world. Limited space but that created  a more family like atmosphere. Love the place.
author: Savinay D.

description:
Somehow the latte is more incredible here. The toast cups are fun and delicious, and the cragle breakfast sandwiches (croissant bagel) are hearty and crunchy

Seats 7 inside, 2-3 outside so it's more grab and go. We got to sit, and it was special
author: J S.

description: This is a lovely get and go cafe to get you on your day, through your day, or end your day. I came in the morning with my girlfriend and she got the toast cup which was uniquely delicious. I don't know what the cup is made out of. While it says toast, I found it hard to believe because it was fortune cookie like, but when eaten together with the bacon and yolkie egg though it's a bite size "HELLO MORNING" in your mouth :D Awesome buy and go option. There's also unique bagels and sandwiches which I want to come back and try. Did I also mention iced coffee mojito coffee? Say what? Drip coffee, with a hint of mint makes for a unique morning buzz. I dig it.
author: Jason F.

description: I ordered a chai latte, and it was delicious. I really wanted to order a bagel, but I saw an employee stocking the bagels from their box with his bare hands, and decided against it. The place is small, but it's very cozy and light. I wish I didn't see the employee grabbing all the bagels with his bare hands, or I would have given this place a 5. Everyone was really friendly, and there was a lot of natural light.
author: H M.

description: Great sandwich!! Probably my favorite place we ate at while visiting San Fran! Even though it's just a Korean style Vietnamese sandwich it was tasty and flavorful and different then your typical sandwich...kinda pricey 9.25!!
author: Dana M.

description: I love the toast cup!!!! Not just because it looks so cute, but the egg inside was cooked just right. I also tried the cappuccino, which was also very good. Seating is a bit tight, but very cute place overall.
author: Anh N.

description: No complaints here. Found parking nearby on a Sunday randomly and we needed a quick bite to eat. I got the bulgogi sandwich and my husband got the spicy chicken sandwich, both were very good but I personally enjoyed the bulgogi more. Good amount of meat and veggies plus the bread is nice and bubbly/chewy. Friendly service, cute interior decor. Takes 5-10min for your sammie. Didn't get to try the coffee but will try next time!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Loved it!

I highly recommend this place if you are ever in San Francisco. We went here on a while because it was a 5 star in the area.  It was a great little cafe with sandwiches and totally unassuming, but the food has SO MUCH flavor.

I ordered the korean beef sandwich and the SO ordered a tofu sandwich. Both sandwiches had an extreme amount of flavor and I polished it off pretty quickly. 

There isn't a lot of seating in this place and there isn't a huge amount of selections, but it totally makes up for it by being amazing.

Run, do not walk to this cafe if you are ever in SF and need a quick bite. PS: The little dog statutes around the place are pretty cute as well.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Very good high quality coffee! 

I came here on a Sunday so they didn't have much food left. I also got my iced coffee to-go, so I didn't get to enjoy my coffee in those nice mason jars they offer. 

I definitely will come back again to enjoy their coffee in their shop, and try some of their sandwiches.
author: Jeanette S.

description:
Came here to lick my wounds after my ever exciting early morning otolaryngology appointment.

Currently trying his ow carb thing, so I stuck with a black "Black Market" drip coffee, 1:3 soymilk. Delicious!

Great atmosphere with "Hazey" by Glass Animals on the speakers. Nice staff.

A less honorable yelper would have deducted a star for having to climb the hill up here. Hardly a hindrance for me!
author: Katie N.

description: Had the beef bulgogi sandwich and it was amazing.   Bread was warm and fresh and meat was spiced very well too.
author: John K.

description:
Oh Beanstalk Cafe, where do I even start? I came here on the first day I came to San Francisco for breakfast with my boyfriend and the expectation and the hype here did not let me down. I have read many reviews here centering around Beanstalk Cafe so I decided to give it a try here. This place is very lovely. The outside was beautiful and it made me look really cute compared to the other buildings surrounding it. Here is my evaluation for it. 

Basic Facts-
- I came here and I ordered a toasted cup and a milk tea. The toasted cup here is what they are famous here for and it is about $4.50. The milk tea here is about $4.00.
- My boyfriend got a Polgulgi (Korean BBQ) sandwich that was about $5.50. 

Pros-
- The people there are very friendly! 
- The seats there is limited but if you find a seat, it's pretty nice to hang out here. The atmosphere is wonderful. One of the best cafe I have seen in a really long time. I wish they had this back in New York City. 
- The names here for the food is very unique and creative as well. 
- The food here is extremely good and tasty. 

Cons-
- There are limited seats. Only one table and about 5 other seats near a bar like table. It was kind of crowded in the morning because everyone was ordering and trying to grab a seat as well. 
- In my opinion, the milk tea was not that good. My boyfriend enjoyed it but to me, it did not taste like the milk tea you would usually get in Chinatown. It was a bit bland and unsweetened. When I did tell them to sweetened my milk tea, they put (get this) RASPBERRY bump into my milk tea to make it sweeter.
author: Ashley Z.

description: I noticed several health code violations right off the bat when walking in. They don't wear gloves when handling the food and they touch everything such as they're clothes, machines, cleaning rags, and other things without washing their hands before going back to handling the food! Someone is going to get sick. The coffee also isn't worth the price you pay. It's poorly made and bland. The service was below par and my order was given to another person. Overall a below average experience. I support small businesses, but at least make an effort to provide adequate service for these prices as well as follow safety standards.
author: Benjamin R.

description:
I had to stop here before my trip to SF ended and after that crazy uphill trek, I easily found this place. I came t around 8:30 on a Monday morning and thankfully I was able to get a seat right by the door. I ordered a coffee and a toast cup. I was thrown off for just a minute because the top of the toast cup was very crunchy. Once I got through it, I was very pleased. It was buttery, perfectly baked and the egg was still soft in the center. 

The coffee was one of the best I've ever had, I quickly drained my cup :) 

As an added bonus I sat and peopled watched for a good 20 minutes before it filled up with people again.
author: Christina V.

description: Had that beef sandwich yesterday. It was a very different taste that ended up not being my favorite. The bread is really good, I think I just picked a meat I didn't like. I also had the Vanilla Bean hot tea which was really good. I'd go back!
author: Joanne S.

description: Amazing tofu sandwich and mojito coffee! Seating wasn't bad either even though it's small. Will definitely be coming back here!
author: Sneha V.

description: Cute little coffee and breakfast joint. The cregel is seriously awesome! Yes a croissant and a bagel had a love child= cregel. You're welcome.
author: Amanda K.

description: I go to the Beanstalk every time I am in SF (I am an out of towner).  The BulGolGi sandwich tastes like sadness - from the moment you order it, you know that you will know true bliss for only a finite amount of time, and after that, you will return to your life of blandness.  For a time, I tried to avoid this place as I knew that I would only be inviting trouble, but it drew me back like a photon circling a black hole, and the closer I got, the stronger the pull.  Should I avoid having pets or children for fear of an ill-fated moment?  Perhaps.  Thus is my conundrum with Beanstalk Cafe.
author: Andy W.

description: After spending the night at the orchard I needed a coffee stop before we toured san Francisco. Easy walk from the hotel, but this little place is TINY! Don't even plan on staying in, there's hardly even any room to wait. It took almost 10 min for two breakfast sandwiches, a cappuccino, and a cubano. Too long in my opinion but the food was certainly good. Great alternative milk options and tasty breakfast sandwiches. A good to go place.
author: Ashleigh J.

description: After hearing about this place from a friend I decided to stop by for some coffee. I ordered a ice coffee and my friend ordered hot chocolate! After seeing their yelp pics I had to try the cragel! Everything came out quickly for how busy they were so glad I listened to my friend's suggestion!
author: Amaryn B.

description:
Mina, the delightful owner has recently expanded her quaint store so that more may enjoy indoor seating. The food is out of this world! The bread is delicious and super fresh. I've tried just about all of the sandwiches and love them. The coffee is first rate. 
Take time to work this into your breakfast or lunch circuit. Mina's Beanstalk Cafe will impress you, I'm quite sure. -JSA
author: John A.

description:
I had known about this place prior to visiting SF and put it into my bucket list because of its' aesthetics & great reviews. 

The place is on Bush Street near Powell Street which can be a hike to get up to but it is worth it! 

The cafe is especially small and it is always packed with people. We went twice on our trip & it was busy both times, during the morning. Quality food and service is fairly quick. 

Tried both the morning breakfast sandwich & I got a roll with egg and cheese (not on the menu but just ask them), which were both equally delicious. The morning breakfast sandwich is filling and got me through the day! The drinks were good as well! 

Although I normally wouldn't pay $10 or so for a sandwich but since I was on vacation, I didn't mind. Definitely would come more often if I was a local!
author: Elaine C.

description: I got the Mina veggie and it was dank! Apples and veggies and dairy less cheese and seasoned mushrooms on a sandwich. My boy got the bagel sando with like bacon and eggs and cheese. Our bill was cheap and filling before Santa con
author: Megan T.

description: My favorite local coffee shop, hands down!  Food is great too - only thing that's better than both is the friendly and helpful staff
author: Brett B.

description: Had a bacon, egg, cheese cragel and iced mojito coffee. It was very solid. The atmosphere on a Sunday after lunch was decently busy but not overcrowded at all. A few nice tables to sit at inside and a clean bathroom. Also a nice bench outside where you can sit in the sun.
author: John S.

description: Came on a Saturday morning and they ran out of cragels a few customers after me and it was only like 9am!  Not sure if this is a regular occurrence but I'd guess it is since they seemed pretty busy on weekend mornings (we came back for another cragel Sunday morning because like everyone says...THOSE CRAGELS ARE AWESOME if you like croissants and bagels individually).  Also happened to try a roast beef sandwich...not impressed with the price or the blandness.   Stick with the coffee drinks and bagels here.
author: Franc N.

description: Yesss Delicious! Just got myself a breakfast cragel and it hit the spot. What is a cragel you might ask... hahah... it's a croissant bagel. Dense like a bagel but buttery and flaky like a croissant . I don't know how they did it but it's perfect. Nice and quick service. Will definitely be coming back to try the others on the menu!
author: Tru T.

description:
We visited the Beanstalk Cafe several times during our stay in San Francisco.  This is a must try if staying in the Nob Hill area! A small cafe with awesome breakfast sandwiches and coffee. 
Must tries: The Cragel-- the perfect marriage between a croissant and a bagel.  These tasty pastries are awesome with cream cheese or as a breakfast sandwich!

Staff is friendly and accommodating and provide very quick service.
author: J G.

description:
I came here for some early morning fuel during a short trip to San Fran while exploring the city. I got a breakfast sandwich which was pretty good, great choice of bread for the ingredients but the eggs were a little too fluffy (almost runny) and I noticed the cook using pre cooked Kirkland bacon which was very thin, fresh thick cut bacon would have improved the taste of the sandwich immensely. The brew of the day was really good with a rich but not overpowering flavor. I had a sip of my friends iced mojito coffee which was unique and tasty, overall this little joint was pretty good and had some interesting ideas. I did find the limited seating to be irritating and was annoyed when my boyfriend got up from his uncomfortable bar seat to grab a coffee refill and had his seat swiped by a rude and pushy couple. 

On a completely separate note I do feel the need to point out that while browsing through other reviews I saw some highly unprofessional replies from the owner of the business and feel like based solely on that I would not consider returning to the restaurant as he seemed extremely hostile to any negative comments made by customers.
author: V S.

description:
My boyfriend and I first came here for lunch on a sunday while in SF for our anniversary. We ordered Pastromi and Turkey sandwiches and let me tell you! They were amazing!! 
I couldnt get over how fresh and tasty they were. Perfect thin meat and fresh bread from ACME. I also ordered a mocha and it was the best i had had while staying in SF. It just had an Mmm factor. 
This place is cute and the people are friendly and know everyone who walks in the tiny door. Give them a try and see for yourself! I will definately come back! Thank you!!
author: Stephanie G.

description: If you're looking for the best spicy chicken sandwich then you've come to the right place. The service was also incredibly friendly.
author: David N.

description: I had the toast cup and the cragel. Both were good. It's mostly the novelty though, I think. Definitely not the most incredible items I've had, but very Instagram worthy and pretty good. I mostly docked a star for barely there seating and the slow service time.
author: Judy S.

description: Meh.. The chai latte was so watery & tasteless. Ice latte was ok though. There was a queue (seems to be the sf theme) but I don't think the coffee is worth queuing up for..
author: Jenn H.

description:
Best bacon egg and cheese in a long time. Reminded me of the days of grabbing one from a deli on first ave in the 60's and off to an office I went. Really I went to an office many moons ago. 

We had it on a "cragel" (croissant-bagel). Great invention. 
Look hard for the place. No signs to tell u "I'm here"
author: Jonathan P.

description: Love this place!  Best egg salad sandwich ever!  Great coffee!  Always go there when in the city... don't miss it...
author: Sue P.

description: Amazing food and coffee in a warm, clean environment. The owner is amazing and always a treat to interact with. I personally love the Spicy Chicken sandwich and Mint Iced Mojito coffee.
author: Eduardo S.

description:
Truly a nice little hole in the wall cafe, and I do mean hole in the wall. There is one table, several barstools at a counter inside, and one table outside. I have a feeling there is a lot of quick eats or to-gos that happen here. They seem to be known for their Cragel- part bagel, part croissant. I got their breakfast sandwich with sausage egg and cheese, the wife got simply cream cheese both on Cragels. Her sandwich actually looked better than mine, more simplistic. But don't get me wrong my sandwich was just great and the Cragel was very unique and definitely worth stopping by to try. Two guys working were very nice and very helpful. The only thing I was bummed about was that they sold out of the toast cups that looked really cool. The fellow working the counter said they are usually gone by 9:30. We were at the Duckhorn winery full book tasting at the Sir Francis Drake all day, the day before. So It was going to take a hell of a lot more than a toast cup to get my ass out of bed early. 
Check em out.
author: Mike P.

description: Coffee was excellent but over priced. Bagel sandwich is okay though they couldn't handle not adding bacon even though I asked several times. Also nowhere for those waiting for take out orders to stand while you wait (and wait and wait) for your order.
author: Rachel B.

description: A great coffee for a pick me up in the morning. Extremely tidy and lively. Nothing else that a man needs than a fresh cup of coffee.
author: William A.

description: A MAGNIFICENT addition to the recent spur of hybrid foods, their cregal is WOAH. Go simple with just cream cheese and you won't regret it. It was busy but is still somewhat of an undiscovered gem. Hop on it before it becomes Mr Holmes busy. Will definitely be going back.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I came in because I was in the area for a quick bite to eat and some coffee. I ordered drip coffee and a sausage/egg/cheese sandwich one a "cragel". The cragel itself was kind of burnt but still yummy. The sausage was cut up into slices which made eating the sandwich difficult because the pieces kept falling out. Why is that a thing? With so many cafes in the area I don't think I'll be back.
author: Cameron R.

description:
Small hole in the wall place with limited seating to eat/drink in. 
Coffee was EXCELLENT
author: Andrew S.

description: I had the pastrami sandwich and a decaf latte breve. The sandwich was good, but not out of this world. I liked the flaky bread and the mayo. The menu stated the sandwiches came with cucumber and arugula; I didn't see either in mine.  The menu is pretty straight forward, nothing inventive. Bottom line, this place has solid sandwiches and is a cute place to sit and have a coffee.
author: AB H.

description: The breakfast sandwich is perfect. I have eaten it the last 3 mornings! I always come here when I'm staying near union square.
author: Sykes D.

description: Blew my expectations out of the water. Great vibes with excelent coffee and supurb food. 10/10. You MUST try the tofu veggie sandwich and Mojito coffee.
author: Klein T.

description: Extremely rude. What a shame. I came for a coffee with my happiest mood in a sunny afternoon and this guy almost spoiled it all. He could not be more unpleasant. The kind when you ask what's in the morning glory cake he points at the menu without saying a word and rolling his eyes. Keep your cake, dude. I'll keep my happy mood ;-)
author: Musa R.

description:
I tried the breakfast cup that everyone is raving about. This cafe was only a block from our hotel, which was great given all the surrounding hills. I needed something to curb my hunger pains until we hit a lunch spot. 

The place is super small. There are only a couple of seats inside and a bench outside. I asked to buy a couple of the cups and they warmed them up for us.

We sat outside on the bench and began eating it. The crust was burnt and the inside was totally overdone. I'm glad for the egg (for a protein fix) but the substance was a completely overdone egg and it was hard. We were pretty disappointed. 

The staff were really friendly and they are super quick with processing orders. Perhaps next time I visit the cups will be fresh!
author: Maria C.

description: If you're looking for a cozy coffee shop with fantastic sandwiches and delicious coffee, this is the place. I was surprised to see a  bulgogi sandwich on the menu and even more surprised at how authentic and delicious the bulgogi tasted. Coupled with ice brewed mojito coffee served in a mason jar, this late morning snack hit the spot! Despite its popularity, the service seas quick, but seating is limited in typical small coffee shop fashion
author: Alex W.

description:
While I don't live in the area, so I can't compare to any other local places, the coffee and food here was the perfect start to a fantastic Sunday in San Francisco. Also got a chance to learn what a Cragel was... was certainly not disappointed!

Also the coffee here is fantastic.
author: Magnus M.

description: Great service and yummy food and coffee! Never had a croissant and bagel so had to try the cragel. It's delicious. The eggs were cooked perfectly. Awesome little cafe.
author: Liz D.

description: Great spot for breakfast! Wish they had larger seating area.
author: Victoria G.

description:
My wife and I were looking for a quick sandwich and Beanstalk was on our way home.  The reviews looked great so we were excited to check it out.  Unfortunately the woman taking our order was not very helpful as we asked what the Bulgogi sandwich was.  After we paid, we wanted to get a drink so we got one and they tried to charge us for the sandwich again.  And end of he day, the sandwich was just ok.

Too many other great sandwich spots in the city that I'd recommend over Beanstalk.
author: Blake B.

description: Such an adorable spot to grab a latte and a breakfast sandwich! It can be a bit tricky to find a table, especially around 10am on a Saturday, but the cragel sandwiches and latte art are worth it!
author: Stacey D.

description: Dug it! Tiny, tiny hole in the wall in the middle of the city. Very nice service. I had my first cragel. The coffee drinks are good. Keep in mind the place is tiny, so you're lucky if you get a place to sit like we did, but the vibe is so cool and is worth checking out. With so many good coffee shops in SF, was hard NOT to come back. But, I was only visiting for two days. I'll come back next time I'm in town, for sure.
author: Joe R.

description: I was very upset because I saw decent reviews. Terrible service. My brother ordered a decaf cappuccino and accidentally picked up another persons coffee and the owner blamed him. Poured out his coffee. I ordered an Americano and I paid and she didn't make my coffee. I had to tell the other worker to make it. Don't go here.
author: Lizzy N.

description:
The Beanstalks 500th review!  So glad to be the 500th reviewer for the Beanstalk Cafe.  These guys are brewing up some of the meanest beans in the city.  I just don't feel the same if I don't get my morning toast cup!  

Excellent service, always friendly and fast!
author: Jeffery H.

description: Toast cup was interesting. Although it was not warmed the entire way through. It's an interesting concept: a slice of bread pounded thin and wrapped around an egg with a layer of bacon in between. Coffee was hot and strong. Small area for seating.
author: Karen B.

description:
hubby and i were walking around chinatown and wanted to grab some food to go for our flight home. walked up to beanstalk cafe and ordered take out. 

we ordered their breakfast egg cup with bacon. bacon was drained of fat and then baked with egg and a wrapper of dough. good for a quick bite to eat and on the go. 

we also got their latte and their bulbogi sandwich. coffee was lukewarm, sandwich  had good meat. overall, a good meal just didn't wow us over. 

cute decor and nice stop over on your way to japantown.
author: Mimi C.

description: Cool, tiny coffee place. Nice breakfast menu and superb coffee
author: Fede R.

description: Cragel bfast sandwich was delicious! Get the bacon instead of sausage though.
author: Ryan C.

description: My brother and I live across the street and go here every other day. This place is super cute and has amazing selection of food and coffee. Can't get enough
author: Caroline S.

description: This is my favorite coffee shop in San Francisco. I try to stop in every time I come to the city. Quick, good food, good coffee.
author: Andrew F.

description: Came by here for breakfast to check it out. I tried two of the toast cups, cool idea, but they are a bit like lavash baked with an egg. I wasn't that impressed. The coffee was okay, but nothing to write home about. I sat outside, they have a couple benches out there.
author: Jonah K.

description: The cragels are amazing. Small shop but always friendly staff and good food/coffee. A San Francisco staple for me!
author: Caitlin D.

description:
Walked in for lunch. Very small and clean, neat place. Very clean! Very cute. Although they have a wide variety of sandwiches, I decided to keep it simple and ordered a grilled cheese with pepper jack cheese. I waited for about five minutes--no sandwich. They were busy, so it was totally understandable. Waited another few minutes before I decided to ask where the sandwich was. Turns out someone else walked up and grabbed it! Could not believe it. The kind woman who took my order apologized and had the guys make my sandwich right away. She threw in a drink as she handed me my sandwich, still apologizing, even though it wasn't her fault! Anyway, it was the best grilled cheese I've ever had. Seriously amazing. Pesto and just the right amount of cheese. Bread was perfectly grilled (panini style, I think). I can't wait to go back tomorrow. Totally worth more than the $4 I paid. 

Update: returned today to get another grilled cheese. She remembered me. I'm not sure how on earth she can remember one person out of so many customers. Any way. Sandwich is awesome agin today.
author: Patricia J.

description: really good! Had the mojito iced coffee and a bagel with cream cheese, tomatoes, cucumber  and arugula. Ill be back next time Im in the city!
author: Julia S.

description:
overall - 3.3/5
----------------

food - 3/5
1) toast cup

service - 3/5

cleanliness - 3.5/5

location - 4/5

experience - 3/5

-----------------------
wait time: 5 mins (weekday, morning)
author: John V.

description:
Environment is welcoming and relaxing. People are genuine and awesomely kind. Go to Beanstalk if you want to get a sandwich, coffee, lemon cake or salad. 

They also have a cold brewed drip coffee machine that looks like it's from the set of breaking bad (fucking awesome coffee).

Coffee is something they are simply masters of here. Starbucks and Pete's Coffee and Tea cannot even compare to the level of excellence and attention to craft and flavor.
author: Conner H.

description:
If you are looking for a place to grab coffee/breakfast and go, this is the place for you! Beanstalk is a very cute and intimate cafe. It only seats up to 6 people inside. When I was here on a Saturday early afternoon, it was constantly packed with people, so it's definitely a very popular spot!

I came here mainly for the toast cups for breakfast, but turns out they stop making the toast cups after 1-2 hours after opening. I'll have to come back and try them another time.

For brunch, I'd recommend the breakfast sandwich. The breakfast sandwich had arugula, bacon, egg, and cheese. It was very tasty especially with the toasted but soft bread. 

I'll definitely come back if I am in the area, BUT I'm keeping in mind that it is a uphill walk from Union Square!
author: Melody Y.

description: This is my favorite bagel place in the neighborhood. I live close by and it's a pleasure to just go there have a coffee and work a on my laptop. The music is always awesome and never too loud. The only thing I don't like is that they don't have professional kitchen vents, which makes your clothes smell of food if you stay there for long.
author: Carola P.

description:
This place is small and pleasant. We came here after checking out of The Golden Gate Hotel. The service was wonderful, despite being obviously busy and overwhelmed. Unfortunately, it was really loud inside, but I guess that can slide because we really didn't have time to linger and relax. 

My husband got a latte that was beautiful and the sip that I tried was delicious. My onion bagel was SO GOOD. Warm, fresh, flavorful without being overwhelming, this bagel was probably the best I've ever had. I'd definitely love to come back early one morning and grab a decaf and a breakfast sandwich (when we inevitably return to The Golden Gate Hotel).
author: Kaitlin D.

description: Wow! Just perfect! We ate their cragel (croissant + bagel), two of my favorite things in one. It was delicious!
author: Raspberry B.

description:
Stopped by here after our flight got in and it hit the spot!

I got their morning breakfast sandwich (bacon, eggs, cheese, lettuce, tomato), which was quite yummy! It tasted fresh and clean.

Also got their iced coffee mojito brew which was what I needed after a 6 hour flight!
author: Sharon Y.

description:
Been here a few times; this place is fine as another neighborhood cafe; go in knowing some of the stuff below to help calibrate expectations. Also keep in mind it's quaint seating: 3 chairs around a small table and a few bar stools.

Toast cup is cute, but I agree that it's more a novelty as others have mentioned. Happy to have tried it once, but don't feel the urge to order it again. [Owner Collin would like to stress that it is simply supposed to be "a good source of protein as a morning food item", but the convenience of toast+egg+bacon in a compact form factor doesn't convince me to retry given the straightforward flavors.] It did inspire me to try making my own though, which was fun! The bread is flattened very thin here, which is hard to replicate with just a rolling pin and a hearty wheat instead of white. ;) If you're just looking for a reasonably priced, tasty meal on the go, a number of good banh mi shops will get you a filling sandwich for an extra $1 or two. But now that it's gotten you through the door, what else is there to order?

I've tried the breakfast sandwich to-go. The breakfast sandwich was a bit of a disappointment for the price; they microwave the egg to reheat it, although their bacon is toasted in an oven. And the arugula component is token at best. [Collin tells me to ask for more arugula next time; duly noted, but not noticeable at first with a takeout order.
