Also, they don't have a hood, so can't legally cook inside, darn.] Best part of this sandwich is by far the crispy yet soft bread, but for $8.43 you might as well try something more uncommon: the bulgogi sandwich.

I tried the bulgogi to-go another day, but was misled again a little by the older pictures on yelp. Looks like there's a lot more arugula in the earlier pics; both sandwiches skimped big time in comparison. And iceberg lettuce kind of sucks as a green in a sandwich to-go: the least nutritious of lettuces, it adds little but texture to a sandwich in the best case, and becomes a limp wet addition in the worst. On the upside, they do give you plenty of meat, moreso than you'd find in a typical banh mi since I mentioned it earlier. But it lacked that grilled caramelization on the meat edges that comes to mind when I think of bulgogi, oh well. [Collin says they braise the beef; thanks, so that explains that! I'm not asking to change the core recipe, but be aware if you had grilled in mind like I did at first.] They use the same tasty bread as in the breakfast sandwich, but that alone can't carry a $9 sandwich.

I've also tried both their mojito iced brew and their regular. Unfortunately my palate apparently isn't refined enough to appreciate this ice brew? I'll take philz' mojito pour over as a guilty sweet indulgence over this, haha. Oddly enough, the regular ice brew kinda reminds me of flavors I might have run into in a cocktail (unsweetened)...what is it, maybe absinthe?? I think that's the initial feeling that hit me when i first sipped the regular each time; kinda strange to me in a coffee. Have not had this impression in other cold brews elsewhere; must be the beans...nice to hear though that it's striking a chord with other more experienced coffee drinkers though!

P.S. Turned off by my banh mi comparisons? Ok, other examples of sandwich shops that strike a great flavor:price ratio include M&L Market near Duboce for a more deli-like sandwich, or Bakesale Betty in Oakland for fried chicken. If money were no object, I'd do places like Lunchpad and Sentinel more often, or maybe even Terminus, V-105, and OTD!
author: Linus W.

description:
Great spot for coffee and snacks. It's a bit blurry since we went here a couple months ago but I think we had this really yummy bugogi sandwich. Filled with tender and flavorful meat on some toasty bread, it hit the spot!

The cafe is quite small with minimal seating. Service was great! Super nice staff and our orders came out fast.
author: Schelly Y.

description:
I had the bulgogi sandwich, which was wonderful - not too heavy, with really good, flaky, soft bread.  

Also had the mojito coffee, which was okay.
author: Deepan M.

description:
Ok ok ok...I'm pretty sure there is a mad scientist making the menu items here.

1. The infamous "Cregel" is a Bagel shape and bagel on the inside and a flaky croissant on the outside. I think I prefer the Cregel & Cream cheese but the breakfast sandwich with the Cregel as the bread definitely is nothing to turn your nose up at. 

2. Toast Cup. It's like a muffin shaped toast with egg and bacon on the inside. They run out by 9am daily. It's really good

3. Mojito Cold Brew. It's as delicious as it sounds. There's even a mint leaf gracing you with its presence.

All in all, there are still solid staples like Contraband Cold brew and your classic bagels with cream cheese, but live a little, and try the mad scientist items, as they are sure not to disappoint. 

Last random facto- this is not a "cafe" where you sit down and get work done. There's one table and a long line(usually) so get in and get out and enjoy at a different location...you know...like that place you call "work".
author: Robert G.

description:
These reviews here are overblown. I ordered a breakfast croissant sandwich and the woman with heavy makeup put it in the toaster oven way too long and this person tried to cover it up by scraping all the burnt crust of the top of the croissant but that doesn't help because the ENTIRE sandwich was burnt black. I was late for work so I took it and left but had to throw it away. I can't believe they had the audacity to do this so here is my review.

And the coffee was terrible.
author: N A.

description: I've worked on the hill for 3+ years and never knew about this place! Cute, clean spot! Tried the iced mojito coffee. Delicious!
author: Joanna C.

description: Strong coffee, smooth almond cappuccino and delicious croissant egg and cheese breakfast sandwich. Stopped by for breakfast a few days before the Nike Women's Half Marathon. The line wasn't too long and I was able to score a seat at the bar. Cool spot to chill for a bit. Plus good wi-fi.
author: Fatimah M.

description:
Tiny, one table.
Tourist families abound.
Toast cup, or to go.
author: Nish N.

description: Breakfast, especially coffee is super important. Well, this cozy little Cafe serves both superbly well. Friendly service, excellent coffee, and fresh produce in the sandwich made our day. The options are limited, but try the morning sandwich and the toast cup. You will not be disappointed. Seating is very limited..but the local crowd turns over fast so you can snag a seat. This is not a place for large group seating.
author: Ankita S.

description:
Sweet little cafe with a small selection of food.  There are only two regular seats inside and three bar and then the outside a couple so it's only really good to go.

The lady making the coffee didn't put it in the glass like we requested and both coffees were luke warm.  After she heated them up it was delicious!

I are the lentil salad that was so good!
author: Adeline A.

description: Great cappuccino! Had the toast cup one day and the cragel the next. I was doing the happy dance when I ate each :)
author: Amy E.

description: A wonderful coffee shop! A true artist making the drinks (awesome espresso machine too!)... Quality drinks folks. Very quality. Add to this their friendliness and we have a winner! Note review is just for coffee... I never tried their food!
author: John W.

description:
-Great, friendly staff.
-not sure what everyone is raving about.. The bulgogi sandwich was meh. Not much flavor. 
-The coffee was not good. Being that I am from Seattle I think I have high standards. Ordered Americano and drip.
-small space with limited seating.
author: Sharon B.

description: Went in for quick lunch.  Small place but excellent sandwich with really fresh bread. Also had morning glory.  Delicious!!  If you need quick bite of bagel or sandwich and coffee this is the place.  Friendly staff. Would definitely go back again.
author: Russ Z.

description:
Wanting to grab a quick bite to eat for breakfast, my friends and I dropped by Beanstalk Cafe. It is pretty tiny, so if you have a big group, you might need to squeeze! They have a small table on the side and three or four counter seats. 

Bagel and Cream Cheese is $3.50. The quality of the bagel is quite top notch! But at $3.50 a bagel, my wallet is saying this place can't be a regular breakfast stop. (I mean, if I go to the bagel shop at home, $3.50 will get me a bagel sandwich with eggs, ham, and cheese!) 

My friends ordered the bulgogi sandwich ($8.50) and the toast cup ($3.50). They said those were really delicious too! It doesn't seem like they skimp on the meat for the sandwiches, so I definitely want to come back and try!
author: Christine S.

description:
The place has no plugs so if you plan working there make sure you have enough battery, and the wifi wasn't amazing. 
Also last time I ordered a chai latte I got a cup of milk and foam with tea bag on top, so not the best. 
Other than that delicious sandwiches, very affordable and cool staff (y)
author: Sophie G.

description: Hidden gem and wonderful place for brunch to sit and catch up with friends. I loved my breakfast sandwich and the croissant bagels look interesting/yummy. The decor inside is hipster/ very cozy with brick walls and bright natural light. Seating is limited.
author: Joyce H.

description:
This little cafe was right around the corner from our hotel so we decided to give it a try for breakfast. The place is tiny, not much seating area but the food and customer service made up for it. We had the breakfast sandwich which was around $10. Its a bit pricey but it was delicious. Wait time was about 10 minutes because they're made fresh. The sandwich had cheese, eggs, bacon, lettuce and tomato. Its pretty big so it'll fill you up. 

Overall, great place to stop by to grab a bit to eat or some coffee.
author: Judy V.

description: I came here for a quick breakfast and was very pleased. The lattes were great and the toast cups were savory, adorable and just enough for breakfast without being too filling. I would like to come back and try their breakfast sandwiches when I have more of an appetite. The man at the register (possibly the owner) was very welcoming and took time to explain the menu to me despite the line of customers and morning rush.
author: Nicola L.

description:
Came here from our hotel based off of the yelp reviews. 

Seemed like the toast cups were the thing to get but she said that they were out of waffle cups. Major fail. Never should anything be sold out. It sucks that it effects my stars but it is what it is. I'm from out of town. Came here for your speciality and now in disappointed. I ordered the breakfast sandwich instead. Eggs, cheese, arugula, tomatoes and bacon. Good. Bread was good. Tasty but nothing I couldn't get anywhere else. We also ordered coffee. He got the 18 hour drop (iced) and I got the vanilla latte (iced). Coffee was good. The 18 hour drip would definitely wake you UP! 

The seating like most other cafés around was scarce. Tiny. Two or three table tops for 2 person seating. Not a big deal except when jerks that eat and want to sit and chat despite the face that people are standing while they are resting is annoying! 

Overall we paid about $19 for two iced coffee drinks and 1 breakfast sandwich. Would I go back? Not necessarily. Was it good? Yes. Was it anything to rave about? No. But I have to say quality was good and maybe if I had the toast cups my opinion would be better!
author: Ida A.

description: The veggie sandwich/ avocado, the coffee and the toast cups were all very tasty. The bread on my sandwich was a little hard, but tasty all the same. The major problem with this place is the lack of seating. With one table and a three stool bar, it was impossible for my family and I to sit together. If your looking for a yummy to-go coffee/breakfast cafe, then this is the place for you.
author: Kim K.

description: Stopped by for breakfast. Reasonable prices, very tastefull sandwiches, and quick service. Perfect place for people on the go. If I'd stayed in city later, I'd definetly go here again.
author: Knut Olav S.

description:
Been in the states for 3 weeks and had shit coffee up until now.
Price is very fair, and the sandwiches were good and reasonably portioned.

The staff are friendly and care about their job. I noticed Collin respond to a lot of reviews while I looked this place up.

Would come back, but I live in Australia.
author: Sunny Z.

description: Great food and good service, but they got my order wrong. I wanted a sausage bagel sando, but they gave me a bacon one instead. The food was delicious nonetheless, but I would appreciate if they could've gotten my order correct. Solid coffee.
author: Anny L.

description: The breakfast sandwich had way too much egg on it but otherwise was pretty good. This place wasn't anything special and was too small. The line was out the door but was only ~10 people long. There was not enough seating and the street was dirty so did not invie you to want to eat outside either.
author: Justin E.

description:
Although this place might only have a table and a few chairs, it's a favorite of mine to grab breakfast, lunch or snacks whenever I'm in that part of SF.  Try the toast cup, waffles and cakes with a dose of their Contraband medium roasted coffee or espresso.  If you're hungry, order the bulgogi sandwich with a latte to counter the spicy sauce if you can't handle a little heat.  

The owner and staff are superfriendly and nice with exceptional customer service.  They definitely know how to treat people well and make them feel at home.  It's no wonder why every dog drags their owner to this cafe to check out their treats.  The only draw back is their restroom in the back, which is tiny and with wet wipes instead of a sink.  However, this is not a problem if you're just grabbing something on the go.
author: Jenny L.

description: Drip coffee was smooth and not too acidic. On the day I went, they opened at 8AM but wasn't ready to serve breakfast food at 8:00 - 8:30AM :/ so I couldn't try their toast cups and Cregels :( I'll be back next time to try their breakfast foods.
author: Jasmine L.

description:
Charming little coffee shop and the staff is super friendly! I'm always walking by this place at night after closing hours and when I finally made it to grab a quick little breakfas on a Saturday morning, it didn't dissapoint! I think their menu has great options, their drip coffee was delicious, and the service was fairly quick. My only complaint would be the prices seem a teeny bit overpriced for a breakfast sandwich...but then again, it's SF. 

Definitely a great place to grab a quick, quality breakfast.
author: Mayra M.

description: This simple, very small spot has what may be the perfect breakfast sandwich.  It's absolutely delicious.  That, plus good coffee and friendly service make this a great place to stop by when you're near Nob Hill in the morning.
author: Greg B.

description: The toast cups were out today after reading fellow Yelpers recommendation so I settled for the cragel. The lighter fluffier composition of a croissant and the density of a bagel made for a novelicious hybrid of a pastry! Loved their mocha too. If they keep introducing tasty and innovative breakfast items, the positive reviews of Beanstalk will surely continue to climb. Love their music selection & service was personable as you would expect of a small outfit. But be warned there's but only one round table that comfortably seats four and a bar counter for three. Be prepared for a takeout.
author: Stan L.

description:
Tucked in an otherwise non-description block in the TenderNob, Beanstalk Café presents solid breakfasts and lunches, along with good coffee. 

Clad in white subway tile, the small space is bright and cheery. However, with only one table and a few counter spaces, be prepared to take your delicacies elsewhere to eat. 

Filled with egg, bacon, and your choice of toppings, the delicious toast cup ($3.50) is a great way to start your day. The Contraband pour over/drip coffee ($2.50) is perfectly made. Piled high with shredded chicken, baby arugula, pickled cucumbers, lettuce, jalapeños, and a piquant sauce and served on a toasty fresh baked sourdough roll, the spicy chicken sandwich ($8.50) is a treat--and big enough to share. Made fresh daily, the lentil salad ($4) was delicious. 

The delightful Korean lady behind the counter is sweet and welcoming. Service is fast and friendly. The selection of drinks is limited, and those wanting a Diet Coke will be disappointed. 

The wonderful sandwiches at Beanstalk Café are worth the hike up the hill from Union Square.
author: CJ G.

description: Nice ambience; mediocre service and goods.  If you're selling cold brew, you should offer simple syrup. Regular sugar doesn't melt in cold coffee.
author: B J.

description: Nice little place. Good ingredients.  Basic food. Goodman spot to stop and grab a sandwich.  The owners are very friendly and hard working.
author: Jason G.

description: This cosy little shop has friendly service and an awesome barista! The espresso was delicious. Bold and rich, but so smooth with a hint of chocolate. We also ordered a cappuccino, to which my boyfriend said "it was depressing, because I'll never have one (cappuccino) as good ever again. The foam was so perfectly frothy creamy exquisite. We must come back." Yep lol. Our sandwiches off the specials board was delicious. Can't remember the name sorry. It consisted of a good roll that was crisp but soft in the middle, fluffy scrambled eggs, cheese, tomatoes bacon and arugula. The size of the sandwich was satisfying, paired with the espresso was great. I was able to finish it and still walk around the city without needed a nap. We sat on the bench in front of the cafe and enjoyed every second of this breakfast.
author: Jacqulene A.

description:
Totally loved this spot. We got the single table outside on a beautiful day for lunch. Couldn't have been better. 

I had the Iced Mojito Cold Brew to begin, and it did not disappoint.  Fresh mint sprigs complimented the creamy coffee goodness perfectly.  And the Korean Bul Gogi Sandwich was to die for. I don't like cucumbers, so I ordered the sandwich without, and it was phenomenal. Perfectly tender beef and a big sandwich to boot - I could only eat half! 

Service was super friendly - brought our drinks and sandwiches out to us - and quick!

Only thing to keep in mind is that this spot is fairly small, so probably not ideal for big groups, and you may have to wait to sit.
author: Noelle F.

description: Fab French-ish Korean-ish cafe. Will definitely be back. Try the bulgogi sandwich. It's fast and delicious. The drip coffee is also superb quality.
author: Stuart T.

description: Great breakfast spot! Went and got their unique and signature "toast cup" which was bread with an egg baked in it in a cupcake shape and was a yummy not overly rich breakfast and just what I wanted. People I was with got bagels or breakfast sandwiches. They also made a delicious cold brew coffee served in a mason jar. Not much seating though - 1 indoor table and a couple bar stools and a bistro table outside. Nice low key vibe.
author: S G.

description:
Highlights
- Bulgogi sandwich for lunch! That's all I need share and all that you need to order from this cafe, trust me! 
- Bulgogi sandwich: beef is tender and flavored well with some fresh greens, cheese, onions, and tomatoes on toasted crunchy baguette. Delicious when it is warm and fresh!
- They have the cutest salt and pepper shakers on the tables. 
- The perfect quick lunch pit stop or a grab and go type of place. 

Improvements
- This place is very small, a few stools and tables inside as well as outside. 
- Really warm inside the cafe during the lunch hour, but the place is really small so that is expected. 
- I wish it was closer to the downtown area, it's quite a trek uphill to get to this cute spot. 

Tip
- I need to come back to try the breakfast toast cup!
author: Tracy T.

description: Nice coffee place close to the Union square! Egg salad bagel sandwich was good!
author: Griffin B.

description:
My significant other is always hungry when she wakes up in the morning so Beanstalk Cafe saved me on my most recent trip up to SF. I like how they open up early and have a variety of breakfast / brunch / lunch savory and sweet items available. It wasn't too far from the Stanford Court where we were staying but the uphill is always a battle.

It's a very small boutique cafe, very cute, and I like the NY feel. Ordered the Bulgogi sandwich as many yelpers recommended and it was pretty good. I didn't know they had cheese in the sandwich, and as you know I don't like cheese, and I could have sworn that it didn't state it on the menu when it listed the ingredients. It wasn't a big deal but I like the option of not having melted cheese on my sandwich.They have coffee, juice, sweet and savory items.

If I was staying in the Nob Hill area again, this would probably be my to go place for a non sit down place / to go.
author: Stanley C.

description:
Three words. Beef bulgogi sandwich!! It's so good and my go to every time! 

I don't drink coffee myself but love taking my many out of town guests to one of my favorite neighborhood spots :) The owner is so sweet and makes the experience even better! If you're looking for yummy coffee, breakfast & lunch sandwiches and  service with a smile, you are at the right place!
author: Kelly L.

description:
This is the perfect little cafe. When I travel, this is exactly the kind of unique, delicious, low-key place I love to find. I tried the mojito iced brewed coffee, which was very lightly sweetened and had the perfect amount of cream. And sure, the coffee was great, but let's just have a brief moment of silence for the Toast Cup...

Okay. That was fun. It's amazing! They're small, so if you have a large appetite, I might recommend ordering two. It's a thin bread cup with cheese, bacon, and an egg. The cheese was a very welcome surprise! Their sandwiches are also amazing. The bread is perfectly crusty on the outside, but sandwich soft on the inside. 

Although I didn't try everything on the menu, I can definitely say that you absolutely need to try this place!
author: Jordan S.

description:
After walking blocks on end and seeing Starbucks' at every corner, it's refreshing to see these small shops like Beanstalk Cafe. 

Really cool hole in the wall café. Small, yet the customer service, the fresh brewed coffee and freshly made breakfast bagels made this experience awesome for these San Diegans.
author: Eddie N Christine D.

description: Great place in the neighborhood! Good coffee, awesome staff, and delicious food. Need I say more? Definitely stop by if you're in the area, it's worth it.
author: Lisa H.

description: Really nice spot...if you're looking for an oasis from the business of the city. Tasty food, good coffee and genuinely, sincerely friendly service. Keep up the great work!
author: Cal M.

description: What a perfect cafe! I am sitting here enjoying an excellent sandwich (Bulgogi), and solid cup of coffee. Love this place.
author: Mike A.

description: Been here a couple of times now. The bread has the perfect crunch without being too hard or chewy. The bulgogi sandwich and egg sandwich are fantastic, plus the employees are friendly which always is nice!  Inside the shop it's always too warm for me so I take my food to go, but I've seen others dine inside.
author: Susan G.

description: OMG! So delicious! My husband made me hike up Powell road with a suitcase and laptop bag to find his place but it was well worth it! Try the bulgogi sandwich and the veggie sandwich. Amazing!
author: Stephanie G.

description: I ordered a latte here that was really good, boyfriend had an ice coffee which he said was solid. There wasn't any seating though and it's not exactly a very inviting place to hang out, also pretty tiny. We had to sit outside on some bench to enjoy our drinks but it was kind of a place where you feel an urgency to just get your drink and go. Unfortunate for me, because I see a cafe as a place to hang out and write, or just get some peace time.
author: Lisa T.

description:
like a wonderful breadth of fresh air in the busy, busy financial district. their light blue walls and eccentric plates make you forget for a second all the chaos that is outside. 

their menu is simple - consisting of a few craft sandwiches (think decked out breakfast sandwiches loaded with a delicious mayo-like sauce, bacon, egg, arugula, etc.), their popular toast eggs, some sweets (cookies, breads), juices, and coffee. the prices are decent for sf, think around $9 for a sandwich, and the restaurant is a refreshing change from your usual weekend brunch routine. come in for a quick-ish, and relatively cheap meal!

a couple of notes-
-the place is small with limited seating, so you might have to take your food to go or share a table
-not a study cafe here! too small for that
-the toast eggs ran out when i went there around 10:30am on a sunday
author: Patricia K.

description: Love the decor! So bright and airy. Coffee was strong and delicious. Bagels were a bit bland.
author: Savvy P.

description: Best almond milk latte in town. The staff is super friendly and the space is clean and well lit. My only request is that I wish they had a rewards program.
author: Beth W.

description:
Okay, I just get a chance to see what's happening here. Okay I'm sorry, maybe it's not 50 cent in SF  but it's not 2.50!
And thank you for your nice respond!
author: Meshal A.

description: I went there for their toastcup. It's really small and overpriced. The have this really big breakfast sandwiches that can be served as a whole meal. The four dollar latte's pretty good.
author: Fei S.

description: Beanstalk is the cutest coffee and sandwich store! Cold brew coffee here was amazing, and I'm inclined to come back to try the Bulgogi Sandwich. The store has limited seating, one indoor table, one outdoor, and a few bench seats, but the decor here is very tasteful and makes it a relaxing place to sip on your cup o' joe.
author: Arthur C.

description: This spot is so cute and the people are wonderful. We got the famous toast cups which were pretty good, but the winner was the iced latte, it was fantastic! One of the workers was also kind enough to make us some simple syrup on the spot to put in our lattes. Great service!
author: Shabnam E.

description: The egg & bacon in a bread cup is definitely novel but unfortunately not much more. At $3.50, you almost have to compare the item to an egg sandwich at any corner deli which is much more filling. Definitely something to try once to satisfy a morning craving.
author: Julia K.

description: Decent coffee shop by Union square. Great breakfast sandwiches, serving them on a cragle(croissant bagel). A few single origin bean options but they need to work on their pour overs, the one we had was under extracted and very bland and watery.
author: Joey G.

description: Neat little coffee shop that also serves breakfast and lunch. Stopped in to try their "morning sandwich", very tasty and fresh. The staff was super friendly and my sandwich was made quickly. Cant comment on the coffee, but everyone else was drinking it and it looked and smelled good, just not a coffee guy.
author: Dan P.

description:
Cute spot worth checking out in the neighborhood. They use Contraband coffee so you're getting better than Starbucks/Peets. They have an interesting breakfast dish which consists of cup (made from toast!) with egg and bacon inside. Worth trying.

The place is well designed, clean and inviting. Not exactly a spot to work out of but maybe drop by for to go or for a quick chat with folks.
author: Victor W.

description:
Definitely my favorite café in SF downtown and I plan to frequent it as much as possible! 

Food-- tried the dark chocolate mochi and the Korean bulgogi sandwich. Both are delicious; the sandwich is made of fresh ingredients; and the choices are interesting enough and not typical of what you would find at bakeries/diners around Powell.

Service-- friendly cashier and an even friendlier Korean lady (is she the owner/manager?)! She is adorable, cleans up meticulously, and

Miscellaneous-- central downtown location + good value for money + cute décor (both interior & exterior... Although the shop sign could use a stronger color to make it stand out more as the pale blue doesn't quite catch the eye)
author: Izzah F.

description: Nice cafe with good coffee, a tasty cragel (my first but not my last!) and friendly quick service.  Cragel was very big and rich and I ended up sharing it with a friend.  So now you have 2 more fans!
author: Pinky T.

description: This place is the cutest place we went to while visiting San Francisco! GREAT coffee & the creamiest chai I've ever had. I had the asiago bagel & it was delicious. The cold drip coffee is beautiful & this place gets a lot of sun. A perfect place to spend a brisk morning in San Francisco.
author: Courtney H.

description: Came to try a cragel  but served me French bread and wouldn't fix the order. Disappointing. Otherwise good but pricey. Still mad ab not getting to try the cragel. :(
author: Xena F.

description:
I was searching for a sandwich spot for my one day in San Francisco and found this place. I got the Pesto Turkey Sandwich which was very well made. They put a lot of turkey and toppings on making each bite delicious and filling. It came with arugula, lettuce, tomato, cucumber, and mayo, the french bread is also very tasty.

You also must get the toast cup - its an egg, bacon, and cheese wrapped in a croissant like dough. It was delicious and so easy to eat! I also got a drip coffee and it tasted great.
author: Erica N.

description: Food is good...not good enough for five stars but they have pretty good sandwiches. The owners are friendly and polite but the place is not one where you would dine in.
author: Jenna J.

description:
Oh Beanstalk, my go-to breakfast stop-over spot on the way to work. I like everything about this place:

- friendly lady at the counter (I'm embarrassed that after all of my visits, I still don't know her name)
- efficient service
- short and to-the-point menu
- tasty and filling food

I normally get the breakfast sandwich or a cragel with cream cheese. Both hit the spot every time. If you're looking for something that's more filling, grab the breakfast sandwich. The bread is crunchy and soft and the egg is fluffy. The cragel is more of a small treat - very moist and sweet; I normally inhale it in under 2 minutes, it's THAT good!

The coffee is tasty but that's not what keeps me coming back.
author: Liza K.

description: Staff was super friendly and will definitely brighten your day. Pretty small place, so don't expect to come and sit down. The spicy chicken sandwich was really good, though not all that "spicy". Coffee prices etc. are all very reasonable for San Francisco
author: Connor S.

description: The coffee stop before shopping at union square! Shop interior design was made all from hand, and very well too. The sunlight comes is just at the right angle, and if corse and the coffee is great. We got a latte, mocha, and cappuccino and they all looked amd tasted great!
author: Joey C.

description:
Go here, get the bulgogi sandwich, and thank me later. Seriously. The bread was perfect - not too crispy, not too soft. There was plenty of meat and fillings on the inside. I wasn't even feeling bulgogi, but I got it because my girlfriend wanted to try it along with the muffin and coffee she got. So glad I listened to her. One of the best sandwiches I've had in quite some time.

Seating is a bit tight, with room for less than 10 people inside, so expect to eat somewhere else in all likelihood. Not a bad thing considering you're in San Francisco and there's always a park or bench within walking distance, but just a heads up.
author: Akshay A.

description:
The toast cups are absolutely amazing and the iced coffee is straight jet fuel. You have to stop here for breakfast. Super pleasant staff makes it even better.
Plan on getting your food to go. The place is super tiny.
author: Ryan C.

description:
First time today, traveling here from
Boston and the reviews sent me here.  The iced brew is incredible and the cragel is excellent.  But what I loved was the atmosphere.  As a solo traveler I got to meet new people while sharing a table, and I felt like this cafe welcomes that kind of interaction.  Great way to start my 2nd day in SF!!!
author: Jen C.

description: Great food. Loved the bugogi sandwich. The chicken sandwich is not bad either. Highly recommended.
author: Cecily S.

description:
This is a perfect little stop. 

Delicious contraband coffee and they definitely know how to do a good pour-over. A great stop. 

Cute and yummy pastries (this weekend they had little cakes from Mochi Rabbit that were gluten-free!! Delicious. I recommend the almond one.) and a nice and welcoming decor. Limited seating- but a great place to grab and go- without the line that some coffee shops can get. 

Both days I was there, they thanked me for waiting (for the drip/pour-over)- good coffee is always worth waiting for.
author: Nicole H.

description: Great spot for a quick bite, breakfast and lunch, very tasty. Staff friendly and helpful. Coffee is the best and they have delicious Almond Milk. Breakfast sandwich is our fav!
author: John H.

description: love! quaint, yummy and i think some black pepper & Tabasco on my toast cups are a must for next time, yummy! I'll take three for me and 5 for him! place is supper small only one little bistro type table inside and i think two outside. DON'T BRING A GANG OF PEOPLE AND EXPECT TO BE SEATED, literally it's a tiny "pick up and go" sort of cafe  :-)  nice though!
author: Gloria H.

description:
Great experience, people were friendly, food was delicious, only negative is that space is (really) tight, the whole restaurant is one room, (kitchen included).  
Will be a shock if you're a tourist, but worth it anyway...
author: Austin L.

description:
Visited SF for the weekend and found myself starving before hotel check-out, so I decided to scout the area. Found this lovely cafe with bulgogi sandwich. They got me at bulgogi. The beef was flavorful and the whole sandwich tasted really well with cheese, lettuce, tomato, and arugula. Ate the other half a couple of hours later, still yummy.

I got the bf a breakfast sandwich, he said it's the best breakfast sandwich he's ever had. 

Ps, I ordered through the eat24 here, and apparently, they told me that it's inefficient so it's better to use their app or just call! Wasn't that long of a wait, but FYI, in case they're busy! 

Will come back and recommend to friends!
author: Marta R.

description: Huge improvement on my last visit! Had the veggie sambo and it was good, fresh and tasty and the bread was excellent...again had no coffee, but a very good sambo at a decent price.
author: Reg B.

description:
As good as everyone says. The toast cup doesn't taste exactly as if expected--but it's better. Unlike anything I've had (and I love breakfast). Indulgent without being too much/rich. Perfect breakfast!

Might have to come back for lunch!
author: Laura S.

description: Found this place on yelp and decided to try it out while on vacation with my wife. It turns out to be a GEM! I highly recommend this place specially if you like bagels or croissants you have ever to try their craigle they are amazing! Also cold brew coffee here is delicious.
author: Victor G.

description: Great sandwiches, price point, cool interior, cozy place.
author: K W.

description: Very over priced. Iced brew was acidic. Normally a huge fan of this place (I took friends from out of town here all the time...) but was super disappointed this morning :(
author: Kicky X.

description: Small coffee cafe...great toast cups for breakfast and 14 hour brewed ice coffee....yum....really nice guys.
author: A J.

description: Small and trendy spot - exactly what I had in mind when I thought of San Francisco. Had their breakfast sandwich and latte. Both were really good. Definitely recommend checking this place out if you're nearby. I swung by on my last day in San Francisco and it looked like they were doing renovations so hopefully they'll open up more seating space soon.
author: Roy L.

description: The hazelnut latte was soooo good!  It had a perfect amount of flavor, not too sweet or overpowering on hazelnut, delicious coffee taste!  I wish it was a bigger cup though.  I also had a toast cup. It was smaller than I expected, but really good!
author: BB S.

description:
I was on a trip to San Francisco three weeks ago, and I still have dreams about the pastrami sandwich at Beanstalk Café. It was the most delicious one I have had in my life. The sandwiches are simple enough, but absolutely delicious. It is a charming little store front with friendly and efficient service. I finished my entire sandwich, even though I was full before it was gone: it was too good to waste! My sister had the roast beef sandwich which was also very good, but we both agreed that the pastrami was the best.
The only drawback is how small it is! Not much seating. Luckily it was a nice day and we were able to sit on the bench out front.
Beanstalk will definitely be my first stop when I'm back in San Francisco!
author: Gabrielle O.

description: One word: cragel...it's a challenge to live so close to this delicious cross between a croissant and a bagel since it's so irresistible. Add a cold brew and you've got a great breakfast or snack. The staff is super friendly and the quality of the food is top-notch. So happy that they are expanding!!!
author: Amanda C.

description:
Very quaint. The owner and cook recommended the breakfast sandwich. 
Colin the owner was so nice and personable ! Staff was great. A really good "local" gem !
author: Susie S.

description:
The barista was really helpful, he wanted to get my drink just right and he didn't get shitty when I tried to explain, in detail, what I wanted (you know how that can be).

My flat white was what I hoped for.   The cragles  (X between bagel and croissant) were okay - should have tried the toast cup.    My daughter thought the drip coffee tasted like weak diner coffee and did not finish it-
author: J M.

description: Came here for a sandwich and tried the pastrami - excellent! Not much seating but ideal if you are looking for something for a quick or if stopping by for a coffee.
author: Renee F.

description: I have to admit that the egg toast cups are way tastier than they look! But the coffee was terrible - tasted burnt and bitter. Could it be that I'm not enough of a coffee connoisseur? Perhaps, but either way, I had to throw it away and start over at Starbucks. That's a coffee fail. Oh yeah, and the girl who works there could smile. That would be a nicer way to start the morning.
author: Sara C.

description: The bulgogi sando is solid. Get it. Sit outside on the bench and people watch while you eat. Or perhaps take it to union square.
author: Misha T.

description: Was in the area for an appointment and wanted a quick breakfast.  Came across Beanstalk (almost missed it--it is tiny and the storefront was being renovated), and was intrigued by the cragel.  Ordered the cragel breakfast sandwich without meat.  Tasty!  Sort of a slightly denser/more robust croissant in a bagelish/roll shape.  Nice taste and texture.  Only downside is it is very small inside, with just one table and a small counter against the wall, and was pretty hot inside both times I have been there.  Will be back, but might be better to pick up and take away.
author: Damian E.

description: We already went back for two more bulgogi sandwiches - yummy!  :)
author: Maile N.

description: They're planning to expand out to to the neighboring space so there will be more seating available this summer. Also, try the mochi bread!
author: Rose Y.

description: Pretty damn good for not having a real kitchen to work with. Good coffee. Breakfast sandwich was good sized and had fresh toppings. Great bread too.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Very good food and the owner is very friendly. They are soon finished with their renovation which will create more seating possibilities. 
Try the spicy chicken sandwich, it's very good.
author: Teddy M.

description:
Got the spicy bugolgi sandwich. It was so yummy and you could definitely split it between two people (I ate a whole one by myself but it was fantastic!) 

I liked that the atmosphere of the place was very friendly and very welcoming. Though be warned they don't have any seating! One table inside and a little bar area. Or you can stand outside. But that's it!! (Was lucky enough to grab the only table available) 

You must go here though, I'm definitely planning on going back whenever I'm downtown!
author: Nicole W.

description: Delicious coffee and friendly staff.  They even chatted with us while our coffees were being made.
author: Megan C.

description:
GET THE TOAST CUP.

The toast cup is a perfect breakfast pastry with crispy bacon wrapped around an egg inside the pastry. Loved it!!

Iced Mojito Coffee is also pretty good with mint leaves on the bottom and semi-sweet flavors. Unlike other places where mint bits annoyingly and frustratingly gets in your mouth, the mint coffee here was stress-free and easy to drink with no mishaps.

The venue itself is very small with limited seating.
author: Katrina L.

description: Decent bagel and good coffee. They accidentally gave my bagel to the wrong customer, a small feat considering there was only 3 people in the cafe at the time, so I had to wait for them to remake.
author: Jim C.

description: Spicy chicken sandwich was really good!!! The place is small inside and if it's busy it will be hard to get a seat but it's very cute inside and has a large variety of coffee and tea drinks that you can order. My whole family enjoyed their meal
author: Eve G.

description: This was a great place for brunch. The atmosphere was very peaceful and inviting, while all the staff were extremely nice. It was a very fast order and were in and out in a zippie. Now to the drinks. We got the Americano and latte and they were both amazing. And of course onto the food. I got the Bulgogi sandwich, while my friend got the roast beef sandwich. They were both great. The crust was extremely crunchy, the crum was soft, and all the flavors blended really well together.
author: Daryl D.

description: Coffee wasn't that good, sandwiches were great but the atmosphere a little dull.. maybe it's because we arrived only half an hour before they closed
author: Lihi Z.

description:
Such a quaint and unassuming spot just a short uphill (it gets steep) jaunt off of union square. If you're in the area getting your shop on and need to quickly quell those hunger pangs, the bulbogi sandwich is a delicious combo of flavorful meat and crusty french baguette. A good stiff latte and then you're good to go. 

The breakfast cups also seem like a hit. Seems like a regular spot for locals and the no fuss service with a smile is a plus. 

A great quick bite stop for the area.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Loved the atmosphere, the food and drink and the friendly employees! 
I had the veggie sandwich which was so good! Has this yummy spicy sauce in it that made it unique
author: Maya M.

description: It's a nice place to start your morning. The roast beef sandwich was excellent and healthy. Although the place is a little small, they have nuce chairs for you to enjoy the breakfast.
author: Yi H.

description: Tasty bulgogi sandwich and an interesting mint coffee. I wish they had more comfortable seating but it's a tiny place. Great roll for the sandwich.
author: Casey A.

description: A great bagel and an excellent cup of coffee, served quickly. If it had been a busy time, there might not have been anywhere to sit. But there are a few seats indoors and a couple on the sidewalk, so it's a good spot to sit for a mid-morning coffee.
author: Robin D.

description:
OMFGGGGG, Bulgogi Brunch Sandwich FTW!!  This was a cute little place north of Union Square that has the best service, food and drinks in the area.  Nob Hill, such a good neighborhood full of hidden gems, I need to come here more often.  I really loved the close proximity to all the shopping and just a short hike north will bring you here.  The place seems to be known for the Spicy bulgogi sandwich and there are numerous pics of it on yelp.  I found it on my mobile app and knew I had to stop here for food.  Was feeling tired and groggy from last nights Yelp Celebratory drinking and this was my quick fix. 

Had the Green Tea and a touch of some raw sugar in it to pep me up.  Paired well with the sandwich no doubt.  The cheese was melted and gooey just the way I like it and was not overpowering in the sandwich.  Very easy to eat and clean.  I finished it quick and was on my way to shop down in Union Square LOL.  I felt like I had energy to take me through the rest of the day and was ready to continue partying on our Epic Cruise ship around the bay that night, HAHA.  

QUICK BITE PERFECTION!  True SF Gem!
author: Kenny P.

description:
A small cafe with really friendly employees and great sandwiches! There is not much in terms of seating area, but most people coming in were getting food on the go.

I had the tofu veggie burger, which was mostly tofu but it was spicy and flavorful (and I really appreciated that they had vegan options for breakfast). I'd definitely come here again for lunch or breakfast!
author: Victoria T. G.

description:
Favorite new morning stop for quality coffee and breakfast bagels. 
All the ingredients are fresh and quality. 
The place itself is small and cozy, the employees always make me feel welcome which is rare for me. 
I go out of my way to come here- highly recommend it to my co workers,  friends and family.
author: Kyle B.

description: Lame. We read all these great reviews and I would hardly call this a breakfast place. It is tiny inside and the menu is small, too. I got a toast cup which tasted fine but was an egg inside bread. End of story. My husband said his waffle tasted like Bisquick and we saw her put Log Cabin maple syrup on it for him. We didn't get coffee but I can't imagine it was good enough to give this place more stars.
author: Ashley P.

description:
Phenomenal service 
Best hot pastrami I've ever had 
I will come here every time I'm in town
It's right around the corner from the JW marriott 
Short walk from Union Square
author: Chris C.

description: High quantity, savoury sauces, and cruncy bun. Great bite close to Union Square.
author: Josh C.

description: This is one of the best cafe places that I have went to. They have really creative names for their foods on the menu. I agree with the other reviewers on the toasted cups and the bulgogi sandwich.  I had read reviews before coming to the cafe and it has definitely lived up to my  expectations. The cold brew here are just about the same price as those at Starbucks but it tastes way better than the one at Starbucks. The Cold Brew here is actually cold brew. The cafe was a bit smaller than I expected. But it is definitely enough space for a couple to come eat or just to grab a quick breakfast at.
author: Andy W.

description:
Walk by here all the time to work. Great coffee with fast service and happy workers that know their way around the espresso machine very well.
Also the mochi are soooo good!!!
Can't wait till they finish expanding their shop.
author: Jay S.

description: I live up the street and Beanstalk became part of my weekly routine immediately. The owners are usually there which impacts the quality and warmth tremendously. They listen to their customers, always ask questions about our opinions, remember everyone's usual orders, are constantly evolving, and are never understaffed. The quality of the coffee and food is high and all the employees mirror the hospitality of the owners. Grateful for this small establishment!
author: Mollie C.

description: During our recent short stay in SF, this became our breakfast headquarters, as they had my intrigue with the toast cups, but had me longing for the bulgogi sammy with more gochujang(Korean hot pepper paste) daily. Sometimes, it's just a nice hearty fusion sandwich that everyone needs in getting their day started, and leave the fancy Michelin starred meals to later. Loved the toast cups as well(especially when you luck out grabbing one fresh out of the oven) but it would have been even more divine if they could master a soft boiled egg inside. Nevertheless, this small cafe has sold me, and become a spot I long to return to on my next visit to SF.
author: Peter L.

description:
Tasty iced mojito brew (mint and half and half) 
Not much seating - and not very comfy. More of a to go place.
author: Hayley T.

description: Such a cute place. Loved the mocha and the decor. It's a very small place, so I wouldnt plan to stay too long. I will definitely visit again!! Highly recommend!!
author: Abby T.

description: Great little place for coffee and some eats.   Many options on menu.   Wife had pesto Turkey sandwich and I just cragel.   Not a long wait for meal or drinks.   Latte and cold mocha very nicely prepared.   Would recommend stop in if near by
author: Craig T.

description: Don't understand the hype. Waited 15 minutes for a flavorless breakfast sandwich. Cute interior and definitely trendy but the food quality doesn't hold up.
author: Will L.

description: Small quaint coffee shop on Nob Hill in San Francisco with delicious mint mojito iced coffee.
author: Erika K.

description: As Aussies we ordered cappuccinos knowing that here in the States that's the closest thing you'll get to a flat white. When the guy heard our Aussie accents he asked if we wanted to change our order to 'flat whites'! Honestly the closest espresso coffee we've had to what we get back home (and we've been to a couple of "specialty" coffee places around here so far that did perfect latte art but the coffee didn't live up to its presentation). Wish we knew about this place on our first day here!
author: Adam L.

description:
I went in because I wanted a sandwich. What was served to me instead was a deliciously delicate work of art. I ordered the Bulogi (sp?) beef sandwich. They serve it hot, which was perfect as I had a 10 minute walk ahead and that would allow the sandwich to reach optimum eating temperature. Once I was able to sit down and indulge my tastebuds with this culinary delight, I was astounded at the complexity of the flavors that danced across my palate. "You're not supposed to do this with a sandwich", at least that's what you think. Guess what, they DID it, and you're grateful for it. The Bulogi (sp?) beef was not only the best $10 sandwich I've ever tasted, this little gem is in my top 5 all time sandwich highs.  

Bravo to the purveyors of this fine, albeit tiny establishment. I'll be back as soo as I can. I'd have given them 5 stars, but I only tried one thing on the menu.
author: Eric E.

description: Had a toast cup, a cappuccino and a latte everything was excellent. Highly recommend this place.
author: Mario M.

description: Came here for the cragel! The cragel with cream cheese is a great choice. It's flaky, crunchy and chewy all at once. Subtly different and better than a regular bagel. I ordered the mocha and loved it until the last drop...which I licked out of the cup. My husband had the slow drip black coffee. He said it was a bit bitter, so we wanted to give this a 4 1/2 star review, but then rounded it back up to 5 stars for the staff. They were all really helpful and friendly. The coffee place is small, so we ended up walking our coffee and food back to our hotel a block away. But the ambiance was nice inside. Great little find!
author: Rebecca G.

description: The morning breakfast sandwich and the cragel with cream cheese were so good! Such a cute little local cafe. Would definitely return!
author: Kori P.

description:
I was enticed to try out Beanstalk Cafe after seeing many photos and reading yelp reviews about their special bulgogi sandwich.The bulgogi sandwich is amazing! Everything from the fresh crispy rustic and local bread, the sweet and savory beef, to the fresh vegetables (fresh tomatoes, lettuce+arugula, onions) was delicious. The sandwich comes hot n' toasty and full of flavor.

The second time I visited, I had a serious craving for the same bulgogi sandwich I had during my first visit. Unfortunately, I arrived too early in the morning and the bulgogi still had an hour left to cook. They suggested their next most popular hot sandwich and it was the spicy chicken sandwich. That sounded pretty delicious, so I opted for that. Everything about this sandwich was similar to the bulgogi sandwich, the only thing that really differed was the meat. The chicken had a good level of spiciness to it and it was also wonderful.

For the coffee, I tried the Iced Mojito cold brew coffee. It's made with the cold brew coffee they make (Contraband beans) with a little bit of vanilla and fresh mint leaves (you can also ask to make adjustments to sweetness, milk, etc). If you've ever had Philz Coffee's Mint mojito iced coffee, it's very very similar to this. It's refreshing and soo yummy.

For the space, it's a very very small coffee shop. There are about 4 seats indoors with one small table and a couple of seats with a narrow wall-mounted counter area. And there's a small bench right outside. On a busy day, it might be difficult to find seating. I would suggest ordering to-go and bringing your delicious sandwiches and coffee down to  Union Square and enjoying it there. You'll probably have better luck finding some seats there (and it's only 2 blocks away)!

TL;DR:  You need to try the bulgogi sandwich (sweet and savory korean style beef in a sandwich)
author: Monica T.

description: A super tiny, cute cafe up the hill from the Marriot. I wanted to try it since it's not Starbucks and I wasn't disappointed. It was pretty cramped being such a small spot but they were very friendly and got my bagel and coffee out in no time. The coffee was great. I would've preferred a bit more cream cheese but I'm the greedy type. It was all really good.
author: Aryana W.

description: X Excellent food and service! They recommended the breakfast sandwich which was great. I found a seat and saw they had a bulgogi sandwich and I knew what I would have next time!
author: Erik A.

description:
Had the egg cup based on yelp reviews, it's not bad but the novelty outweighs the breakfast. It's also a little awkward to eat.

Cafe is tiny and disorganized; loses a star for the chaos.
author: Brandon A.

description:
Stayed at the hotel across the street for four nights, and didn't discover this wonderful treat until checkout. 

Ordered Bulgogi sandwich - deelish!  Some of the best bread ever.
author: Wayne F.

description: We live right next door so this place is always a go-to for a quick breakfast bite and a yummy coffee. Try the mojito coffee! Good prices and great people.
author: Brittany L.

description: We just missed the toast cups (for the 2nd time) so decided to try the cragel sausage and egg sandwich. I definitely liked the texture of the bread and the egg/sausage was good as well. Good place to grab a light breakfast and be on your way, exploring the city. There was a small seating area but not really big enough for groups.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Cute, friendly, delicious! Enough said! Excellent coffee, and the toast cup was simple and delicious...albeit you just have to commit and shove it in your mouth!! Nothing wrong with that I say!! Hope you can enjoy the yumminess soon too!!
author: Lori H.

description:
This place is alright. 
It's overpriced and the customers that were in here when I went were unfriendly. The staff was friendly enough and speedy so I guess that's all that matters. The bread they use on the sandwiches is fantastic, but I don't feel right getting a breakfast sandwich and an ice coffee for $12. I also wish they had outside seating beyond the one chair and a bench.
author: Sophia G.

description: I came in here to caffeinate and escape the rain while I was walking around San Francisco. Beautiful and tiny space, with super nice baristas and great coffee. It doesn't have tons of space or outlets, so don't plan on camping out here with your laptop all day. However, it was a lovely reprieve from a rainy Saturday.
author: Leigh H.

description: Great spot on the way to work. Coffee is pretty good but I order basic stuff like Americanos. The toast cups are a perfect size for a light breakfast. My only critique is I wish the egg yolk was more runny, mine was well done. Overall solid place, I went every morning while I was in the city for week in work.
author: S M.

description: Little cafe spot with about 6 chairs. I came this morning to get a quick bite before a conference. The Morning Breakfast Sandwich was a bit of a wait but it was really good and filled me up. A crunchy outside/tender inside half baguette with lettuce, tomato, egg, cheddar, bacon, onion, and arugula, I thought it a tad overpriced - it is MORNING, after all - but it's BIG.  Service was very friendly.
author: Suzee Q.

description:
My wife and I were in town and were staying right on the edge of Chinatown.  We were looking for a non-chain breakfast.  After using Yelp, we found this gem was within six blocks and had great reviews.  So we decided to give it a try.

I got a simple onion bagel and a "red eye" (coffee and espresso).  I really enjoyed the flavors and enjoyed the ambiance and all the little extras.  My wife got the Bulgogi sandwich, and fell in love with it. 

Two mornings later we ended up eating breakfast here again and used the online ordering.  It worked great.  This time we both got the Bulgogi and I have to say, it was absolutely delicious.  The meat was hot, fresh and absolutely delicious.  The break was perfect and there was just the right amount of dressing and vegetables in the sandwich.  Excellent all around!
author: David S.

description: Great coffee, super nice people, local vibe and great food.  Basically all You need in a morning place, and more.  Highly recommended!
author: Etai M.

description:
This place is a small-hole-in-the-wall, carry-out breakfast food joint. I have to say it has a welcomed assortment of american breakfast foods (CRAGELS!) fused with a korean twist!  I came into San Francisco briefly for wedding and went here each mornings for three days.  I was referred here by locals who work in the area.  The service is as fast as you can get for a busy little shop (5-10 minutes for sandwiches, 2-3 minutes for drinks). The coffee was kept fresh each mornings.  Best of all, the sandwiches are what kept me coming back.  The cragel (bagel + crossiant) breakfast sandwich was what I expected.  An airy, flaky, buttery cragel bun combined with chedder cheese and bacon goodness.  The spicy Korean chicken sandwich was a fusion masterpiece (it wasn't burning hot spicy). The pastrami sandwich was filling and had a great peppery taste. I also tried the banana bread which was baked fresh that day. It was very moist, sweet, and well-balanced with walnut bits--greatness. My cousin ordered the Bulgogi sandwich which reported as very satisfying.  Each day the staff was extremely nice and you can tell when regulars arrived as the staff predict their order.

Tip: The inside gets crowded so once you order it may be courteous to wait outside.
author: Alexander H.

description: This place is ridiculously good. A must see. Vanilla latte was delicious and the toast cup was awesome one of a kind creation. Tiny little cafe, friendly and delicious. Came here during the week early it was quiet.
author: Kevin L.

description: Nice and little cafe.  Very nice staff.  Had to try the Bulgogi sandwich based on what other Yelpers suggested and was not disappointed.  Very nice taste, right size.
author: Bob F.

description:
Extremely rude employee.

Today I watched one of them start yelling at a pedestrian outside the cafe because their dog peed on the sidewalk.

Not the kind of place that will ever get my business again.
author: Justin K.

description: Beanstalk is a small cafe where you're either in there for a quick bite or taking things to go. There were maybe 3 seats at a small counter and then four or five seats around a small table. Service was friendly. I ordered a small drip coffee and a toast cup. The coffee was good and the toast cup was tasty however the bread was slightly over baked so was hard biting into it. I'm glad I tried it and would go back and try other things as seemed like people were ordering a lot of their sandwiches to go.
author: Teresa T.

description:
Bulgogi sandwich and quinoa salad, absolutely delcious!
The staff is always friendly too!
author: Mike A.

description: This was an amazing experience! I had the  milk tea with almond milk and a drop of honey. Highly recommended!!!
author: Robert M.

description: My experience here was not bad, but not great either. The coffee was tasty, but they could refine their milk texturing and pouring skills.
author: Chris K.

description:
If only this place was in a cuter, less noisy neighborhood like Hayes Valley or something. It's quite adorable and there's a lovely bench to sit on outside, which we sure did. But unfortunately all you got to see and hear around you was Union Square area traffic. 

I only had a latte so can't comment on much else, but that was good.
author: Rowena L.

description: In my recent trip to San Francisco I had the pleasure of climbing some hills and visiting beanstalk. I yelped it before going and was so intrigued by their cragel and coffee, so that's what I got! Cragel with cream cheese & mojito iced coffee. We also tried the breakfast sandwich and cappuccino. EVERYTHING WAS EXCELLENT. So simple yet the best things I had while I was in San Francisco and I cannot stop thinking about the cragel! The coffee was so delicious and perfectly strong. The mojito iced coffee wasn't too sweet which I loved! I wish we had a beanstalk in LA because I would get it all the time. Can't wait to visit again!
author: Chel B.

description: The 12-14 hour brewed iced coffee is absolute heaven. It's a little pricey for iced coffee, BUT that is likely due to the fact that you are drinking an iced coffee that took them half a day to make! And in my opinion, it is totally worth it. Try their iced mojito coffee as a treat to yourself. It is a little cup of heaven! Needless to say, I really like this place. The staff is very nice, which is always appreciated :)
author: Liz M.

description: Everything here is fresh and the ingredients are top flight. Great coffee, as well.
author: Emery J.

description:
Cute little shop near downtown...line can be long but definitely worth it.  

The Latte is very good.  Very smooth, rich and tasty.  

They also have sandwiches and bagels.  I might try it next time.
author: Liza T.

description: Delicious! Very small though, only one little cafe table and a tiny bar style seat. Might be better to get it to go. We had the classic breakfast sandwich and coffee and we loved it! Really cute little place with friendly people.
author: Stacy P.

description: What a treasure to live so close to a great coffee shop like this! Not only is the coffee perfect and the food great, but they bring a real feeling of community to the neighborhood. One of the owners is usually behind the counter, and they are always interested in how you're doing, where you're from, etc. The only drawback is that it's very small, with limited seating. If I can't find a spot to sit, I love to hike up Powell, then go left on California a few blocks to sit in Huntington Park (across from Grace Cathedral) and enjoy my treats.
author: Rachel S.

description:
I like Beanstalk Cafe - the coffee is good, the staff is nice, and the store is neat-looking. I prefer this place over many of the other bigger establishments like Blue Bottle since it's more down-to-earth here.

I had the cappuccino and some kind of brownie, and they were both good. I'd definitely hit this place up again the next time I'm in the area, and would recommend others to do the same!
author: Don L.

description:
This place is a little pricey but they have good coffee. I got a mojito ice coffee and a toast cup, it cost me right under $9.

The coffee was good but I dont think it is worth the $4.50, even if its a 12-hr drip. I can't tell the difference from a 5 minutes drip from a coffee maker.

I like the idea of the toast cup, but it was a little hard and awkward to eat.
author: Vay V.

description:
Nice breakfast bagels, odd atmosphere.

Food is great for the morning fix, but staff feel a bit tried/off and don't really speak or chat to the customers, not that I have seen.

Nice place but could do better.
author: Daniel R.

description: I had a hotel nearby and went for breakfast, about 8am in hopes of scoring the toast cup. I heard they were great!  I did score one. I wasn't sure what to make of it.  Convenient to eat, yes. Cute, definitely. But the egg was cooked too hard (I like a runny yolk) and It also needed salt. Barely enough to make a meal I also got a yogurt.  The coffee was decent.  Prices are fair and the bathroom was clean.
author: Peter H.

description:
They know how to prepare sandwiches. Slightly crunchy bread, soft inside, and most of all...truly fresh ingredients.

The place seems under renovation, so it's a little untidy, but this is definitely a hidden gem.
author: Romolo P.

description: Came specifically for the toast cup and I grabbed one of the last ones. It was actually better than I thought it would be. The toast isn't too thick and has a perfectly crunchy outer layer. This and a cup of coffee totally hit the spot for my morning around SF.
author: Liliana P.

description: Roast beef sandwich was excellent!!!  Small place only really good to take away.
author: Daniel A.

description:
This review is for the service and their toasted cup. 

I called at around 1130 am to check if they still have any toasted cups available because I was afraid that they would be out by then. Luckily they still had 6 left and the lady over the phone was kind enough to put three aside for me. 

First time arrived the cafe and it was smaller than I thought but very cozy. All three of them working were very nice! Toasted cups were already in a to-go container for me. I could still feel the warmth of the cups. Had a short and sweet conversation as I paid. 

It was creative to make the Toasted Cup. A different way to have breakfast. It reminded me a snack that I have had when I visited Seoul. It could be easy for someone that has culinary background to make this, but I guess it takes experience in order to keep the texture of the wrapping and not to over cook the egg. I personally prefer to have more cheese in the cup. 

I will definitely find a time to go back to try more of the items that they offer here.
author: Lianna D.

description:
Thanks yelpers for calling out the Burl Kogi sandwich. It's like a Korean Banh mi with bolgogi beef and cheese and gochujang (as far as I can tell) and it totally works. Perfectly balanced flavors, served warm on killer bread, and crafted with aplomb.

Coffee there is excellent too.
author: Cranston M.

description:
A very cute, super clean cafe with friendly proprietors, this family-run establishment has much to offer the wandering traveler -- like me ducking in here after trudging up too many of those ridiculous steep streets for which SF is famous.  

I really wanted to like everything about this place, but the food was only so-so.  A quinoa salad could have benefited from a zip of lemon or a spritz of vinaigrette.  Though dry and largely tasteless, it wasn't any worse than anything else I've eaten made with quinoa.  Just not something I'd want to chew through again.  My veggie tofu sandwich lacked structural integrity.  Picking it up released a cascade of crumbled tofu and a steady drip of red chili juice.  However, the bread was superb with a show-stealing crust and crushable insides.  They even toasted a bit of cheese onto it too.
author: Gregory W.

description: Almond milk coffee right around the corner from the Amsterdam Hostel on Taylor. Very friendly staff and seriously, the almond milk is sooo good!
author: Chloe C.

description:
I would say for the quality of food and coffee a 4.5-5 stars! Smooth coffee at reasonable price for the coffee of the day $2.50.  The sandwiches taste fresh with fresh ingredients and service is very nice. 
The prices are a little higher than other small delis and they don't have that much variety, which is why I dock some points. But I understand it's because their ingredients are good qualifying etc. 
Anyways, to get on with the food- ordered the bulgogi and roast beef sandwich. $8.50 each. Both were delicious mainly due to the rustic bread. Light and crispy crust with a tender inside. The bulgogi beef was not fatty. I expected the sandwich to be a little bigger when I first got it but after eating it, I was satisfied! The spicy sauce flavor was not too kimchi-ish garlicky spicy at all and only a smear of sauce which I enjoyed. Both sandwiches came with red onions, arugula, tomatoes and a little bit of cucumbers. I liked the bulgogi better than the RB but the RB was really good too! Coffee is excellent here. I tried both hot and iced and both were good. Would definitely come back on my next visit to frisco! My first visit I tried the breakfast cup and thought it was good, but I got it around noon when it prob wasn't as fresh as in the am. The Bread Seemed a little rubbery and wish there was more bacon although the bacon was a thick slice and good. A neat concept and I would try it again if early in the am when fresh.
author: Sandy G.

description: Charming decor, the wait staff were wonderful, but the coffee and food are very average.
author: Kate A.

description: Wonderful sandwiches!!! What a pleasant surprise. The lunch was probably our best meal while in San Francisco. The bread made the sandwich. Absolutely perfect.
author: Tushar T.

description:
4.5 stars. 
Had the bulgogi sandwich. Very tasty!  Bread was super fresh. Tasted like a banh mi with bulgogi.
author: Adam B.

description: Wonderful local cafe for Lower Nob Hill neighborhood.  For the limited space they have, this little place cranks out deliciously fresh breakfast sandwiches, usually on fresh Acme bread. They normally have a couple very tasty and unique cakes or pastries available.  They have a few seats but you should plan to pick your food or coffee up and go.
author: Nash R.

description: Latte, cafe au lait were great. The veggie sandwich was superb. Especially the bread they use.
author: Darshan L.

description: Cragel with bacon, egg, and cheese is delicious. Really, really good lattes. Bulgogi beef sandwich was okay. Almond milk tea has a pretty wide temperature variation depending on who makes it. The space is small and the vibe from staff and some customers is weird, so I would recommend takeout.
author: Tina T.

description:
To the point: This place is a must visit. The food is excellent, and the service is great.

The Burl Kogi Sammy offers a very unique taste that satisfies a particular (indescribable) craving. You will know what I mean the second you try it. 
This place is very small, but there's no chance I will dock it a star for that. After all, it's in SF. If you have to eat close by and there is no room in the cafe, I recommend the short walk to Huntington or Union Sq. Park to eat in the sun. The service is great, the staff is beyond pleasant!

Check it out!
author: Charles H.

description: LOVE! All of my favorite things: fresh flowers, fresh ingredients, fast/friendly service, many variations of sandwiches, vegetarian friendly, natural light, and modern. The spicy chicken sandwich was delicious! Chicken sliced thinly in a spicy orange sauce. If you are in the area and to grab a quick bite you will not regret stopping in!
author: Lacey C.

description: The Asian-looking staff sounded like he was the owner. He seemed to be very knowledgeable with coffee, and his Latte was pretty tasty. For a cup of small Latte at $4, I don't think I would come all the way for that or for the tiny space, but I might hop in and try their Mojito Cappuccino next time I'm in the area.
author: Shaz L.

description: Really cute place, very nice employees and very good food. I had the morning sandwich which was super yummy. It must've had mayo or some other sauce on it that really pulled it all together. Someone in a previous comment mentioned that the eggs were a mix of steamed and scrambled and that's exactly my experience. Fluffy and light.
author: Victoria M.

description:
Beanstalk is a great little cafe for sandwiches and excellent coffee.
The Bulgogi sandwich is amazing, and all of the staff are extremely nice and friendly.
Portions are very generous, a ton of meat packed on delicious bread.
I highly recommend Beanstalk to anyone in the Union Sq area.
There's only a small number of seats available in the cafe, so most people order sandwiches or coffee to go.
author: Jan L.

description:
I have lived right around the corner for a little over a year and Beanstalk is hands-down the best part about my neighborhood. My girlfriend and I come every weekend in the morning for coffee and a delicious sandwich - the Morning Breakfast (bacon, egg, cheese) and the Bul-go-gi are our favourites! - and the employees are personable and quick workers. They make a mean black eye (coffee with a double shot of espresso), a terrific Sunday morning pick-me-up.

There isn't much place to sit at the moment (6 chairs inside, 4 outside) but their food is worth it. I hear they're expanding soon, too, to increase the places to sit!

This is our favourite business in SF by far; nothing else compares!
author: Parker M.

description:
Was in SF, more specifically FiDi for business and was looking for a non-chain place where the locals would get their coffee and breakfast.

I had a cappuccino and an egg and bacon cup.  Both were awesome!  The egg cup was fun and original, and true to SF coffee shop form, a top notch cappuccino.  SF has ruined cappuccino's for me, I can't get them anywhere near as good in Austin!
author: Robert A.

description:
My boyfriend and I love coming here to grab a quick cup of coffee on the weekends because the owner, Mina, is the sweetest woman ever and loves dogs! We love to bring our puppy over to say hi and she is always so warm and welcoming.

It's a great way to start the day!
author: Pam C.

description:
My favorite go-to coffee house in the city.

The place is nice and cozy and the employees are very welcoming. I usually stop by on my way to work every morning and grab a latte or a mocha. It's gotten to the point where the employees all recognize me and will take a stab at which coffee I want to order that morning. (And usually, they're right!)

It provides a good start to my day to drink a nice cup of quality coffee and receive a warm "good morning" and a "have a nice day."

However, depending on the time of the day, the line can get pretty long. I would recommend dropping by any time before 8am or after 9:30am.
author: Dale W.

description: I am a big fan of breakfast sandwiches, unfortunately I was doubly disappointed in the outcome at Beanstalk cafe. $10 sandwich with a $5 coffee left me longing for something more. The sandwich made me feel as if I wasted my calories this morning. Unfortunate and avoidable for anyone else now.
author: Charlie F.

description: The toasty cups are okay.  A little on the dry side, but it's a cute idea.  What I really enjoyed was the breakfast sandwich.  It was delicious and a better deal.  I would go back for the sandwich!
author: Sophie G.

description: I wish this place was here when I lived up the street, a new breakfast on-the-go favorite. The toast cups are delicious and light enough to get you going but not slow you down. The mojito coffee has been my favorite find though. I typically take my coffee black but I love this concoction. The mint helps alleviate some sweetness. It's fantastic!
author: Lauren L.

description:
Beef sandwich and spicy chicken sandwich absolutely delicious.
Get a espresso if u love good coffee, it is strong but really taste. (Coming from a Spanish, espresso addict).
author: George W.

description: So far this place does my favourite coffee in SF. And the sandwiches are also excellent. I need to try the breakfast items some day
author: Tom D.

description:
After passing this cute storefront everyday on my way to work for the past month, I finally pulled over to try a cup of coffee from Beanstalk. 

Super cute cafe serving up Contraband coffee. Delicious. They offer a selection of cold case drinks and breakfast options. The staff is very friendly, and did I mention how adorable this place looks for the outside? 

Love and will be back!
author: Theresa T.

description: Delicious sandwiches and yummy coffee!  Perfect mid day stop and break from the hustle bustle of union square
author: Christi K.

description: Very tasty breakfast sandwiches coupled with home made bread. A bit pricey for what you get - next time will go for the regular breakfast sandwich at about half the price. The higher end bacon egg and cheese sandwich was contained within a fresh baguette garnished and flavored with fresh greens. Very filling, but just a bit too pricey for my wallet. Nice iced coffee - not too acidic. If you are in a hurry, double park or have someone wait in the car while you wait for your order.
author: Kris B.

description: Found this place on Yelp because it was 3 blocks from my hotel, cheap, and had good reviews. I ordered two toast cups and an iced coffee. Service was extremely fast. I was in and out in less than 3 minutes. The toast cups were good...I would order them again. Such a cute idea too, and easy to eat with your hands. Iced coffee - delicious. The lady in front of me was visiting from Australia and she said she's been in America for two weeks and this place had the best coffee that she's had. That says a lot right there!
author: Miranda M.

description: My review is solely for the the flat white. I haven't been able to find any cafe that's been able to do a flat white as good as in Australia, but this place nailed it.  Will be back next time to try the food!
author: Kelly Q.

description: Sandwiches are hand crafted to perfection! Come early as it goes all out on the weekend
author: Kobi A.

description:
Stopped in for the famed Bulgolgi sandwich and man, did it not disappoint!
I was on a food trip in San Francisco and this spot came up with high ratings and low cost. 

The dude behind the counter was really cool too. We even joked around a little bit. 

Highly recommended! 

Order the Bulgolgi sandwich!
author: Ricardo H.

description: Very fresh and delicious. The owner was there and was really passionate about every ingredient. The coffee was amazing. The food was a 5 out of 5. It's a tiny place with one table. Totally worth the try. We loved it. Everything was A+
author: Jessica H.

description:
I love this place as a lunch spot! My favorite is their Bulgogi Sandwich but I've tried the Spicy Chicken, which is also good. They also have yummy looking breakfast specials, but I've never tried them. Their prices are pretty reasonable for downtown and the sandwiches are huge and super filling (I also love that they have arugula in them!)

The owner and staff are also really friendly and will make sure you're completely comfortable and satisfied. They've done things like lower the shades and bring me water even without me asking! They also will recognize "regulars" and are always fun and willing to chat.

It's pretty small inside, but there usually isn't a wait for lunch and seats are almost always open, even though it is very limited seating. The decor is also super cute, which is a plus. They also have a bench outside, if you wanted to have a cup of coffee outdoors.

Their coffee drinks are delicious and use really high quality beans. It's a little pricier than other places (en par with Starbucks prices) but is better tasting coffee and they have a lot of non-dairy options. I love that they serve cold-brewed iced coffee, which  is delicious and so smooth/not bitter, but I can't justify paying $4 for an iced coffee unless it's a treat yo' self day.
author: Christina R.

description: Love this place! I stumbled upon it over my wedding weekend needing a snack after my mom and aunt arrived from Korea and it was just down the hill from the Mark Hopkins where they were staying. They got addicted to the toast cups - we had them every day including on my wedding day!
