This is an adorable little cafe with friendly service and I am sure my family will want to come back the next time they are in town.
author: Kathy T.

description: Love this little place my recent trip to, San Francisco stoping here for breakfast was a must go the shop has awesome breakfast stop and the coffee is definitely slow peak to perfection the owner explain it all to us and the staff was so nice .
author: Nancy E.

description:
We were staying at the B and B across from there.  Stop in and got the bulgogi sub. Awesome!! 
Will definitely be back when in town.
author: g y.

description: My husband and I needed a breakfast place nearby. I randomly came upon this place on yelp. (Thanks, Yelp!) When you get there, it looks very simple and plain. Nothing about this place screams "Try me!" If you don't though, you're really missing out. My husband ordered coffee and the breakfast sandwich. I ordered a cragel with cream cheese and got some bottled juice. O-M-G... the cragel was sooooo good. It was so good that my husband wanted more of mine, but I ate it all already. Then he kept talking about it for the rest of the day! His breakfast sandwich was also good, but my cragel was definitely the winner. It was so simple but tasted so buttery and creamy. I love trying new places and being pleasantly surprised!
author: Christina P.

description: Really nice coffee and breads ( morning glory and banana) but the real stand out is the staff. We went with our baby in a stroller and our 3 year old. The barista went out of her way to grab us the first available table. She offered to bring us anything we needed so we didn't have to get up and down. The guy making the coffee made funny faces at our 5 mo old. They were just wonderful. Thanks so much!
author: Lisa W.

description:
Simply the best find close to where I stay when I'm in San Francisco, fantastic service, good coffee and great sandwiches.

Will be coming back here many times in the future. Highly recommended!!
author: Patrick C.

description: Beef bulgogi sandwich is amazing. I could eat it every day and would actually like to. I was there a couple weeks before Christmas. Easy walk from Marriott Union Square. I will no doubt get this incredible sandwich next time work brings me to San Francisco. Breakfast sandwish/cragel aslo very tasty and coffee is exceptional. Very friendly staff as well. Only negative is the small size of the place with very few seats but I did takeout each time and ordered ahead for my bulgogi sandwich which was key since they were pretty busy.
author: Toph L.

description:
Beanstalk cafe, is a fantastic little sandwich shop. Recently opened, I'm glad to live around the corner and be able to find a healthy alternative to sit-down restaurants. While the cafe only has one table, and a few barstools, the real reason to come is the food.

I've so far ordered the Turkey ( no onions ) and a Veggie ( no onions ). Their unique way of making the sandwich, and their willingness to substitute without question makes their food even better.  The vegetables are fresh, added after the toasting of their awesome, (locally) sourced bread. Their Korean sweet/tangy sauce truly adds taste and just enough zing to make the 10 min wait, worth it.  All orders are made as ordered, and they do take their time.  This is not subway! So don't expect to come in and order and have it in 2 min or less.
author: Jase E.

description: Delicious drip coffee no doctoring needed. Breakfast cup was tasty and hit the spot. Great way to start a day!
author: Brad J.

description: Coffee and grilled panini (they don't call it that) HEAVEN. Hands-down best house blend coffee I've enjoyed in SF. Turkey panini was toasted to perfection. Staff is friendly, attentive and welcoming to newbies like me (my order took a while, all my fault). Seating is limited to one table and 3 bar stools but that adds to quaint vibe of establishment. No negatives here; all good. I'll definitely return and highly recommend.
author: Christopher K.

description:
My coworker and I were looking for a new spot to have coffee around our office. This is when we found Beanstalk Cafe. We trekked up the hill from Sutter, and then we came upon Beanstalk's storefront--quite mute and innocent when I first saw it when getting to the top of Bush. 

The interior is really cute. A small cafe with a barista and a chef. Right when my co-worker and I entered, we were greeted by the nicest barista ever. She might even be the owner or manager. She was nice in asking about where we worked and how we found out about the place. When we told her we walked from Sutter and Stockton, she gasped and thanked us for coming all the way over. That was nice of her, but I actually didn't think it was that far, and I enjoyed the walk!

The menu is great--your standard espresso drinks and coffee ($2-$4 bucks). What surprised me was their selection of sandwiches! ($8-$10) I really was caught off guard by the Korean influences! I got the Red Eye to go. After she made our drinks she thanked us again for coming and expressed that she'd love to see us again soon. 

I definitely will come back again to try their sandwiches, and of course to get some coffee again soon!
author: Ben C.

description: What a great place.  I'm visiting San Francisco from the Midwest and I wanted a non chain coffee place.  I'm so glad I walked to this place from my hotel.  Had a delicious waffle and a breve to die for.  The guys working here are friendly, helpful, and adorable!!
author: Christina D.

description: We were very impressed by the thoughtful reply of the owner. Based on the reviews, we were excited for a special vacation breakfast and it just wasn't there. The lack of vegetarian toast cups was frustrating, no doubt about it. The lunch menu looked very good, though.
author: David B B.

description:
TLDR. Great Cragel, great staff, great service.

I have been there several times and every time the staff is super nice. 
Tried their hot chocolate, it's from the powder, but it also has whipped cream, so, no complain from me. 
They have cragel (croissant / bagel love child) and it is awesome.
author: Joanne C.

description: Incredibly hot and fresh breakfast sandwich packed with fresh green, tomatoes, egg, cheese and bacon on a fresh roll!! What?!?!
author: Allison M.

description:
Im very picky.
Never had bulgogi before and tried it today

Bulgogi sandwich: 5/5. extremely flavorful. sauce is just perfect. size of sandwich is enough. 
Iced latte: 2/5. doesnt taste horrible, but really has no taste overall. 

Try the organic mango juice thats in a bottle. tastes great.

Service: 5/5: very kind , and very nice people.
author: M J.

description: Tasty sandwich, filling. 10$ for a bulgogi Sammy that everyone raves about.. Dope looking desserts, peanut butter rice crispy bar is cray. Tiny space, no AC, grab n go spot. Good contraband coffee options
author: Roy C.

description: cute place! love the rustic modern feel, warmed by brick and marble counters. they seem serious about their coffee and have lots of breakfast sandwiches. my reason for a 3 star rating is that i ordered an almond chai. it was $4 and came with a tea bag. that is way too pricey, even thought the almond milk was done well.
author: Nicole B.

description: A perfect pick-me-up breakfast after a long late flight from the Midwest. The long drip coffee mojito with fresh mint leaves and surprisingly filling Toast Cup both offered unique and delicious flavors. I especially like the mint in the coffee because it wasn't overly minty... only a hint of mint with big fresh leaves in the drink. Quick and friendly service. Not cheap but a worthy treat.
author: Jeff B.

description:
I ordered the Bulgogi sandwich and iced brew through Eat24.

The sandwich was light and tasty. Turned out they were out of the iced brew, so the lady behind the counter immediately got that removed from my order and made a point to show me I wasn't being charged. Ended up buying an iced latte at the store which was very good. 

Not a ton of seating space, but the service was excellent and the place has a chill vibe.
author: Hart N.

description: Awesome tiny cafe with well-made espressos and a DELICIOUS breakfast sandwich. I'd make my way out here again just to eat that breakfast sandwich.
author: Roy C.

description:
Honestly, I'm convinced that Beanstalk Cafe serves up the best cup of regular coffee on the planet.  Their sandwiches (especially the bulgogi and the morning sandwich) are fantastic.  You MUST try their toast cups, which are like an egg breakfast served in cupcake form.  It is an egg with bacon wrapped around it inside of a fluffy batter cup.  I can't think of a better way to start the day than a toast cup and black coffee from Beanstalk Cafe.

Add to this that going there is just a pleasure.  The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is inviting.  You can tell that the owners put great care into the food and drinks they serve.

Definitely go to Beanstalk Cafe!
author: Kevin F.

description:
The coffee is good the sandwich is amazing!!! We got the breakfast sandwich, it was monnneey! The flavor is perfect! I love the mix of egg and bacon! The bread was toasted perfectly! Crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside! I got the drip of the day which was the black market. It was very flavorful. If u like dark coffee this is a good one to try. My fiancée got the cold brew mojoto coffee. It was very interesting. Good interesting. It's got a refreshing mint flavor. If I'm rating on food only, this place is a 5 star hands down. 

I took one star off because of the service. The place is tiny so they r trying hard to serve everyone, however it is a little disorganized. For the size they should try to give out numbers when people order. Since their menu is small people order the same items, when they yell out, for example, coffee, when it's ready, the wrong customer could mistaken the coffee as theirs.

Still people working there are friendly and the food and drinks are great! I would highly recommend it!!!
author: Xinyi T.

description: Ok, good food and good coffee are served here but when you feel at home and are known the first time you visit then you will always come back. That is Beanstalk Coffee!
author: David N.

description: The bulgogi and the spicy chicken sandwiches are both good. They were out of cragel when I went for lunch. If you want to try that, be sure to go before 9:30am.
author: T L.

description:
Visited here twice on our weekend trip to SF. We enjoyed our sandwiches on Friday night and LOVED the toast cups and coffee this morning. Good quality food.

Our daughter nicknamed the place "Sweet Lady Palace" after meeting one of the owners on Friday night...such friendly, welcoming people who strive to offer quality food and experience!
author: Drake L.

description: This place is adorable. A good place to grab a to-go breakfast sandwich or toast cup. I would not recommend coming here with a plan to sit for a long time because there is very little seating. I did not get coffee but it looked like they do the pour over method.
author: Gina G.

description: The food here is amazing. Ordered off the menu which was no problem. Bread was fresh, atmosphere was great, and Colin the owner was very friendly.
author: jack d.

description: Visiting from Las Vegas and this place is just down the street. Wonderful!!  Great coffee and the owner was awesome!!  We will be back for sure.
author: Jeff K.

description: Popped into this lovely little cafe for lunch. Very nice staff and cute decor. Not to mention excellent spicy chicken sandwich. Spicy is no joke, I love that. And every sandwich has the works.. Another love of mine. Coffee is really good too.
author: Jessica H.

description: I went here because I was staying in Union square and it was conveniently located near my hotel. My boyfriend and I shared the Bulgogi beef sandwich and toast cups. The toast cups are creative and very cute idea. The Bulgogi beef sandwich was delicious; the beef was super flavorful with the right amount of sauce and the bread used to make the sandwich was tasty. I also ordered an iced mojito coffee.. The mint added a real good unique flavor to the coffee; I've never had mint in my coffee before! I really appreciated that the people who work at this cafe are extremely polite and friendly. This was my last meal after staying in SF for a week and I'm glad I came here!
author: Mai N.

description: It's a really nice place; a bit smaller than I thought, but the cappuccino was really good and the sandwich was great too. The owner was there I believe and he was really nice and friendly. They had a cool coffee setup that looked like it came from breaking bad. I'd def. recommend this place for people trying to grab a bite and a drink, especially to go.
author: Ali T.

description: I'm down w the toast cups & super friendly efficient staff while I'm late to work
author: J A.

description:
Very small cafe with a table and a couple of bar stools. 
Bulgogi sandwich- Very creative fusion sandwich. Nice crusty French  bread stuffed with mayo, tomatoes and bulgogi. Enough said. Must try if you are in the area.
author: Sachin T.

description:
I had a latte and a Cargel. It was good but it wasn't  spectacular. 

Why one star? The lady behind the counter I guess didn't seem to care that I wasn't one of their "preferred" customers. 

A Caucasian lady is in front of me as I walk into the store. The lady behind the counter greets her and takes her order. All normal. I walk up to the counter and she doesn't greet me and continues to stare into the payment iPad with a blank and rude face while I place my order. 

An African American fellow walks in later and wanted to know what street the store was on cause he was lost. Granted the guy barged in and announced the question quite loudly. The lady gave an annoyed face expression and was about to respond (probably rudely) but another kind customer in the store replied the answer before she was given the chance.

Another Caucasian lady then walks in while I wait for my Cragel. She greets her with a smile and a hello. The Caucasian lady asked if there was a bathroom she could use and was not there to buy a single thing. The lady behind the counter replied that there was no bathroom in the store and continues the friendly manner.

This type of stuff leaves me bewildered since the worker/owner herself is Asian, I am guessing Korean based on the store's menu.

Avoid this place if you don't happen to be the right skin color. Or go if you condone this type of behavior.
author: Jay H.

description:
Yummy to the point of being outrageously amazing. This very small cafe consists of an open kitchen, a table with four chairs, a counter with three stools, a coffee station, a cold case with some brownies and other items, and a counter at which to place your order. It also had a very friendly staff, very attentive, lovely owner and a constant stream of customers. 

I ordered the bulgogi sandwich and my husband ordered the breakfast sandwich. Both were delicious. The combination of marinated beef, cucumber kimchee, lettuce, cheese, kochujang (red pepper paste), and a bit of arugula all on a crisply toasted baguette were a perfect marriage of flavors. The sandwiches were neatly wrapped and the owner brought them to our table even though she was very busy. I saved half my sandwich for later but when I got back to our hotel, which was just a five minute walk away, I opened up my still warm sandwich and finished it off! My husband's comment was, "Oink! Oink!" I just smiled as I licked my fingers.

The coffee was really hot and REALLY good. It had great depth of flavor and wasn't bitter or sour. It was fresh and delicious.

I wish I could comment more on my husband's sandwich but he scarfed it down. All I can say is, "Oink! Oink,"
author: Julia P.

description: Had the bagel samo and it was nothing special. Also tried the cregal and it was just okay. Skip
author: Theresa C.

description: The morning sandwich is the way to go! It is wholesome and delicious. The bread is a sourdough baguette with melted cheddar, bacon, onions, arugula, and egg. It is very filling though;can probably be shared. The toast cup was a little dry for my taste, but it was definitely interesting. The lattes were on point!
author: kiersten a.

description: Beanstalk is a great gem of a breakfast cafe not too far from Union Square, but without the craziness. I've stopped by here a few times to grab an everything bagel with cream cheese. It's not quite a NYC bagel, but it's pretty good and fresh. The cream cheese is generic. It's a good stop for on the go coffee and bagel. It is a little slow, so give it about 5-10minutes to get your order.
author: Mike L.

description:
Consistently 5 star rating for very obvious reasons, you'll find out why when you try it! I can't rave enough about the sandwiches! And the good coffee! This is an excellent cafe, definitely a neighborhood gem! 
The fact that they didn't advertise how much people love them on yelp (all over their window like most places do) gives it a certain charm, to me. There's something humbling and awesome about that! 
I just wish they had more seating! Bfast sandwich and bulgogi sandwich had me pulling out my pen and paper to write home about!! Mama, you've got to check this place out! ; )
author: Tu L.

description: The Morning Sandwich I just had at 330 in the afternoon made me wanna go back to sleep just to wake up and have another. Great little coffee/sandwich shop on Nob Hill.
author: Jason K.

description: The breakfast sandwich was delicious and service was super friendly!! Seating was a little tight considering we were with an infant, but space wise it's what I expected based on other reviews.
author: Brian M.

description: Perfectly made coffee, they know what they are doing in that department. The iced coffee is one of the best i have ever had! Their toast cups are delicious and they have great bagels! Definitely will be back.
author: Aaron S.

description: This is the cutest cafe ever. I work up the street and having to go to Starbucks or 7/11, which is down the hill is highly inconvenient. Beanstalk Cafe has become my new spot.  I come here every morning to get my mocha and Cregal with cream cheese and yogurt. Collin and Mina are the coolest people!!!!! All the workers there are great. They've become family. I love that I can call in an order work for 20 mins and then come in and grab it!!!! Love you guys and thank you for all the great food and laughs
author: Kyla W.

description: Well if a breakfast for 1 costs 20 bucks with tip included, I just can't think how it can be rated $ on yelp. The breakfast was okay but like all places in this area they are short on space. The iced mojito coffee was meh. The brekfast sandwich and the special toasted egg bacon rung were good though.
author: Rohit B.

description: Great little neighborhood spot with good bagel sandwiches and strong lightly roasted arrisan coffee.
author: Patrick S.

description: Headed out this morning on a quest, a quest for a great skinny latte.  After a quick google map search I was walking up Mason to find the Beanstalk. Being not from around here the 15% grade of the hill look ominous but I figured the walk would be go for me. The cafe was small but quaint. The baristas very pleasant and greeting. The skinny latte? Off the charts, rob ably the best I have ever had. I think tomorrow I will try the breakfast sandwiches.
author: Chuck K.

description:
Great spot for breakfast on the go.

I recently stayed at a hotel near Union Square and this was my go-to breakfast spot. They have a great breakfast sandwich, as well as these cute little "toast cups". The coffee is also good, the staff friendly, and the service quick. (You can apparently order online for even faster service.)

My only complaints are that there is very limited seating (minor) and breakfast options (less minor). If they could add a bit of variety among their breakfast offers, I think this would a 5-star spot! (Note: their lunchier sandwiches come in a wider variety.)
author: DJ S.

description: I am visiting from Atlanta, but I love trying new/interesting places. Beanstalk cafe is about a quarter mile from union square where I am staying so I decided to give it a try. I ordered the breakfast sandwich-it is delicious.  Fluffy egg, bacon, arugula, onion and cheddar was the perfect combination. Def worth giving a try!
author: Cassie D.

description: This used to be my go-to coffee spot when I lived in Nob Hill. The coffee and menu are excellent for such a small shop, and I've always found the owners to be incredibly welcoming. My favorite dish is the bulgogi sandwich.
author: Drew C.

description: Great little place with bagels and coffee :)
author: Kira G.

description:
I had their mocha, and my partner joked that it was like drinking hot chocolate. I agree, but I LOVE sugar, so it was fine with me. I highly recommend it if you like sweet drinks.

The guy at the counter was patient and friendly.

We also tried their bulgolgi sandwich. It was tasty, like all well-prepared sandwiches are.
author: Justina C.

description:
Great tasting sandwiches with a Korean twist. The bulgogi sandwich is delicious and will set you back $8.50. It is served on fresh, Acme artisan roll and includes the tasty contrasting flavors of peppery arugula. 

Service is friendly. Only drawback is limited seating. There is one small table and counter with couple chairs inside. Outside seating includes a small bench for two.
author: just d.

description: Everyone has their off days - the worst cappucino I have had in a very long time. Unless it was intended to be a retro-kickback to the days of Australian cappucinos with 50% stiff foam piled on top. Sorry :-( it was a cute spot and I wanted to love it since so many other Yelpers loved it. Oh well.
author: Paul D.

description: Cute little shop and friendly service. Plan to take away from here beause seating is very limited. I had the toast cup. It was ok. The kind of thing you try once and never again. It was a bit of a chore to eat because the top of the toast was crispy like a cracker. It tasted ok. The egg is naked into the toast cup with a ring of bacon around it and the bottom of the cup has a little cheddar cheese in it. Not for someone with a big appetite
author: Al D.

description: Fantastic selection of coffee and very friendly service. Exactly what I need in the morning. The morning sandwich is massive - basically a breakfast burrito on a bami bun! If you manage to get here before 9am you'll might be able to get one of the 9 seats. The little table outside is great to wake up in the morning sun!
author: Teun H.

description: Don't believe the hype. This isn't a 4.5 star place. The toast cup was first cold and the egg was stiff. This is a quick coffee stop, so don't expect to be able to sit. Service was good and fast and my girlfriends morning sandwich was filling and tasted ok.
author: drake e.

description: The bulgogi beef sandwich is spectacular.  Amazing staff, and amazing place.  Can't wait to go back for more.
author: Derek P.

description: We had a latte, cappuccino and the breakfast sandwich. So delish! The sandwich was perfect for us to split because we didn't want to fill ourselves up too much so we can continue to eat throughout San Francisco. The ingredients were fresh and tasty. The coffees were also amazing. I definitely recommend eating here on your journey in San Fran.
author: Danielle B.

description: Great little shop. Tasty coffee and delicious croissants. The breakfast sandwiches are a little egg heavy but you can add all sorts of ingredients i.e. Pesto, avocado, tomato.
author: Lilly D.

description: How often does one rave about sandwiches...I'd say not often. But the beanstalk café not only serves excellent coffee but I had the best egg salad bagel sandwich ever ! And it was 4:30 in the afternoon and I was afraid the bagels and bread would not be fresh not so at all.... The bagel was excellently  toasted lightly filled with an abundant amount of yummy egg salad ! I also had the turkey and cranberry sandwich on one of the best French rolls ever crispy but doesn't scratch on the roof of your mouth !! I'd say this should be your go to coffee and deli stop ! The mocha was superb excellent ghirardelli  chocolate and served in a nice deep cup! And of course Collin is awesome :-)
author: Laraine S.

description:
Cute spot I like to get lunch from on my days off. Sitting inside eating a sandwich reminds me of staying over at my grandma's house when I was little - which usually doesn't sound like a compliment, but trust me, it is! There's a certain warmth here that's hard to find downtown.

The food is good and the people feeding you are friendly and sweet. I've only had sandwiches here, but everything has been fresh, high quality and delicious. I try not to drink coffee on my days off but their cold drip definitely tempts me.

It's true there isn't much seating, but there's not much they can realistically do about that - so go with takeaway in mind, but hoping to get lucky.

(P.S. I'm 80% sure I saw the lead singer of Chromeo here once while they were in town. He's got good taste.)
author: Dani A. C.

description: Superb coffee and excellent food. The cragel is worth coming for all by itself and the chocolate butter Mochi is a textural adventure for your mouth.
author: Patrick C.

description: My spot for Contraband coffee and an interesting variety of tasty treats. It helps that the owners are kind and generous too!
author: Basile K.

description: Want a unique but flavorful and satisfying sandwich? Order the Korean Bul Gogi sandwich - crunchy toasted French bread with tender beef and amazing slightly spicy sauce! Perfection
author: Steve H.

description:
Cool place to have fresh brewed coffee.
They also have some funky but awesome breakfast grub.
It's a must!!
author: Victor B.

description: Great little neighborhood cafe! I highly recommend the morning sandwich, it is so good! There's bacon, egg, cheese, tomato, lettuce, and onion. Lettuce is probably weird on a breakfast sandwich but I liked it and it gave the sandwich a nice crunch. I will be back!
author: Patty K.

description:
Great spicy chicken sandwich! Nice amount of heat, tasty combination of Korean BBQ-style flavors, quality ingredients. Bit pricey, but hey it's a high end sandwich. 
Small place with not much seating, but not crowded when I went and certainly good for take-out.
author: Kyle C.

description: I love the Korean influence. Nice to mix up from dim sum and western breakfasts! Nice management and cozy place to start your day.
author: Darren C.

description: This is a tee-tiny little place with very little space on the inside, great to drop by and pick up, literally, some of the best iced coffee in town on your way to work or for a quick bite. The croissant I had was not super fresh, but it was alright. The pretzel bagel has a very unique flavor. Wish I had tried the bulgogi!
author: Marisa G.

description: Awesome coffee (my mocha had chunks of chocolate in it, making me a happy camper) excellent food and great service. Try the spicy chicken sandwich...it's like a cross between a Bahn Mi and buffalo chicken. Only excuse I have for not giving it 5 stars is its small size; there's maybe 5 or 6 seats to the whole place, but there were a ton of people getting to go orders while I was there.
author: Rob H.

description: This is my goto place for soy latte - and I got their veggie sandwich ones; YUM! They slide everything so thin and with good bread, its very delicate. Can only recommend
author: Marie V.

description:
Adorable coffee shop a few blocks away from the hustle and bustle of the financial district.

I am not much of a coffee drinker so tried their milk-tea concoction (I had the orange-flavoured tea bag with some milk and honey they put in - they suggested it and I gladly took it). -- uploaded a photo of this

Service was great, with them making the effort to bring your drink to your 'table' (albeit it was only 3 feet away, but a nice touch!) 

They also had small scones-type of pastries that they heated up in their small oven. It was kind of an amazing array of items they had considering the size of their open kitchen area.

A caveat is if you are planning to come and sit down, there is essentially only one small table that seats 4, and a bar stool area that seats 3. Try your luck!
author: Yan K.

description: Hidden away without even a sign on top , coffee and food is excellent. Veggie sandwich had apple slices in it which really surprised my taste buds. Bread was excellent too. It is a very very small place though with no more than 5-6 people seating. Highly recommend.
author: CHET M.

description: Staying at the Orchard Hotel and needed a quick bite. The reviews were good, so I ambled over. Had a very tasty egg salad with cheese on a toasted (hot!) bagel - very tasty!  The egg salad was not soupy like some places - it was really quite good. Topped with a very nice cappuccino in a ceramic cup (I hate paper if you're eating in) and it made for a nice light meal. As reported by others, the staff were very nice. And they're in the process of expanding into the space next door. More room to hang out and casually enjoy the coffee - as it should be!
author: Curtis P.

description: Cute little cafe on Bush St just down from our hotel gave us a bit of respite from the cold and the hustle and bustle of the streets. We spent 3.5 weeks travelling the USA on holiday from Australia and the Beanstalk was the best coffee that we had the entire trip! Friendly and enthusiastic staff. We liked the Beanstalk Cafe so much that we came back the next day. Thanks Collin for the coffee, the chat and of course the cragel :)
author: Ashley M.

description: What a wonderful place. We have found this place by chance, while walking down Bush street. Good fresh coffee with great sandwiches and bagels. We had tried bagels with cream cheese (plain and with raisins), a roast beef sandwich and an egg salad sandwich. They were all tasty, made from fresh and good ingredients. The owners are charming. On our second visit they have treated us as if we we regulars, and although the place was crowded they helped us with our baby stroller. What a shame that we had to go back home to the east coast. Highly recommended!
author: Ofer Z.

description: Ugh.  Just go to Starbucks.  Toast cup and pastry were days old tasting and toasted to be "fresh".  Barista is not very talented either.
author: Melody J.

description: WOW, your responses throughout this blog are a clear indication that it flows from the top.   Your employees act as they do presumably because they've got your full backing.  For your information, I did ask for my money back when I told the barista that I couldn't drink my coffee without the cream (separate issue from the whipped cream).  That is when she shrugged and turned away.  And speaking of empathy, one of the people in our foursome was deaf and part of the delay was in our interpreting for her information being given to us by a cashier who clearly had a hard time understanding our questions.  For the record, empathy goes both ways.
author: Sally L.

description: Shame that I couldn't try the signature toast cup breakfast. 9:45am, they are sold out. Really? So what? Are they pre made and they can't make more?  Sign says it's 3.50 with bacon and egg. So I order a bagel, bacon and egg. She says it's $6.50.  Isn't the toast cup bacon and egg too?  I couldn't see paying $3 more for standard.bacon egg bagel sandwich. I said forget it and left. Not even an I'm sorry. I mean if you're niche is the breakfast toast cup, I think you should at least be able to serve it or make it fresh during breakfast hours. Sorry, I won't be going back to try this place at all out of general principle.
author: H D.

description: Friendly staff, awesome smooth mocha, nice place. Try the toast cups, truly unique way to enjoy eggs, bacon and toast.
author: Chris P.

description: In area for business. Nice little place to pop on for lunch. Got the spicy chicken on recommend for the fella behind the counter... Chicken has nice spice, veggies and bread are perfect! What I mean by perfect: cool crisp veg... Warm soft in middle crunch on outside bread.  Also grabbed a tasty little pastry.  Sandwich, pastry, tea and tip -$18 and worth every penny! :)
author: Dan S.

description: The staff is very friendly and the food is delicious and varied! As it's name implies, the Beanstalk is small, with only 6 seats, but with the option to order online and take food to go, it has a pop-in, pop-out community feel. Would definitely go here again!
author: Joshua S.

description: Toast cup and coffee great!!  Would recommend to travelers! They cater to the locals!
author: Linda S.

description: Only offers 3 menu items for breakfast (waffle, bagel, breakfast sandwich). What the heck. Next, needed to get sandwiches for the day & there website says sandwiches are their specialty. You cant even order a sammie at 9 am (opens at 7:30 on Sat). Why not.. Total bust!!  Perfect location, quite a shame.
author: Sarah B.

description: Great coffee shop! The guys running it are super nice, the coffee is strong and tasty and so are the bagels.
author: Nils M.

description:
Originally, I saw the 5 stars on here so I figured I'd give it a shot. Even though the hill up from Powell/Union Square is a bit daunting to those that spend all day in front of the computer, it is absolutely worth it. 

The staff is super nice and welcoming. 

The the Bul-go-gi beef sandwich is absolutely a must have. You won't be disappointed
author: Jake B.

description: Overpriced and little flavor for the food. We had a couple bagel breakfast sandwiches and they were just smothered and overpowered by the crazy amount of cheese. I don't think we would come back.
author: Brittany D.

description: When I go out to a restaurant I look forward to getting something that I can't make at home without a lot of work involved. I had a toast cup and waffle and they were nothing special. The toast cup was creative and I have never seen anything like it before, but it lacked that something special in the taste department. The waffle was soggy and tough with nothing to set it apart from a Bisquick waffle and Log Cabin syrup, which it was. $4.50 for a Bisquick waffle! It seems like you might get a little fruit in the waffle or compote. Next time I am walking by this place.
author: Trent P.

description: The bulgogi beef sandwich was incredible!! The owner was the one who took our order, and was super friendly and helpful. Really great service, and really great sandwiches!
author: Russell H.

description: Hidden gem! This brand new cafe is phenomenal. Great location convenient for both locals in Nob Hill and Union Square tourists, delicious Contraband Coffee, and fantastic sandwiches. And very clean.  All that would make for a solid review, but what really makes this place 5 star is the friendly service. I will definitely be back and highly recommend Beanstalk Café!
author: Will P.

description: Great little cafe, the breakfast sandwich had really fresh bread and they serve contraband coffee.
author: Danielle r.

description: Great food and friendly service. Really liked the breakfast sandwiches and delicious  coffee. We will come again before we go home to Maryland!
author: Katharine N.

description: Stayed in Nob Hill area and we looked everywhere for a little coffee shop with fresh locally roasted coffee and a grab and go breakfast.  We finally found this little gem and went back each morning where we had super friendly service.  There is only one locally roasted drip of the day to choose from, but each morning it changed and was very good and flavorful.  The cragel breakfast sandwiches were very good as were the egg cups (until they run out).  If you are looking for gluten free options, they also have a couple daily gluten free muffins to choose from as well which were very good.  Only two tables, so plan on getting to go on your way.
author: Austin H.

description: This is a family run business, and these folks understand coffee. I'm a big fan of attention to detail, here, the coffee drinks made to perfection, the decor is cutesy but not an overkill. Beanstalk also carries yummy Belgian waffles. Worth a visit if you're a coffee lover. Enjoy!
author: Diana B.

description: Came here to check out the toast cups they looked great on yelp and this place has 4 stars. They were out of toast cups but said they were famous for their sandwiches. Really wanted breakfast so got a breakfast sandwich and egg salad sandwich. Both were sub par lacking mayo, dry on a French roll too thick for breakfast sandwiches. No seating at all really, not comfortable with our two small kids.
author: Ryan E.

description: Yay!! Finally a shop that sells a true Flat White!! Like we have in Australia! Service was fast and friendly and they had s few homemade treats! The raspberry bar was Delish! So happy we found this little quaint cafe! Jump off the cable car at bush and Powell street. It's worth the stop.
author: Billys M.

description:
Amazing coffee. Ordered almond milk drinks over a long weekend and kept comin back.

Drinks are made fast and done like real espresso drinks are made.  

Prices are good and they have a pretty decent food menu.  If you like places that aren't cookie-cutter, check it out!!
author: Chad S.

description: Saw the reviews and went there twice over four mornings.  Loved the cragel with bacon egg and cheese!
author: Tom D.

description:
My new fave spot! Delicious Korean-style sandwiches and great coffee. But go gi sandwich is my favorite though spicy chicken is a close second. I wish the morning breakfast had the red sauce on it, will add that next time.

Everything is made to order and there is little to no seating.
author: Mari M.

description: Cool, albeit, tiny cafe.   Nice place to sit down and grab breakfast and a cup of coffee.
author: Nick D.

description: Here on business from Michigan. Just had a pour over Ethiopian Harrar and turkey sandwich. Both were great. Coffee was rich with flavor and the sandwich was also tasty. I highly recommend this place!
author: B A.

description: Between the Morning Breakfast Sandwich, drip coffee and Iced Coffee Mojito, I'm in heaven!  I brought coffee for my co-workers and ordered a breakfast sandwhich. I was expecting a dinky, horrible Starbucks sandwhich. What I found was a fresh, delicious piece of heaven. Although the sandwhich did take about 20 minutes, it was worth the wait.
author: Enoch L.

description: Bought 7 sandwiches for my accounting meeting. What a way to keep the day going! Thank you Hector and Mina!
author: Tony L.

description: i find myself yearning for their breakfast sandwich even as i type this review.  it's such a simply constructed offering of eggs, cheese, arugula, tomato, onion, and lettuce, but the combination of these ingredients has a synergistic affect that makes every bite better than the last.  the price is steep, but they're in a prime location so i guess that justifies the cost?  in any case, this cafe is worth a visit.
author: Melissa Y.

description: I found the Beanstalk on Yelp, otherwise I wouldn't have known it was there. The store front is hard to notice, but since the reviews raved, I had to find it. I ordered the Veggie Shitake sandwich. It was amazing. Great service too. I'm going back tomorrow!
author: Sarah B.

description: I just wanted some good pour over to sip on while planning our trip to Napa, which was exactly what happened at Beanstalk. My boyfriend and I were on vacation in San Fran and sat in Beanstalk literally all day. Free wifi made it all possible. Mina, the owners wife told us the cafe just opened 5 weeks ago but it seemed like a neighborhood staple. She was so sweet and made us feel welcome even though we took up their only table for 4 hours. There are a few stools at a small bar too. We ate breakfast and lunch there. The Korean beef sandwich was perfect. Definitely need to go here if you are interested in some good coffee.
author: Anna B.

description: Amazing latte, and waffles made to order. It was the best breakfast I've had in a long time and the space was lovely, too. I will come back again!
author: Rya M.

description: He opened early for us, and made me a prefect espresso shot start the day. The latte I had to follow was also well constructed. I didn't get to every coffee shop in San Francisco, but this was definitely five star espresso.
author: Scott N.

description: Had the steak sandwich today. Sooooo good! One of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time. Lentil salad was very good as well. The staff is super friendly and the place is way small. Good place to grab some food and head to the park in front of Grace Cathedral or to Union Sq with.
author: Patrique R.

description: Was pretty disappointed in this place. They did not have their egg cups so I got a bagel and cc instead. The most mediocre bagel. Stale bread and poor quality cream cheese. The only other place in town with a worse bagel is probably 7/11. My fiancé got the breakfast bagel, it tasted like airplane food. Would have been better off with a mcmuffin from McDonald's. I give a star for its cute atmosphere but if you're looking for a nice quick breakfast in San Fran, I'd skip this place.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: What a neat little sandwich shop. Wife and I stumbled upon this place while taking a casual walk in the neighborhood. The spicy chicken sandwich and toasted cups were out of this world. Especially the sandwich, the spices and the marination of the chicken was just so perfect. You gotta try it!
author: Yao Z.

description: Great coffee and food. Try the breakfast sandwich if you're really hungry. Staff were nice enough without being crazy friendly. Not a lot of seating, so it would suit to grab what you're after and keep going.
author: David B.

description: Loved this little (and I mean little) coffee cafe! Delicious breakfast treats, fabulous coffee, and wonderful service. The Toast Cup is a quirky take on egg and toast and the Cragel is a mash-up of a croissant and a bagel--both were DELISH! The coffee was amazing! A great way to start off the morning--we smiled the rest of the morning as we walked the streets of San Francisco.
author: Lara D.

description: The spicy chicken sandwich is one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten! Perfectly spiced with fresh, crunchy cucumbers and red onions. Delicious!!
author: Bipin S.

description:
Yelpers have not steered me wrong on this anniversary vacation.  My wife and I were looking for a place close to our Union Square hotel to eat before heading to the Giants-Cardinals game.  With 4.5 stars and a lot of reviews, we gave Beanstalk Cafe a try.

After getting in late the night before, we had a late start to breakfast.  By the time we ate it was not quite breakfast, but not quite time for lunch either.  As we came to this quaint storefront, we were hoping either the single table for two or the three bench seats would come available, which they did fairly quickly.  My wife ordered a breakfast bagel sandwich with a chai latte while I ordered a Korean "Bul-gogi" sandwich and Ethopia Yergacheffe Blue Nile drip coffee.

First, the drinks.  My wife was impressed with her chai latte and pleasantly surprised that it came standard with almond milk.  The coffee was a tasty pour over that I was pleased with myself.  Now the food.  Both sandwiches were great and extremely filling.  The bulgogi was tender and tasty while the breakfast sandwich was filled with egg, bacon, lettuce, and tomato on an asiago cheese bagel.  The sandwiches were substantial, lasting over five hours before we could even think about having a ballpark snack.  Thanks to these sandwiches, it was only a two meal kind of day for us.
author: Jason H.

description: The best mocha I have ever had and their breakfast sandwich is amazeballz. Great customer service and you can also order your pickup on the Eat24 app. Very expedient service.
author: Nadeem Y.

description: Really sweet people that runs this. Will take a little bit of time to get items order but not unreasonable. Very small building I do not recommend staying there to eat or enjoy coffee.
author: Malinda M.

description:
Tried the Toast Cup - mine was pre-made and reheated in the oven. I'm OK with the pre-made part, but it wasn't heated through, so it was barely warm inside. Nice concept though - the bacon had no grease but added yummy taste and the egg yolk was flakey and not a hard dried mass.
The cappuccino - if you like Columbian roast, you might like this. I don't like Columbian roast. I also have a pet-peeve against places that ask if you want your Cappuccino dry or wet. It's a Cappuccino!
The staff are genuinely nice and aim for top notch service. It is a relatively new place, so they are still learning. When it gets busy, it might be a good idea for the cashier to stop taking orders and help make the food/drinks. I know - you want to collect $ so people do not walk away, but people also walk away when they see the crowd of people with no food/drink in hand.
author: MT Y.

description: Great sandwiches. No place to sit. For sure an order and go type of joint. Friendly people and reasonable prices.
author: Rosie N.

description: Every time I visit San Francisco, I treat myself to a vanilla latte from Beanstalk in the mornings.  This place draws a good crowd, so a bit more indoor seating would be great.  We just get coffee to go.  The breakfast foods look amazing, so will try those on my next visit.
author: Sher M.

description: Charming neighborhood spot offering espresso drinks and tasty bites. Just around the corner from the intercontinental.
author: Wallace C.

description: Staff was super friendly here. I ordered a hot chocolate which was tasty and a bacon egg and cheese on a bagel/croissant which left me underwhelmed. I had high hopes for this menu item and was super excited to order it, but the taste was quite bland and my bagel/croissant was slightly burnt. Surprisingly not much flavor.
author: Aub B.

description: Every morning. Best sandwiches ever haven't had one I haven't liked. By far everyone must try.  Can't go wrong with anything. Most amazing people love it
author: Robert B.

description: this place is only 2 min walk away from my hotel. I went there to grab something fresh before my 9am meeting. I ordered morning sandwich and drip coffee and neither disappointed me. All ingredients are fresh and well flavored.  I will definitely come back when I visit SF next time.
author: Alexia Z.

description: 1. Bulgogi sandwich was good a little too much meat for me though. It was my first time at this place and i looked up some spots on yelp and this popped out so i gave it a try. So i end up finding a hair in my sandwich luckily it was at the end of the sandwich so i was already full and end up throwing the rest away. Just when i threw the sandwich away they offer me a free mocha and i was like what!! sure why not. Overall place is not bad ill give it another chance.
author: THe real TrUth D.

description: Interesting little operation. Seating is limited. Coffee is average. Breakfast sandwich was good, but I've had better.
author: Erin U.

description: Awesome coffee, it was the first time I've ever had Contraband beans, and I've gotta say that I'm hooked. It has a smooth medium/light roast flavor with very little bitterness. The cafe space feels like a really comfortable nook that is the perfect size for a neighborhood cafe. I plan to go back and get their bulgogi sandwich.
author: Steve K.

description: I was near here for a workshop and was looking for a quiet place to be solitary during lunch. The sandwich I ordered was great--the bread was crispy and the ingredients were fresh. There isn't too much space to sit down. I honestly don't know how they get everything made in the tiny kitchen. I also ordered the mojito iced coffee--which was amazing. The mint complimented the slight sweetness perfectly. I recommend this place either for take out orders or a quick stop by on a busy day.
author: Anna W.

description: Meh.  Pretty disappointed by the Bugolgi sandwich which was rather dry and lacked any kind of flavor.  I think the meat could use some more seasoning and sauce.  Also they brew their milk tea straight from a tea packet and then simply added milk to it.
author: Lisa Z.

description: Was skeptical but hopeful about this place. Happy to report that I am a fan. Many overrated places around Union Square, based on tourist reviews. Great coffee (and I am very picky about my coffee) plus their signature egg-toast cup is a win. They have an eclectic offering of other items, but it seems some sell out (like their muffins). If you're out want to grab a bite but not lose time sitting down for breakfast this is a good stop and super reasonable prices. Four stars only because they sold out of muffins and poor seating plan for the space.
author: Jeremy B.

description: This is an excellent lunch location!  Loved the comittment I felt to excellence!  Fresh food and so tasty!  Loved it - turkey sandwich was superb!  The owner was waiting on customers and made for such a pleasant environment - treating all the customers with above and beyond service!!  Would go again and again.  The sandwich was so big, I saved 1/2 for later in the day.  Location is close to Union Square, not much seating inside, but there is some outside patio seating.  It was one of our best finds in SF.
author: Karen B.

description: Delicious coffee and wonderful experience!  The flat white was recommended and it was superb. We're visiting from out of town and a local recommend it, and it was a great find.
author: James F.

description: I'm a huge brewed coffee fan and what they serve is exceptional.  Breakfast cups are tasty and convenient for a quick breakfast fix. Look forward to testing out some more items on the menu next time I'm in SF.
author: Matthew F.

description: Mina is so wonderful! It is such a treat to go in and see her, let alone the great snacks and drinks. My day always seems a little bit better after a stop by Beanstalk Cafe :)
author: Michael F.

description: Deliciousspicy chicken salad Vietnamese style on fresh crispy French bread oven warmed... Delicious! Clean and friendly! Will definitely go back.
author: Lindsay H.

description:
A great place if you need a quick cup of coffee or sandwich to go.

Not a great place if you need to get work done. There's only one table and a couple bar stools. 

Wifi is available.
author: Jenny H.

description: Exceptional service, I don't think there's a single thing on the menu that isn't made right here in the store. The toast cups are delicious and pair perfectly with their curated selection of contraband coffee. Telling all my friends in Nob Hill!
author: Max B.

description:
This is a nice little local spot. Good coffee, clean, nice staff but the Yelp profile is not accurate. No outlets, not a good place for kids or groups. Not a place to get work done. This wouldn't be an issue other than the fact that two of us walked there to buy some food and coffee and get a little work done. Not cool, ended up walking over to Contraband. 

Great place but needs to be honest in the profile. That said it's still one of the best places for coffee and sandwiches in the neighborhood.
author: Jason B.

description: really solid ice brew - I had mine without milk or any syrup, best test of great coffee. Washed down a toasted cup of ham and egg nested in thin pastry. The perfect way to start a morning I'd imagine or an afternoon shopping break
author: Jiahui Y.

description: I stayed in Union Square during my trip to San Francisco and a friend introduced me to this cafe. Amazing choices and a lot of varieties. If I remember correctly, I believe the owner uses Contraband(?) Coffee! which is delicious and very satisfying. This place also has Moshi Cupcakes?! with different flavors. (They're right in front of the register)  IT WAS DELICIOUS!!!! MUST-TRY!
author: Christina C.

description: you know, those toast cups are great. as a business traveler, i'm always looking for a breakfast that's more satisfying than a kind bar or a handful of almonds and not as gut-punching or calorific as a bagel. this was a nice option. and the place is cute. and the coffee's decent. and the walk up the hill from my hotel made me feel like i EARNED the toast cup.
author: Lynn V.

description: Great food!  Great owner!  We had such a nice time talking to the owner while we are breakfast. Two of is had the breakfast sandwich...one had the turkey sandwich...and one had the spicy chicken...I can't say which was best. The bread was the perfect level of firmness...I just can't say enough about this place!
author: Matthew M.

description: Love this little coffee shop.  The service is good and the food is delicious.  They have a lot of options for breakfast and even lunch.  They are just on the pricier side.
author: Sasha R.

description: Reasonable prices. Best cappuccino ever. Delicious toast cup. Just the right size for a light but filling breakfast. The guys were also very courteous and friendly.
author: T N.

description: Pretty bad ass hot chocolate. The coffee and bagel were great but the breakfast cup was even better. Simple yet delicious.
author: Warren I.

description: Their toast cups are the most delicious breakfast i ever had! Just an amazing idea for a quick treat in the morning!
author: Alla S.

description: Came in at 8:10 on a Sunday morning, we had the sausage egg and cheese CREGEL (ahhhh-mazing::: a croissant in the shape of a bagel) it was great- the eggs were scrambled kinda of but remained together while eating it. Two bacon toast cups- also, awesome. It's toast formed into a cup with a strip of bacon, cheese, topped with an egg and baked! NOM. We also had the lemon coffee cake which was an excellent sweet treat to accompany the best coffee I've had since being in SF.
author: J P.

description: The toast cup is amazing. It's made with all organic ingredients: there's a lining of toast to create the cup, and a strip of bacon curled inside, and topped off with an egg, then baked. I could eat 4 of these! I just tried the 24 hour drip of iced coffee and it blew me away.
author: Adam S.

description: Nice new small business cafe.  They support other local small businesses like acme bread and contraband coffee they use organic ingredients too!!!  Super cool owners too!  I tried the bulgogi sandwich and it was super delish hot crispy and definitely worth it
author: Dubl A.

description: The coffee here is so fresh and so well prepared. I enjoyed every last drop. The place is tiny, but has a great feel and makes me want to stay. The people who work there were so nice and talked us through what would be best. This place is a must go-to! :)
author: Katherine J.

description: Our good friends took us here one weekend. Super cute shop and very yummy food! We were introduced to Mina, she is very sweet and inviting. We had the egg salad sandwich ,so good and unique, the breakfast bagel, very good, and piece of spice cake (may be seasonal) but it was super tasty. We also tried the coffee. We will definitely be back soon!
author: Sarah G.

description: This cute little coffee shop was right down the hill from the Fairmont where I was staying, so I took a little jaunt in the morning. They tempted me with their famous breakfast sandwich, which was delicious and so large I could only eat half. Very friendly service and excellent coffee!
author: Ruby R.

description: Excellent small cafe.  Great service, yummy breakfast options, and delicious coffee. So much better than Starbucks.
author: Jenny K.

description: Just a heads up that this place only has one table.  So not really a good place to have a meeting.  Otherwise good.
author: Sean E.

description: Great great breakfast spot! Thanks yelp for the recommendation. We went there two days in a row as the food quality was fantastic. We had the morning sandwich, toast cups and the cregle. All were very tasty! Highly recommend it!
author: Helen Y.

description: Stopped by twice now before work, never had contraband coffee before it's definitely up there with 4 barrel. Haven't tried the sandwiches yet but the toast cup is great! 8oz Americano and a toast cup and I'm ready for work.
author: Wei W.

description:
Im so happy to found this place 
I lov e bul go gi sandwich and coffe latte 
So enjoy
author: susan t.

description: Well worth the uphill walk from Parc 55. Beanstalk is a darling cafe with excellent coffee and VERY friendly staff.
author: Katy T.

description: I really enjoyed the bul-go-gi and spicy chicken sandwiches. The people working there are friendly. I wish there was more seating inside.
author: Julia N.

description: Went here with some out of town friends and had a blast. My chai tea was AMAZING. I'm addicted to them! Their quality of products for the low price are baffling but very awesome!
author: Mickella M.

description: Had the most delicious brownie ever (which is saying a lot because I love brownies) and a really good mocha. The space is small so don't go expecting somewhere to sit, but the food and drink is great.
author: Kaitlyn W.

description: Excellent coffee and espresso drinks. Limited selection for breakfast, but they have sandwiches for lunch and a little bit of seating inside with a great view.
author: Eric R.

description: I had a pour over coffee and it was wonderful.  It came in a glass jar!  The egg, bacon, invention was great although the egg was a little dry.  They have a combination bagel and croissant.  This was good except there was a boatload of butter.  You will enjoy!
author: M F.

description: Small menu and even smaller seating area. Extremely good food and coffee! Take out from here would be better than trying to find a seat.
author: Sarah S.

description: Most amazing coffee ever and the service is amazing!!! I would recommend this cafe to any local and anyone from out of town! The sandwiches are to die for. I will miss this place very munch and coffee won't be the same when I get back to Phoenix:(! Thanks again beanstalk!
author: Adam A.

description: The latte was great, as was the asiago bagel. They were out of toast cups, which bummed me out, but staff was really nice. Only seating for about 6 inside.
author: Aleem D.

description: Quaint place. Tasty coffee and excellent cragels (bagel and croissant mix). Wife and I were up in SF for a evening away and we stopped by here for a snack. Owner was a very nice talkative gentlemen. Will definitely go back before going home.
author: Ryan C.

description: Beanstalk Cafe is great and I would highly recommend it if you're in the area looking for breakfast or lunch. Their toast cup is amazing! Their food is consistently on point and you'll just fall in love with the staff here. It's been a great experience every time!
author: Thao N.

description:
Read about the bulgogi sandwich and decided to give it shot.  All the meats are cooked fresh every morning, plus the bread is really fresh and toastie with the sandwich.  The flavors pair well with the lightly spicing sauce.  Great service and great coffee that is hand crafted from Contraband so you know it's quality.  I'll be back to try other items on the menu.  

Environment is well lite and very welcoming.  Props to that for sure.
author: Jonathan W.

description: My favorite things here are the quinoa salad and veggie sandwich! Toast cup was ok. The bundt cakes were pretty good especially the salted caramel chocolate cake.
author: S C.

description: What a gem. We live 2 blocks away and will be coming here often. They've got a great selection of food (for a coffee place), and the interior is really well done. The staff is incredible - my wife is GF, which can often be a headache, but they were very creative in accommodating and extremely friendly. Well done.
author: Justin N.

description: Cute little place, they don't have a chai latte on the menu, but they made me one anyway :) very friendly staff
author: Holly K.

description: With all the touristy, mediocre diners around Union Square, my husband and I were looking for an inexpensive but quality, quick, and light breakfast before headed to the Warf for the afternoon. The Beanstalk Cafe hit the mark. Fantastic coffee! We also had a toast cup (very unique and tasty) and a cragel (buttery toasted cressant and plenty of cream cheese). The place is quaint with limited seating. We had planned on taking out coffee to-go but snagged the only table in the cafe. The trolly stop is near by and a few stops away from the turn around making it easier to board.
author: Rebecca P.

description: A 5 star rating with 75 reviews is hard to pull off, and this one is well deserved. The gal who opened this sandwich shop 5 months ago is a gem, from her winning smile to her customer friendliness to her cute doggie s&p shakers. The bulgogi sandwich is really among the best sandwiches I have ever eaten in my 50+ years. The idea of putting bulgogi on delicate crunchy crusted French bread (not sourdough, which was a very good decision, since the Baguette is a more delicate backdrop) with just the right amount of pickled cabbage is just fabulous. The spicy chicken is also great choice, though not quite in the same stratosphere as the bulgogi sandwich. Check it out, you will not be disappointed!
author: Monika S.

description: Great staff, amazing Bulgogi sandwich. Never had anything like that before - the bread was perfect, the sauce left a nice spicy aftertaste and the beef had perfect texture. Highly recommend this.
author: Ivan R.

description: Simple yet delicious! Very friendly, everything you look for in a good coffee shop. Breakfast sandwich out of this world!! Toast cups were really good too. Great find.
author: L E.

description:
The sandwich was ok, although the bread a bit too thick for the filling.

There's not enough seating here (although we were really lucky to get some) so I'd recommend for to-go orders. I've definitely had better sandwiches, but perhaps if you're craving a bulgogi sandwich, it's worth a try.
author: Victoria K.

description: Pretty cute little joint with decent coffee. A bit impatient service but I would go back again.
author: G F.

description: Perfect little coffee shop with wonderful breakfast and lunch sandwich selection. Don't forget the Iced Brew Mojito!
author: Todd W.

description: Cute little cafe. Great turkey pesto sandwich and breakfast sandwich. Iced coffee is good too. Limited seating. Perfect for grab and go or if you are alone or just two.
author: Phyllis A.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood! Friendly service and good coffee - Contraband Coffee at the moment. Loved the toast cup! I'll definitely come back to try the sandwiches.
author: Rachael B.

description: Love this small cafe. Great customer service which I expect bit not every place delivers. Must try the tofu vegetarian sandwich on their very fresh bread. In addition, the raspberry latte is amazing and delicious.
author: Bradley A.

description: My coffee was amazing! Thank you. I will also be coming back to try the delicious looking pastries salads and sandwiches you have. Even though you are busy I would much rather wait in your line than a Starbucks line ; )  any day.
author: LJ E.

description: Tried the bul-go-gi sandwich yesterday for late lunch. It was superb. Just the right combo of moist beef with tangy sweet sauce and crunchy bread. The reviews were spot on. My son scarfed down a piece of chocolate bundt cake drizzled w icing. The service was super friendly and fast. I'll definitely be back, that sandwich is worth going out of your way.
author: stephanie s.

description: Awesome sandwiches and very nice staff ! You have to try the spicy tofu or bulgo-gi beef sandwich!!
author: Manu R.

description: Fantastic sandwiches.  Lots of attention has been made on the bread to meat to veggie ratio.  Bread was also top notch with just the right amount of crunch!  I had the roast beef on this visit and was one of the best (freshest) I have had.  Coffee was good as well and perfectly prepared.
author: Derrick D.

description: First time in, had the bul-go-gi beef sandwich. Baguette was outstanding---crunchy exterior that gave way to supple crumb. Proportions of fillings were nearly perfect, excellent balance between meat, veggies, cheese, and dressing. Beef was tender and delightfully spicy. Highly recommended.
author: Robert K.

description: Great place to grab breakfast. I found Beanstalk using Yelp & I was not disappointed. The toasted cregal with cream cheese was amazing! Crispy croissant outside with a moist dense bagel inside. So Yummy!!   They had a friendly staff. I sat at the bar & enjoyed the funny salt & pepper shakers. The only negative was that there wasn't a bathroom.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Had a great time on my visit to San Francisco. Great food and quaint setting. I enjoyed talking with the owner and hearing how passionate he is about quality and customer service.  Checkout the approach they have to making iced coffee. Worth a stop if you are in the neighborhood and looking for a good sandwich.
author: Jackson B.

description: Definitely my favorite coffee shop in the neighborhood. I'd give them 5 stars for niceness alone.  But the coffee and food are pretty good too ;)
author: Arthur Y.

description: My first ever review in yelp. This place was so nice that it actually motivated me to create an account to write this review. Everything was just great, price, great quality food (must try the roast beef) and great service! After a miscommunication issue I received the wrong order. The nice woman working at this place just insisted to change it and that I should not pay the difference in price for the new order. Anyway, free wifi, clean, good food and great service, what else can you ask for.
author: Diego I.

description: Disappointed. The four guys working were very, very nice but I purchased a onion bagel with cream cheese; too hard and virtually little cream cheese for $3.00. For a 3 dollar bagel I expect more.
author: Stephen B.

description: Found this place my first day in SF.  Best turkey sandwich I have ever eaten - fresh and light.
author: Chris W.

description: Loved the Bulgogi sandwich. Good flavor and fresh ingredients. The Morning Breakfast sandwich is good also, but not quite as special as the Bulgogi sandwich. All of it delicious with the Contraband pour over coffee. The ajumma is super nice and cute too!
author: Dee C.

description: Great little cafe. had the Korean Tacos for lunch. Very good. Staff was very friendly and let me hang out while working on wifi for an hour. I'll definitely go back.
author: Zachary V.

description: I'm from out of town and found Beanstalk thru Yelp. I tried the Bulgogi sandwich last night and it was very good. This morning I tried their Americano and it was perfect. They use quality products and it shows.
author: Alex H.

description:
just enjoyed a bulgogi sandwich at the beanstalk.  

i like how the sandwich includes so much vegetable, combo'd with bulgogi and red bean paste, as well as the noticeably quality and freshly toasted bread. 

overall delicious food and an A+ customer service! 
will definitely be back soon. 

highly recommend the sandwich as well as the raspberry latte (best latte ever!)
author: Daniel K.

description: Tidy cafe full of tasty snacks and sandwiches, and great coffee, in a neighborhood that needs it!
author: Amy H.

description: The bulgogi sandwich is excellent and very filling. Go here when you are hungry. Nice and friendly staff.
author: Thomas H.

description: I live in the apartment building right next door. Absolutely love this place. The people who own this place are uber nice and have been very helpful. Really happy that I could just go downstairs and grab some breakfeast and coffee on a lazy weekend.
author: Guang H.

description: Excellent service and food to match.  Recommend the spicy chicken or the bulgolgi sandwich.
author: Shane A.

description: SF is full of amazing independent food shops/restaurants and Beanstalk Cafe definitely fits the bill.  We were up for a week long trip and this place was just a block away from the hotel we were staying at and we were SO thankful that it was!  The sandwiches were absolutely AMAZING!  The bread was soft on the inside yet crisp on the outside and the fillings were so fresh and full of flavor that it made me pick up all of the fall aways and eat them up!  The coffee was artfully crafted and equally amazing as well.  The staff is incredibly friendly and takes an immense amount of pride in their work.  I wish that there was a place exactly like this in San Diego!  We will definitely return on our next trip to SF.
author: Christiana V.

description: This place cares about how they make coffee.  Comparable to the quality you get at Philz.  Has a nice selection of coffee drinks and their food selection looked great, but I didn't try any of the foods.  Definitely coming back here.  4 stars only because it was my first visit, but the owners were nice and the coffee had a nice flavor.  Maybe after a few more visits, I'll bump it to five stars.
author: George C.

description: A great place to get breakfast to-go that taste's great. I got the Burl Kogi Sammy and a toast cup.
author: Talton F.

description: Breakfast sandwiches are amazing and the burl kogi sandwich is can't miss. The service is quick and friendly. Absolutely love this place
author: Trevor S.

description: Great little place with some fantastic sandwiches and good service. Slightly lacking in the seating but it adds to the charm. Everything is clean as a whistle and food seems really fresh. Loved our sandwiches.
author: Peter R.

description: Had the Korean BBQ sandwich (can't remember the actual name right now). It was really tasty and better than I was expecting. Service was great, and the two people working were friendly.
author: Nick J.

description: Great service, super friendly at this small street side cafe -- my cappachino & veggie sandwhich were terrific!
author: Rishi S.

description: Came here due to all the great reviews on yelp. It is very small with only one table and a bar with 3 stools and the breakfast menu is limited but the staff are super nice and the coffees very tasty! We had almond milk lattes and they were delicious. Overall, a great place for a quick simple breakfast for on-the-go but if you want more choice and to have a sit-down breakfast then visit one of the local cafes.
author: Joanne B.

description: Tried this spot based on fellow Yelpers recommendation. Had the bulgogi sandwich. Excellent! A little pricey for a sandwich, but it was fresh. Bread had a nice crunch on the outside while soft and warm on the inside.
author: Natalie B.

description: Very nice people working there, had the bulgugi sandwich and a mojito coffee drink. Both excellent worth the visit.
author: Peter G.

description: We love, love, love Beanstalk Cafe! We moved a few months ago from the East Coast and have been in serious 'breakfast sandwich withdrawal'. While Beanstalk doesn't serve a traditional NY breakfast sandwich on a hard roll, we are happily replacing our old standard with their Morning Breakfast sandwich. We've become weekend regulars there, ordering a couple sandwiches to go each Saturday (and sometimes Sunday) morning. The food is always fresh and hot; they actually get their bread from the Acme Market in the Ferry Building every morning...and you can tell. I haven't had the toast cups yet, although I've been meaning to. They get great reviews and sell out early, although I'm such a creature of habit I can't tear myself away from the breakfast sandwich anyway, even if that have toast cups left. The sandwich is a great combination of the traditional bacon, egg and cheese, with fresh lettuce, tomato and onion. The veggies are always fresh sliced and really flavorful. The cheese is always melted perfectly. They are efficient and really friendly....all reasons why we're now weekend regulars.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Beanstalk Cafe is really good! 
If you're around Union Square area, this is definitely a place to visit for a breakfast/lunch. The coffee is good and I highly recommend their Korean Sandwich.
The portions are good and staff is very friendly. They also have online ordering system, so if you're in a rush that may be an option for you. However, if you want to dine in, keep in mind that the place is not that big. There is a one "formal" table and several bar stools. So, there is a possibility of a little wait time. Outside of that, this place is great!  Definitely on one our mine favorite breakfast places.
author: Vlad P.

description: Found this amazing place on Yelp and couldnt have been happier.  We went for breakfast, had a great breakfast sandwich and fantastic cup of coffee, and took off.  Hours later as we're wandering the city wondering what we should have for lunch, we made the wise decision to head back to the beanstalk and have their incredible Korean Burl Kogi sandwich.  One of the best, if not THE best, thing we had the entire weekend in Frisco.  Do yourself a favor, and go here, and then go back again for lunch.
author: Tom E.

description: Hole in the wall. Unassuming staff. Indifferent coffee. Don't go here for the ambience. There is none
author: Healthy F.

description: I had a vegeterian sandwich and mocha coffee. It was a good breakfast. Very cozy place. Customer service was good too.
author: Denise A.

description: Amazing Korean style steak and my wife loved her lentil salad. Fresh, yummy and inexpensive.  Wish i had tried the ice brewed coffee.  Also got to meet the owner who is unashamed to share his Faith in Jesus Christ. Support this business...
author: Gary K.

description: This place is really nice. Small, light and you can tell the proprieter loves their work, it definitely shows. This is one business on Yelp that doesn't need to buy reviews.
author: Morgan B.

description: I was delighted to find this little cafe, so new and bustling with energy with speedy service! Though it is small, I was in a hurry for a workshop at the Foundation Center and the lines at Starbucks and 7-11 were horrid. As somone who was visiting San Francisco, I wasn't expecting to find such a place in the Financial District. I tried their Mexican Mocha with cardamom, that woke be up and kept me warm that chilly morning. I highly recommend this cafe, especially if your in a hurry and want some quirky twists on old school dishes and drinks. Will come back again on my next visit!
author: Nestor L.

description: Good sandwiches, great coffee.  There's very limited seating, but it makes up for it in charm.
author: Kevin C.

description: Wish I had tried the Burl Kogi sandwich.  I had a bagel that wasn't very good, but the coffee is situation is serious here and quality.
author: Alf O.

description: When I complained about the wait time, the owner offered me a free latte and apologized for the slow service, citing a new employee and one out sick as the reason. I totally understand when that happens, so changing my review!
author: Meghan G.

description: I live in the neighborhood and saw they were opening up. The coffee is delicious, and Mina was so sweet and gave me free mochi chocolate chip bread to try out. It is small but very cute and welcoming, and well-lit. I'll definitely be back to hang out and enjoy- it's nice to have something cute and neighborhood-y in the area!
author: Madeline A.

description: Really cute cafe featuring delicious sandwiches, good coffee and tasty desserts and juices.  I had the Korean bulgogi sandwich which is so delicious and fresh.  They use quality ingredients.  The coffee (Contraband) is excellent and I brought home a mochi cupcake for my son as a special treat.  He loved it!  Can't wait to come back and try the breakfast cups, which look really yummy.  This is a bright spot on the street and a wonderful addition to the neighborhood!
author: Betsy B.

description: Had a delicious Morning Breakfast Sandwich, clearly made with care down to the last piece of arugula. Takes a few minutes, but worth the wait. Had a vanilla soy latte which was half fluff, but otherwise great. Quaint little spot with only a few seats.
author: Bryce C.

description: I came in here looking for a quick breakfast after I found it highly reviewed on Yelp and because it was one block away from our hotel. I wanted to try the toast cup but I think they were out so we ordered a bagel with bacon, egg and cheese. I guess we were in a rush and not really thinking because being from NYC, this bagel of course was disappointing. Taste was ok and coffee was good. Cute little place.
author: Betsy L.

description: Was staying at the Mark Hopkins a few blocks away, stumbled upon this little cafe -- really didn't look like much, but wow, talk about "never judge a book by its cover" -- just fantastic sandwiches.  I had a pastrami and got a turkey sandwich for my wife.  They heat up the sandwiches.  Bread was fantastic.  Also tried the breakfast sandwiches -- best damn breakfast sandwich that I ever had -- fluffy eggs, tasty bacon.  Just awesome!
author: David H.

description: Staff is nice and welcoming. The atmosphere of the place is warm and inviting. Their menu selection is amazing. I tried a tofu veggie sandwich and it was the best I've ever had. It is a great place to get coffee and because of the lack of seating it is best to get food to go
author: Natali Q.

description: Good coffee, but limited to one size. Expensive, vibe and lack of space weaken review. They cater to tourists, as you'll see...
author: Cage G.

description: This cafe makes me want to move to SF.  I was staying at a hotel near here over Christmas and kinda went crazy over everything I ate/drink.  My BF and I ordered the toast cup with egg and sausage, vanilla lattes, and we each shared half of the Burl-Kogi and chicken sandwich that I can't remember the name of, and got a almond chocolate dessert-thingy for my sister.  Everything was soooooo good, my boyfriend even proclaimed that the latte might be the best one he's ever had, and that means A LOT.  The toast cup was adorable and made me want to eat a thousand of them.  But the sandwiches took the cake for being impressively delicious.  The ingredients were high quality, fresh, and carefully arranged, and I could go on forever about the bread... Even better is that the cafe is family owned by a really nice lady, so support small businesses!
author: Erin C.

description: Quick service and the sandwiches are amazing. So fresh and the bread is to die for! I ordered a tea and breakfast sandwich and the sandwich was so delicious that I ordered another to carry away for lunch! Love this place! What a find!
author: Becky R.

description: Cute little place. I asked the person behind the counter which was their most popular sandwich and she recommended the veggie one with tofu and also said that the Bulgogi sandwich was very popular too. I got the Bulgogi and took it home, it was way too salty I couldn't even finish it, dunno if I'll go back, maybe I should've tried the veggie one...
author: Tina B.

description: Very darling, quaint cafe.  Read about it in Yelp and we were so happy we stopped by.  Tried the egg cup-perfect portion and delicious.  As well as their egg sandwich which was excellent as well.  Very clean restaurant and the employees were so very cordial.
author: Patti A.
