description: Using purified water and contraband coffee bean! The coffee tastes solo good.
author: Hien P.

description: Good breakfast sandwich and coffee.   Pleasant vibe, thx
author: sd e.

description: Had soy latte and hungarian coffee cake.  Soy latte was better than average but not great.  Coffee cake was pretty good.  Not sure id come back for coffee though.  Owner is super nice
author: Konki T.

description: This place is wonderful!  I first noticed it because it's so light and adorable inside (a lot more aesthetically pleasing than most other coffee shops in the area) and have already been a few times since it opened.  Mina (sp?) remembered me after only one visit and even went out of her way to ask how my last experience had been and make sure I was happy since they had made a few changes.  I would have been happy with the food alone it's so good, but she and Hector are great and their thoughtful service makes it that much better.  The staff/owners are beyond kind, friendly and helpful and really care about making sure you have the best experience and get the perfect order. I've had a few of the sandwiches- breakfast, tofu and spicy chicken and all were absolutely delicious.  The ingredients are fresh, the flavors go really well together and the crispy baguettes make every sandwich that much better.  The shop is really clean and bright and the music very relaxing- overall just a really pleasant and enjoyable spot.  I would highly recommend stopping into Beanstalk for breakfast or lunch and can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.
author: Sarah W.

description: The service here is amazing! The owners are incredibly kind and thoughtful. They recommended a coffee blend for me and even steamed some cream so my coffee wouldn't become cold. The coffee is superb, and comes in cute mason jars. Although 4 or 5 dollars initially seems expensive for a cup of coffee, it is worth every penny at this place. To think that i could get a crappy latte at Starbucks for around the same price also puts things into perspective. This place is an easy walk from Union Square and is perfect for anyone needing a break from shopping. I will certainly be back here for the best coffee and service I've ever received at a cafe!
author: Tim C.

description: This is a tiny cafe with only a few seats. But what they offer are pretty special. Toast cup is a creative idea: two eggs wrapped by bacon in a cup. It is light, not a bit greasy, great for breakfast. I also had a cup of Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Blue Nile coffee: mild with nice aroma.
author: Emmy P.

description: Ordered the breakfast cups and the beef sandwich. Definitely don't see what's so special about the meat sandwich BUT I really enjoyed the uniqueness and taste of the breakfast cups. Yum!
author: Natalie M.

description: Great little (and I mean little) breakfast and coffee shop. Smells amazing while you walk in and wait. Only 1 table and wall table available for seating, so getting a take out order is preferable. Coffee was amazing.
author: C M.

description: Just got the Bul go gi and loved it!  I would definitely go back to try something else.
author: marc V.

description: I had the bulgogi sandwich. Very good, fresh ingredients, tasty and hot. Ordered online, arrived early so kicked back for a few minutes. Super friendly...will go back.
author: Tom R.

description: Stopped by for a quick, tasty, and filling lunch (bulgogi sandwich), but it was nothing spectacular.  FYI only a few seats inside.
author: G H.

description: I recently made a quick trip to SF for a conference and was looking for a good local eatery.  My hotel was located in Union Square and I didn't want to wander off too far since the conference was fairly early in the morning.  This place was amazing with the only draw back being the lack of seats.  I ended up purchasing the toast cup, breakfast sandwich, and their iced coffee. The sandwich was great.  The portion was enough and it included eggs, bacon, cheese, and arugula lettuce (which I love). The toast cups, though a novel idea, I did not find to be all that impressive.  I know a lot of reviews raved about it which was why I purchased it in the  first place.  It was literally just rolled up bread with cheese, egg, and bacon. The coffee was what impressed me the most.  I ended up going with the 12-14 hour brew.  Most coffees I've had, specifically the iced ones, retains an acid like taste.  However, this one was purely the simple taste of great coffee beans. I was really sad that we couldn't com back here for a 2nd run, but if I were to ever come back to SF in the near future, this would be one of the top food choices on my list.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Found this place when we were just walking by, had to stop in even though we were on our way to dinner.  Very cool vibe, and the owners are really, really nice, and very passionate about their coffee and their food.  We had an almond mochi pastry thingy that was super delicious, and the latte was excellent.  Nice machine, all manual, and the owner really seems to know his stuff.  Definitely will be back for a dry cap and looks like we need to try one of those bulgogi sandwiches, mmmm...
author: Jill L.

description: The owner is the most passionate business owner I have ever met. I was sick and she gave me some of her handmade ginseng lemon tea from Korea. Definitely coming back here.
author: Adam V.

description: Splendid, friendly service.  Both the bulgogi and turkey sandwiches were wonderful melanges of flavor.  The espresso was expertly pulled from decently flavored beans.  Overall, I couldn't be happier and plan to return soon.
author: Sean N.

description: My husband and I stayed in union square and saw that this place received a high rating on yelp so we decided to give it a try. I'm so glad we did! The first day we came, they ran out of toast cups so we ordered a breakfast and a "burl kogi" sandwich. Both were delicious! I wanted to try their toast cups so I had my husband go the next morning when they opened to make sure that we would get some before they ran out. They were wonderful as well! I also wanted a mocha latte with almond milk. Even though I told my husband multiple times that I wanted almond milk and even wrote my order on a piece of paper, he informed me that he actually forgot to say almond milk upon ordering my mocha latte. As he was telling me this story back at the hotel, my eyes began to widen and my nostrils were flaring. He continued and said that after the drink was made, he suddenly remembers that the mocha latte needed my requested almond milk. He felt bad that the drink was already made and was going to take it back to me without the almond milk, but the people who worked their insisted on making a new one, especially when they found out that it wasn't for him, but for me, his wife. I just want to say thank you to the workers at beanstalk cafe for going the extra mile and making sure that my husband wasn't going to return to the hotel dreading the consequences of his mistake, lol! Not that many places offer almond milk and being lactose intolerant, all I can usually get is soy; therefore, being able to have almond milk is a delight! I highly recommend this place for their amazing sandwiches and coffee. FYI.. It's kind of small so you may want to consider taking your order to go :)
author: Toothfairy P.

description: A very cool, yet very small coffee house/café.  We had a drip and a pour over. Both were very good.  The owner and staff/crew were all very friendly and helpful.  My girls had "old fashioned" hot chocolate...the real stuff.  They also had freshly made waffles...light and fluffy.  We also tried the egg, bacon and toast mini cup...very good.  Be aware that they only have one table and a counter/bar, but even if you group is too large to eat in..get it to go...it's very worth it.
author: Tom J.
